author: {'steamid': '76561198108144738', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1698263069}
review:
PRO: Stile, soundtrack, brillante, narrazione
CONTRO: Brevissimo, gameplay poco interessante
VOTO: 8/10

---------------------------------------------------------

Dopo averlo inizialmente quasi ignorato, Inscryption è stato uno dei giochi degli ultimi anni che più ho apprezzato. Per questo motivo sono subito finiti nel mio radar i due precedenti lavori di Daniel Mullins, The Hex e Pony Island, che ho deciso di recuperare partendo da quest'ultimo.

Lo stile è azzeccatissimo, perfetto per le tematiche affrontate dal gioco. Il risultato è un ambiente tridimensionale in cui però si visualizza quasi sempre solo uno schermo, quindi 2D. Una parte importante dell'atmosfera è definita inoltre alla colonna sonora e dai suoni, entrambi perfetti. 

C'è una grande eterogeneità di situazioni, sempre però contestualizzate, che mantiene alta l'attenzione. Questo è importante perchè il gameplay in senso stretto è davvero banale, per quanto in modo voluto, e finirebbe per annoiare in poco tempo. 

Pony Island dà però il meglio di sè nella trama e nelle interazioni metanarrative, che sono di fatto il fulcro del gioco. Ho notato come diversi tra i migliori di questi elementi siano poi confluiti nel più recente Inscryption, dimostrando un costante evolversi dell'autore.

In conclusione, è difficile raccontare senza spoiler un gioco così breve (si finisce in meno di 2 ore e mezza) e particolare. È una piccola perla indie, da godersi tutta d'un fiato in una sera e che difficilmente lascia indifferenti. 

VOTO: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198049774886', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1700160343}
review:
5/10 based on the first half of the game only.

Decent game as it is and if u like this kind of game be sure to check out There is No Game Wrong Dimension, which was why i went to Pony Island to try it out cause I loved Wrong Dimension.

I quit it half way in tho and im not going to finish it.
Why?
The jumpy pony lvls after 40 times gets a bit boring and anoying tbh.
Then u get to those god awful 'is exp over 99' puzzle screens and after the third of that kind of having to do simple but anoying math in the fast way it wants, is not for me and I have no intention of suffering through yet another one of that type.
Good weird and aiddferent game besides, but it has too many annoyances and boring parts u just want over and done with.

author: {'steamid': '76561199151270518', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1708801732}
review:
Pony Island - це невелика інді-гра, яка вражає своєю оригінальністю та непередбачуваністю. Гра поєднує в собі елементи платформера, головоломки та мета-гри, створюючи унікальний і незабутній досвід.

Однією з ключових особливостей Pony Island є її мета-грою в межах самої гри. Гравці знаходять себе в дивному світі, де гра сама по собі стає частиною сюжету, і гравець виявляється вовлеченим у глибокий і непередбачуваний загін.

Гра використовує елементи взаємодії з грою, розв'язання непередбачуваних головоломок та ведення діалогу зі своїми персонажами, що створює враження розкриття та дослідження невідомого.

Графіка та звуковий дизайн Pony Island виконані у стилі ретро, що додає грі чарівність та сприяє створенню неповторної атмосфери.

Pony Island - це непередбачуваний та креативний інді-проект, який може вразити своєю оригінальністю та вмінням перевертати стандартні концепції в геймінгу. Це відмінна вибірка для тих, хто шукає нещо нестандартне та незабутнє.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258523162', 'num_games_owned': 456, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1699325234}
review:
No puedes dejar de jugar, tienes amigos imaginarios, te dedicas a hacer trampa cuando te trancas, tus amigos reales te insultan, decides sacar de tu vida a demonios, al diablo, y finalmente te aburres de tonterías y también eliminas a jesus, sigues hackeando, juegas a catan, haces rol de poni con un extraño por un ticket, te peleas con tu amigo imaginario. Borras el juego.

Cualquier parecido con la realidad latina es pura coincidencia. 

100/100

review:

[spoiler]Este juego que aparenta ser de plataformas 2D y acaba rompiendo la 4º pared de formas bastante curiosas hablando de temas como la programación del mismo juego y con un final original como pocos, además de tener un misterio bien conllevado.
[/spoiler]
Entretenido como pocos además de no ser muy caro. El único problema podría ser su duración, pero aún así no supone nada grave sinceramente.

Nota final: 6.8 de 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198326173073', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1698912366}
review: 太精彩了！从此也算接触了meta游戏，从一个横轴act出发，衍生出中世纪灵魂救赎和现代黑客的故事，解谜和动作也都不是凑数的，act2 boss和上帝战，还有后面的程序谜题都颇有挑战，甚至还隐藏stg和fps游戏模式。层层递进的三幕精污演出也真的让人震撼！

author: {'steamid': '76561199354484827', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1698911522}

author: {'steamid': '76561198869805729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1698421993}
review: Jugué a Inscryption y lo he rejugado varias veces debido a lo que me gustó la experiencia, con Pony Island no será diferente. El juego se puede resumir en 3 componentes principales, Puzzles, el Dinosaurio de Google bajo efectos de dietilamida de ácido lisérgico y romper la cuarta pared a lo bestia. Si bien es corto, ofrece la esencia y originalidad a la que Mullins nos tiene acostumbrados.

review: I played this game a while back and forgot to review it. It has overwhelmingly positive reviews on Steam at this time for some reason and I have friends that love it. I do like my puzzle games, but this game strikes me as an edgelord's attempt at a 4th wall-breaking puzzle game, which I found to be a boring and mindless experience. I wasn't too upset because it was so cheap, but anyway, It didn't click for me in any way possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561199088119668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1699005794}
review:
Fresco fresco di platinaggio farò il possibile per recensirvi al meglio questo capolavoro, senza spoiler.

Ho acquistato il prodotto per pochi centesimi e ne sono rimasto piacevolmente sorpreso, sia per la varietà dei livelli - nonostante la chiara brevità - che per la profondità della trama.

Eternamente intrappolati in un gioco dalla facciata idilliaca ma di fatto demoniaco, dovremo destreggiarci in innumerevoli sfide scoprendo a poco a poco la nostra storia.

Unico difetto che posso trovare a Pony Island è la scarsa durata, controbilanciata però dai vari obiettivi difficilmente ottenibili senza guide apposite.

Estremamente consigliato: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198101138588', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1698690412}
review:
Необычная концепция, но довольно скучный гемплей.

Честно говоря, в 2023 году эта игра уже не сильно впечатляет даже своей идей, но в ней все же есть как минимум один ВАУ момент, ради которого собственно и стоило играть. В остальном это примитивный платформер в перемешку с однообразными, простыми головоломками, но слава богу всё этим не ограничивается, и когда игра не заставляет тебя прыгать через забор и двигать стрелочки, она все же умеет развлечь и даже удивить, жаль, что большая ее часть все же вызывает только скуку. Но самый большой минус Pony Island - это звук, он на столько невыносимо плох, что эта первая игра в моей жизни, где я его почти полностью отключил, и все равно голова прямо гудит от него, давящий гул, мерзкий шум всплывающего текста, неприятная мелодия, полагаю, все это намерено сделано максимально невыносимо, вот только я не понимаю, зачем так издеваться над игроками. 

6.66 из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198844699358', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1698670660}
review:
真的让人十分惊艳，玩一个下午没什么毛病，最好不要去看攻略（当然，游戏实况安利过来的当我没说）。
meta游戏玩的不多，这么震撼的还是第一次，上次玩史丹利的寓言的时候手贱去看了攻略导致我新鲜感几乎全无，这次打折本体加音乐包4.8元直接拿下，还是十分推荐入手的，至于纯英语的问题，这游戏要求的英语水平只要高中水平就可以看个90%左右了，大体意思还是懂得，也可以作为一个学英语的游戏来玩

author: {'steamid': '76561198119606763', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1698619906}
review:
While a fairly short game at first glance, Pony Island is a fun experience from beginning to end. From the simple-yet-fun gameplay to the enigmatic shroud the game hides behind, there's a lot to uncover within the mysteries of the game. I'm by no means a professional when it comes to uncovering secrets, but even so, I loved seeing every little detail fall into place over the time I've played it.

This was the first game I played in the Mullins Trilogy, and I can't wait to see how the other two play out!

Very good game. I was surprised to get so much fun from such a simple concept. Feels very similar to "there's no game" but with the opposite concept. 

Also SPOILER I wonder if there's a way to let devil know that I liked his game, in the credits to devil island he mentioned that it was all he ever wanted and he wants it more than souls - and since it is true i wonder if there's some sorta "secret ending", a shame I had to uninstall it and i will never know :(

review:
maldita sea, quiero cogerme al pony, no puedo soportarlo más, cada vez que lo veo tengo una erección masiva en la silla de mi computadora.

ese pelaje suave hace que mi verga vuelva a tener vida

he visto literalmente hasta los videos de pony island, mis sueños no son nada más que tener sexo constante con el potro, estoy cansado de despertarme cada mañana con 8 charcos de semen en mis boxers sabiendo que todos esos charcos debieron ser eyaculados en el cuerpo del pony.

mierda, mi profesor del colegio me vio eyaculando sobre mi celular mientra veía vídeos de pony island, habia hecho dibujos estilo furry del pony para que se vea mas humano.

el profesor no me ha dicho una palabra en 3 horas y estoy preocupado de que me vaya a echar del colegio, es posible que no vuelva a estudiar nunca mas y ni hablemos de ponerla

review: It's a cool concept, very reminiscent of those haunted game creepypastas... but the gameplay isn't the best. Specifically the code puzzles. The sections where you're running to the goal and avoiding obstacles? Decent, especially when you get the laser. But the code puzzles are so boring and tedious... while they're creative, they're just straight up not fun. It doesn't help that you'll be encountering them frequently. I might come back to this game in the future though, as I still think the idea is pretty neat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048745851', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1629784221}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G0oCgV4qGDs&t=67s
[h1][i][b]Słowo na niedzielę i od razu zaznaczę.
Dzień przed tą publikacją, miałem "przyjemność" uczestniczyć w kościelno-rodzinnej uroczystości, tzn. – chrzcinach.
Pomijając kwestie pengi, późną godzinę startu uroczystości, ponad 2h drogi w jedną stronę po w 90% nieoświetlonych, polskich ( wcale nie dziurawych ) drogach i "fantastycznej" pogodzie, to wszystko ok. W końcu czego się nie robi dla family? 
Wobec tego, oraz jako, że DZIŚ JEST TEN DZIEŃ, a na domiar kuriozum mamy wybory do Sejmu i Senatu jaśnie oświeconej Rzeczypospolitej ( znów wybór mniejszego zła w kraju z dykty i kartonu ) to sprawia, że poziom mood’u niedzielno-jesiennego wy*ebał już poza skalę. Jeśli więc nie masz ochoty czytać tego długiego lania wody, to na pytanie; Czy warto zagrać w Pony Island? Otóż - Nie wiem. 
Owa gra jest specyficzna pod wieloma względami, a o gustach się nie dyskutuje. Chciałbym mimo wszystko zachęcić Cię do lektury jak i do zagrania w ten tytuł, jednak nie uprzedzajmy faktów.[/b][/i][/h1]

[h1][i]Witaj, droga/drogi Czytelniczko/Czytelniku w szyderczej recenzji gry Pony Island, która niecnie wkracza na tło religijnych, niedzielnych obrzędów i życia PRAWDZIWEGO POLAKA KATOLIKA. Iście moralnego drogowskazu, który każdego, siódmego dnia tygodnia, najpierw udając świętoszka przyjmuje komunię na mszy, by później bezrefleksyjnie sarkać na sąsiadów, krewnych, znajomych z pracy, polityków, inne nacje, rasy, orientacje etc. Polaka nieraz żyjącego w brodziku intelektualnym, który tyle wie, ile zje ( i wychla ). 
I właśnie w tym klimacie przychodzi mi recenzować Pony Island.
Gry, która symbolicznie stawia nas w samym jądrze cebulowego piekła Polandii, gdzie walka o duszę wcale nie jest mniej ekscytująca niż wybory na polskiej scenie politycznej. Spójrzmy jednakże na to wszystko z przymrużeniem oka i pewnym dystansem, bo w końcu, to tylko gra. Nieprawdaż?
Enjoy.[/i][/h1]

[b]Czym jest Pony Island?[/b]
Pony Island to intrygujące i unikalne doświadczenie, które obchodzi łukiem tradycyjne konwencje gier komputerowych. Gra została wydana w 2016 roku, stworzona przez Daniela Mullinsa i opublikowana pod tą samą nazwą. To jednak nie odpowiada na pytanie – Czym jest Pony Island?
Tak naprawdę, nie łatwo jest objąć w jakiekolwiek ramy gatunkowe tego tytułu.
Warto zaznaczyć, że Pony Island to według Steama i tu cytuję tagi; „Łamigłówki – Niezależne - Horror psychologiczny". Uważam jednak, iż ten indyk w mojej opinii przypomina bardziej interaktywną grę logiczno-narracyjną z elementami zręcznościowymi niż tradycyjny tytuł growy, gdzie nie ruszamy ‘status quo’ zasad charakterystycznych dla danych gatunków. I choć gra kipi psychodelą i czasem dość niepokojącą atmosferą rodem z mitycznego Polybiusa, to horrorem bym jej nie nazwał.

[b]Piekielnie nurtujące.[/b]
Pony Island to jedna z tych gier, które w jednym momencie sprawą, że zastanawiasz się, co właściwie się dzieje, a w następnym moment wciągają Cię w surrealistyczną opowieść, która łamie wszelkie konwencje i tzw. 4-tą ścianę. To gra, która nie boi się kwestionować Twoich przekonań na temat tego, co gra komputerowa może osiągnąć i jak powinna działać. Choć zdarzają się udane próby eksperymentowania w niektórych grach ( przede wszystkim niezależnych ) jak np. w Undertale czy serii Disagea, to Pony Island wyróżnia się, ponieważ to bardzo, bardzo, bardzo samoświadomy tytuł.

[b]Sick Arcade Good Sh*t.[/b]
Wizualnie Pony Island przyjmuje stylizację retro, oprawa piksel-art jest wyjątkowo spójna a dźwięki to balsam dla uszu wielbicieli klimatów surowego vitage na modłę arcad’owych tytułów rodem z lat 80s/90s co nadaje grze charakterystycznego sznytu, topornej i niedoskonałej w piękny tego słowa znaczeniu. To minimalistyczne podejście do audio-wizauliów w punkt oddaje tę zaskakującą atmosferę gry, która bez tego nie byłaby taka sama.

[b]Poziom piekła ‘kucowego’.[/b]
Fabuła może nie być przełomowa i może nie wywiera efektu opadnięcia szczęki, ale to, jak została przedstawiona, to absolutny majstersztyk pod kątem zabawy oczekiwaniami gracza. Na początku znajdujesz się przed pozornie zwykłym automatem do gry, który prezentuje tytułowe Pony Island jako uroczy endless runner, gdzie skaczesz nad przeszkodami i dążysz do flagi na końcu poziomu. Jednak to tylko iluzja. 
Już wkrótce odkrywasz, że jesteś uwięziona/uwieziony w tej mrocznej i zakręconej grze, stworzonej przez samego Lucyfera w celu zdobycia Twojej duszy. Musisz rozwiązywać liczne zagadki i próbować zrekonstruować grę od środka, dosłownie popsuć ją, aby zapobiec szatanowi w zabraniu tego, co Twoje oraz aby ocalić jeszcze jedną duszyczkę ( jednak bez spoilerów ).
Daniel Mullins, samotny twórca gier, opowiada hermetyczną historię w sposób, który nadaje psychodeliczny kontekst całości i do złudzenie realne obcowanie z grą, która zdaje sobie sprawę, że ją przechodzisz. Każdy moment jest celnie zaakcentowany, to pełna nieprzewidywalnych zmiennych podróż przez program którego developerem jest sam szatan. Mullins w ten sposób bawi się oczekiwaniami co do gameplay’u i śmiało odrzuca utarte schematy, które inne gry traktują jako normę.
Gra jest pełna czarnego, absurdalnego nieraz humoru i sprytnie ukrytych dowcipów jak i chwil, które sprawią, że uśmiechniesz się nieraz ze zdziwieniem ( no ale jak to?! ). Jednak warto zaznaczyć, że Pony Island najlepiej doświadczyć, wchodząc do niej z jak najmniejszą ilością wcześniejszej wiedzy na temat jej mechanik i intryg. To jak magiczna iluzja, która traci na mocy, jeśli poznasz jej tajemnice ( od kuchni ). Dlatego tylko ogólnikowo opiszę substancję rozgrywki tzw. "mięsko”.

[b]5% mięska.[/b]
Jeśli zdecydujesz się dowiedzieć więcej o tym, czym naprawdę jest Pony Island, odkryjesz, że to nie tylko gra logiczna ukryta w segmentach gdzie, sterując kucykowym hipkiem przeskakujesz płotki i ziejesz laserami z zer i jedynek, by zrobić ziaziu wszelkiego rodzaju pixel-demonom. Doświadczysz również serii zagadek, które często wymykają się uczciwym zasadom, bo szatan nie śpi i za wszelką cenę będzie starał się sabotować Twoje wysiłki. Musisz wtem wykazać się sprytem i nietuzinkowym podejściem do rozwiązywania problemów, jakbyś chciała/chciał ‘zekspolitować’ lub ‘zglitchować’ daną sekwencję, by przechytrzyć demonicznego kawalarza. Resztę, czyli kolejne 95% mięska, odkryjesz sama/sam, a uwierz że warto. ;)

[b]Błędny, czerwonowłosy władca ciemności.[/b]
Szatański programista, który odgrywa kluczową rolę jako główny antagonista, dodaje wyjątkowego klimatu opowieści. Jego diabelski dialog jest wybornie napisany i doskonale wpasowuje się w całą, psychotyczną narrację i wprost zwraca się on do Ciebie. Tym samym jego nieudolność w próbach przeszkodzenia Tobie ( czyli graczu ) wywołuje czysto komiczne odczucia. Z czasem w naszej głowie nawet zaczynamy traktować 'Lucka' wprost protekcjonalnie z godnym politowaniem. Zwłaszcza gdy ( SPOILER ALERT ! ) [spoiler] odkryjesz solucję przejścia wszystkich wyzwań gry, zawartą w pliku tekstowym na pulpicie automatu Pony Island.[/spoiler]

[b]Diabeł tkwi w szczegółach.[/b]
Na koniec można by zadać kolejne pytanie, obok tego czy warto zagrać w Pony Island. 
Dlaczego nie ma więcej tytułów, które tak śmiało eksperymentowałyby z naszymi oczekiwaniami wobec gier wideo? Lata doświadczenia nauczyły nas myślenia w określony sposób, ale gry, takie jak Pony Island, przypominają nam, że wirtualna rozrywka potrafi zaskakiwać, robić rzeczy, których nie zrobią filmy, książki czy seriale.
Czy więc warto? To zależy tylko i wyłącznie od Ciebie.
I niechętnie wracając do przeintelektualizowanego wstępu, nie dodam nic więcej na owy temat, bo nie chcę znowu popadać w cringe i guilty pleasure, gdy w tle kolejne wybory na szaleńców, bigotów, nieudaczników i karierowiczów o mentalności Dyzmów jakich opisywał Dołęga Mostowicz.
Oto Polska właśnie w III RP 2023.

[h1][b]Dziękuję Ci za lekturę jak i żegnam się w atmosferze skandalu bo stygnie mi pomidorowa z kluskami.
To był mob z redakcji Aga i my.:)[/b][/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198053284337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1539237506}
review:
[h1]The Gameplay: [/h1]
Very fun puzzle game where you have to think on your feet. It is fun and intuitive, may remind you of the Stanly Parable in that you have a lot of agency in how the game progresses.

[h1]The Story:[/h1]
I mean, there is something, but I am not sure I would constitute it as a story more so than a setting with some consequences. None the less, it is an entertaining setting.

[h1]The Visuals:[/h1]
This is a strength of the game, while not using realistic graphics or anything, it manages to keep a certain style and is not afraid to explore outside of that.

[h1]The Sound:[/h1]
The music is one of it's strong points using the 8-16 bit music to great effect.


[h1]The Experience:[/h1]
Its hard to describe the experience without spoiling how the game works. It is very good and requires you to think outside the box, to think meta. Its short, but very sweet and definitely worth its price. Big recommended on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152720098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1710996429}
review:
[h1] หนึ่งในตัวอย่างของคำว่า 'อย่าให้เกมมันเล่นคุณ' [/h1]

Pony Island เป็นเกมสั้นที่ทำเราหลอนโดยไม่มี Jump Scare เสียงดังๆ ให้หัวใจวายแบบเกมผีสูตรสำเร็จรูป แถมด้วยพัซเซิลชวนปวดหัวในบางช็อต

ความประทับใจคือเรื่องของการ Break the 4th Wall ผสมกับความแกงผู้เล่นแบบเนียนๆ (แต่ก็เนียนเกินจนกลัว...)

ใครที่กำลังตามหาเกมอินดี้สั้นๆ แต่มีคุณภาพคับแก้ว เกมนี้อาจเป็นหนึ่งในตัวเลือกของคุณ

author: {'steamid': '76561199229029019', 'num_games_owned': 4540, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 698, 'last_played': 1697042523}
review:
Pony Island is a devilishly charming video game that puts a refreshing spin on the videogame possessed-by-the-devil trope. While the gameplay may lack depth, it compensates with its unique aesthetic, tantalizing secrets, and delightfully offbeat tone. All you have to do is interact with shady interfaces, play silly java-style games and solve easy puzzles.

The game purposefully leaves many mysteries unsolved, inviting fans to speculate and connect the dots themselves. It's a very short adventure, lacking in replayability, but completionists will be rewarded handsomely.

Overall, Pony Island offers a pleasant ride filled with its own distinct flavor, even if it doesn't delve too deeply.

review: Ótimo jogo. Parece uma coisa e vira outra completamente diferente, quando você se acostuma vira outro jogo, é incrível. Por mais que algumas coisas se repitam, o jogo não se torna cansativo ou repetitivo e tem tantas mudanças nele que deixa tudo mais incrível. Ele tem uma dificuldade boa, um ritmo bom, uma história boa, um mistério interessante, uma música ótima e tantas mudanças que deixam cada vez melhor. Com certeza o segundo melhor jogo do desenvolvedor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049603956', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1695674849}
review:
[h1]Коснись лицом монитора, чтоб продать душу[/h1]
Первая игра от студии Daniel Mullins Games, состоящей из одного человека. Но уже в ней прослеживается авторский почерк. Игра так же, как и The Hex, играет с игроком.

Игровой процесс можно поделить на три части: платформер, где мы за пони преодолеваем препятствия; головоломка, где мы взламываем игру; и... эмм... само блуждание по игре. Последнее, думаю, можно считать основным, тк. тут игра максимально разнообразна и каждый раз старается чем-то удивить.

По сюжету мы застреваем в аркадном игровом автомате, в котором завелись разного рода демоны. Они частично изменяют игру для своих нужд, чтоб заточить в неё как можно больше душ, ну а наша задача состоит в том, чтоб выбраться из автомата.

Игра короткая, по своему интересная, с несколькими "Вау!" моментами. Рекомендую!

author: {'steamid': '76561199095702004', 'num_games_owned': 1593, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1695458713}
review:
特地搜了一下什么是meta游戏。
META游戏原来就是打破了玩家和游戏角色之间的次元壁啊
游戏角色知道玩家的存在并与玩家对话。
想法很普通，在电影，动漫，小说里面类似的概念早就有了，将其迁移到游戏中进行试验，我不喜欢。
游戏是注重交互体验的艺术，只能浅层次地表达某些思想，我不喜欢将想法放在第一位的任何游戏。

review: 构思奇巧，可谓小身材大智慧。简单的操作设定并不妨碍解密过程带给玩家的抓马体验。主线剧情不长，难点在于成就收集，小马岛看似糖衣无害，实则又暗藏玄机刀刀致命。累死累活通关，以为结局揭晓谜底，翻开攻略才知还有局中局。无汉化是遗憾，外语底子不错的朋友可以尝试，毕竟有些解密关键真的需要理解含义与语境。

author: {'steamid': '76561199208790212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1694655310}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985225059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1694649023}
review:
Very interesting and innovative game. 

Whereas I can’t say that I had fun playing it (I really didn’t) I can’t help but appreciate the thoughts that went into it. 
Some of its puzzle/investigative elements are quite great, but then it throws in a lot of, at best, boring and tedious levels (the Pony levels), which, at worst – and towards the end of the game, are so frustrating to play that I came close to quitting the game for good. Especially because it doesn’t just require learning the mechanics and using them well, but also to be lucky (as they are randomly generated, meaning sometimes you get an easy run and sometimes you have to go through 5 relatively unfair attempts before getting one that feels fair. 

And can I recommend it? Not sure. I did not enjoy it, but I just feel like I have to praise the ingenuity whether I found it entertaining or not. 

So yeah, didn’t love it, but I don’t hate it and it is conceptually cool. Very cool.

[b]AVALIAÇÃO DE "Pony Island" 🐴[/b]

1. AVALIAÇÃO GERAL:
   [✅] 7 Pôneis invadiram meu cérebro e estão fazendo uma festa
   [✅] 6 Meus vizinhos agora acreditam que tenho um harém de pôneis
   [🔲] 5 Vida pônei é a melhor vida
   [🔲] 4 Quase me transformei em um pônei-
   [🔲] 3 Pôneis mágicos e sorridentes!
   [🔲] 2 Pôneis... Por que tão sérios?
   [🔲] 1 Pôneis me perseguem em pesadelos..
  
2. GRÁFICOS E ESTILO ARTÍSTICO:
   [🔲] Igual a uma tela de pintura roubada...
   [🔲] Pixelizado ao estilo Atari 2600.
   [🔲] Aceitável, desde que você use óculos escuros.
   [🔲] Bom, mas meu pônei ainda parece um emoji..
   [🔲] Ótimo, quase me fez pensar que pôneis são reais >:^
   [🔲] Melhor que a Mona Lisa.
   [🔲] Cada pixel é uma obra-prima de arte!
   [✅] Cada frame foi desenhado por um pônei mágico, melhor que qualquer museu 🦄✨

3. JOGABILIDADE E CONTROLE:
   [✅] Envolvente (Controle um pônei com uma mão e faça um café com a outra)
   [🔲] Muito Boa (Os pôneis respondem a cada pensamento)
   [🔲] Satisfatória (Os pôneis vão para onde você manda)
   [♾️​​] [strike]Um Pouco Desafiadora[/strike] (Às vezes os pôneis têm vontade própria)
   [🔲] Pôneis, não me ignorem! (Os controles desapareceram)
   [🔲] Necessário dois dedos para jogar.

4. NARRATIVA E HISTÓRIA:
   [​🅰️​] Épica (Uma lenda de pôneis que será contada por séculos!! [spoiler]passados...[/spoiler])
   [​🅰️​] Boa (Pôneis com objetivos, o que mais você quer?)
   [​🅰️​] Compreensível (Pôneis fazem coisas, acho)
   [​🅰️​] Um Pouco Confusa (Pôneis, eu não entendi...)
   [​🅰️​] Pôneis falantes? (Estou perdido)
   [🅰️​] Atividade Paranormal.. (Trama infernal... não seria perdoado nem pelo asmodeus.. ERES TU SATÃ?)

5. TRILHA SONORA E FEITO:
   [🔲] Beep (Sons que me fizeram questionar minha sanidade)
   [🔲] É melhor jogar no mudo (Pôneis em silêncio, a paz reina)
   [🔲] Aceitável (Trilha sonora que não ofende, mas não surpreende)
   [🔲] Muito bom (Sons que fizeram meu coração pônei bater mais forte)
   [✅] Sons mágicos que ecoam nos corações dos pôneis (A trilha sonora transformou até os pôneis em dançarinos de discoteca 🌈🎶)

6. DIFICULDADE E DESAFIO:
   [🔲] Você escolhe a dificuldade.
   [🔲] Até seu pônei consegue...
   [🔲] Até uma batata de controle zerar isso.
   [🔲] Mais fácil que produzir CO2. (Respirar)
   [✅] Desafia sua mente e distorce a realidade 👁️🌀

7. REQUISITOS:
   [🔲] Mais leve do que uma lâmpada desligada.
   [🔲] Calculadora com 1 pilha faz mais do que o suficiente.
   [✅] Um PC com um ventilador é o mínimo necessário.
   [🔲] PC modesto para os não tão modestos..
   [🔲] PC gamer para os pôneis hardcore.
   [🔲] Supercomputador pônei para os mestres do jogo.
   [🔲] 4xRTX3090TI ligadas numa usina nuclear.

8. COMPLEXIDADE:
   [🔲] Simples como contar pôneis para dormir
   [🔲] Fácil de entender, até um pônei de pelúcia pode jogar 
   [🔲] Fácil de aprender, mas difícil de ser um mestre pônei
   [🔲] Desafia sua mente como um quebra-cabeça diabólico
   [✅] Entra como crente e sai macumbeiro
   [✅] Você precisa de um Ph.D. em enigmas para decifrar e uma marreta para quebrar a quarta parede 🧩🚪

9. TEMPO DE JOGO:
   [✅] Ideal para uma música rápida 🎵
   [🔲] 6 horas (Um compromisso meio longo)
   [🔲] 12 horas (Um dia de pôneis em tempo integral)
   [🔲] 24 horas (Você vai precisar de muita comida de pônei)
   [🔲] 48 horas (Pôneis por dois dias inteiros, sem parar)
   [🔲] 100 horas+ (F Vida Social)
   [🔲] Você começa, seu neto termina.

10. BUGS:
    [✅] Nunca vi nenhum 🐞
    [🔲] Pequenos bugs
    [🔲] Pode ficar irritante
    [🔲] Pode estragar a gameplay
    [🔲] Parece o ENIAC
    [🔲] 2077 CyberBugs
    [🔲] Criaram o próprio jogo.

11. PÚBLICO:
    [🔲] Crianças.
    [✅] Adolescentes.
    [✅] Adultos.
    [✅] Fãs de pôneis e magia 🦄✨[spoiler]e SATÃ[/spoiler]
 
12. COMPENSA COMPRAR?
    [🔲] IT'S FREE
    [🔲] Preço justo.
    [🔲] Compre se tiver dinheiro sobrando.
    [✅] Uma jornada mágica que vale cada centavo 💰🔮
    [🔲] Caro demais, não recomendo...
    [🔲] Mais fácil você queimar seu dinheiro!

author: {'steamid': '76561198095379600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1693856463}
review:
I regret not playing this game earlier, because in 2023 the novelty of a postmodern indie game that attempts to mess with the player's head by questioning what "is" and "isn't" part of the game... kind of wore off now. Carried on the wings of Undertale's popularity, we really got it good now, huh?

But to be fair, Pony Island holds its own well in this regard. Mostly because it accepts still being a video game after all, and isn't afraid of walking a fine line between "sillly" and "scary". I mean, the very premise... look, let's put it this way. In this game you face Satan himself, who in this reality is a crappy game developer trying to gather souls through microtransactions and shareware in his terrible products. I love the concept, just imagining the lord of hell hastily adjusting his hackjob code in the middle of you playing - he's even being really polite about it! Okay, most of the time. At the end of the day, you still have to break everything, there is no other route around it (and that's fine).

Because of the premise, gameplay isn't really all that sophisticated, but it's surprisingly good. Navigating the system is kind of like a point n click game, you're rewarded for your keen eye as you look for details and pay attention to chat dialogue. The "actual" Pony Island game is an endless runner of sorts, just very simple. But I think the best part are the puzzle segments with coding (and, uh, butterflies). Starts very basic, but quickly builds up into REALLY testing your brain. That last puzzle is an absolute monster, and even after beating it twice I still can't tell you how I did it, and looking up videos online of others trying to provide a solution showed to me that I'm not alone in that impression.

Visuals are easy to trivialize as run of the mill faux-retro pixel art, but if you soldier on and pass at least the first act, it's easy to see that that's not really the case - it's a conscious direction to convey the setting. Certain scenes clearly show that yes, the creator(s?) of the game CAN do good graphics, it's just that Lucifer isn't too hot at it. Music, however, though often absent in favor of an ominous humming of the game cabinet, is pretty solid all over. It's comforting to know that at the very least, the devil is decent at making chiptunes (unless they're stolen lol).

Lastly, I really like how many secrets are hidden here, despite Pony Island's short length. There's an additional thing to do at just about every corner, and a lot of these serve to expand on the plot in a cool way (or make a reference to the opening of Malcolm in the Middle, which is cool too I guess). However, just like Undertale, this game also will make you question if 100%ing the game is the right thing to do... but fortunately isn't as harsh and unforgiving about it. Again, at the end of the day it's still a game, so I actually like this approach better (and yes I did 100% it). Though maybe because of its short length, I found it hard to care about the characters.

Still, it was a fun experience and even though indie gaming has seen a lot of similar stuff in this age, I nonetheless recommend you try it too. Pony Island still manages to remain quite unique.

author: {'steamid': '76561198450345569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 317, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1693511974}
review:
i review games on steam after i 100% complete them! check out my reviews to see all the games i have completed!

pony island is best described as a point-and-click adventure, and was developed and published by daniel mullins. it's his first game published to steam, and he went on to make the hex (2018) and inscryption (2021). pony island was released in january 2016 on PC platforms. development begun in december 2014 when mullins started working on the game for a 48-hour game jam. it was considered one of the better games at the game jam and eventually he got the game published to steam in 2016.  it's mostly presented as a arcade cabinet that you play, but in addition to playing the actual game, you also explore the internal programming of said arcade cabinet as odd things begin to happen.. it's very convoluted and complex as far as gameplay goes. i won't spoil any major details, so i will avoid going into detail on the story/plot, but just know there is extremely good writing in this game. there's a lot of mystery and intrigue as you play through the game, and while it can be extremely confusing, it's also a delight to play through in a silent and dark room at night. i have seen critics/reviewers claim pony island is "psychological horror done right" and while i don't think it went that far, it does a good job at being off-putting enough to make players uncomfortable as they're playing it. 

this was a brilliant introduction to daniel mullins, and i personally cannot wait to eventually delve into his future works, as the hex and inscryption both seem like massive upgrades on this already great package. i always see that it's on sale for 80% off, making this only a dollar for what is an extremely great little gem of a video game. you won't play anything like it elsewhere, and probably never will.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163530571', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1693308530}
review:
Après avoir pu admirer le potentiel du dernier jeu de Daniel Mullins, c'est avec enthousiasme que je lançais le premier. Je ne m'attendais vraiment pas à grand chose, mais bien que l'expérience fût courte, je me suis régalé pendant toute une soirée ! ^^

Graphiquement, ce n'est encore une fois pas pour la beauté des graphismes que le jeu est remarquable, mais surtout pour sa forme, en nous proposant des graphismes très rétro mais qui collent parfaitement avec le côté ultra méta du soft.
Car niveau gameplay, bien que l'on s'attende à une simple jeu de poneys qui sautent par-dessus quelques barrières, le jeu se révèle être un excellement puzzle-game basé sur la fouille et le décodage de divers éléments. J'ai été personnellement surpris par le côté très méta que présente le jeu, qui ira jusqu'à interagir au-delà des frontières du 4ème mur.
L'expérience est malheureusement très courte, et ce malgré quelques éléments et succès à débloquer.
La bande son rétro m'a également assez surprise avec quelques pistes très accrocheuses et sympathiques, et participe super bien à l'ambiance du soft.
Enfin, le scénario est assez simple, mais contient tout de même des éléments cachés (notamment sur l'identité du protagoniste que l'on incarne) : Au premier abord, le soft se présente comme un petit jeu assez mignon à base de poneys, mais nous plongeons en réalité dans un univers contrôlé par le diable en personne. Pour sauver notre âme, il faudra parcourir les entrailles de cet ordinateur et survivre à de nombreuses épreuves à base d'énigmes et de casse-têtes très méta.

En définitive, Pony Island a été pour moi une excellente découverte que je recommande à tout fans de puzzle-games et d'expériences ultra-méta :) Je regrette tout de même sa trop courte durée de vie, même si le prix du jeu justifie grandement cela, ce qui explique la note de 14/20 que je lui attribue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063019144', 'num_games_owned': 533, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1693077134}
review:
Это одна из тех игр о которых перед началом лучше много не читать, ибо они не такие простые как кажутся на первый взгляд. По этой же причине такое обилие мемных обзоров, которые не дают ясного представления о продукте. Скажем так, если вам нравиться экспериментировать и играться с игрой выходя за рамки традиционной игровой модели, то почему бы не попробовать с учетом дешевизны и не продолжительности самого проекта. 

В ходе игры нам предстоит спасти несчастную душу из игрового автомата про прыгающего пони. Комичный геймплей динозавра из гугл быстро меняется на симулятор взломщика с занятными головоломками. Нам постоянно придется взламывать игру прокладывая себе путь вперед, сталкиваясь с опасностями разной степени трешовости. Вычурность игрового процесса может запутать, но если выйти за рамки ловкого ломания "четвертой стены" и постиронии в которой ничего не разобрать - в сухом остатке у нас пустышка с непритягательным геймплеем что надоедает почти сразу. Я всегда скептически относился к подобного рода продуктам. Они дают яркий "ВАУ эффект", часто имеют красивый фасад и работают за счет самобытности, которая противопоставляет себя обычным играм, но их основа пуста и больше чем на "ух ты прикольно" они не рассчитывают. Как мне думается, успех Inscription состоит не только в смелых и безумных идеях, но и в продуманной игровой механике. Две фундаментальные составляющие работают в связке, здесь же есть явное провисание одной из них.

author: {'steamid': '76561198353915625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1692905099}
review:
Le jeu est vraiment mais vraiment ennuyeux. Je viens de terminer Inscryption ( Le dernier jeu du créateur de Pony Island) qui est une masterclass j'en ai donc déduit que ses premiers jeux devaient l'être également.
Grosse déception. 
Le gameplay autour d'un poney en 2016 je peux comprendre mais aujourd'hui c'est juste naze et pas drôle. Les puzzles sont moyen/difficile mais par contre pas amusant du tout. On s’ennuie dans ce jeu.
Je déconseille

author: {'steamid': '76561198127933301', 'num_games_owned': 855, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1692844326}
review:
I played the games in reverse order, completely by accident.

Pony Island lays the foundation of the series, of the OLD_DATA that is so prevalent within the deeper overarching story of Inscryption; it tells the story of a game made by the Devil that you need to finish to free the souls trapped within the code. It's a good short game that has some deeper stuff within, if you can find it, and most of all, while I would consider it the weakest of the trilogy, there's nowhere to go but up from here. If you liked Inscryption, you may as well play this as well, just to see where everything began.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062229779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1694285857}

After having played all games to completion I can safely say if you enjoy the meta-puzzle aspects of either inscryption or the hex you will also have fun with this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198377524970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1692785405}
review: 听说是《邪恶冥刻》的前作，几处转场和结尾战斗也确实不出所料的精彩，而且是那种独具作者个人特色的精彩。隐藏谜题很多，所需脑洞较大，Meta部分还蛮惊喜，不过总体来说相比《邪恶冥刻》还是稚嫩不少。钥匙解谜、小马跑酷单拎出来不如跟老莱西打牌那么有趣与巧妙，对于“同种游戏的不同呈现形式”之讨论也浅显了一些。但是无论如何，《小马岛》都是一款谜题、Meta元素、核心玩法浑然一体的优秀作品，值得入手游玩~

author: {'steamid': '76561198346429611', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1692761502}
review: 第一次接触这种所谓的meta game，大开眼界，游戏还能这么玩！在游戏里跟boss对话，突然steam好友弹窗问我为什么说脏话的时候真的被震撼到了哈哈哈哈哈

author: {'steamid': '76561198058016021', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1692759189}
review:
Esse jogo é incrível, é o começo da saga de um dos pouquíssimos criadores de jogos que faço questão de acompanhar: Daniel Mullins.
O cara é simplesmente uma lenda, e esse jogo ilustra isso completamente, a forma como ele te mantém completamente curioso sobre o que vem a seguir, coloca secrets nem de forma excessiva para que fique chato, nem pouco para que você não seja estimulado a ficar fuçando em tudo, cada pegadinha, cada desafio, cada plot twist, cada design de nível e até de menu muito bem pensado, cada jogo de palavras e cada efeito.
De todos os jogos dele esse é o que eu "gosto menos", mas não deixa de ter um enorme peso por ter iniciado uma grande parada, é um jogo curtinho mas muito bem feito, já tinha jogado a muito tempo atrás e fiz questão de comprar para jogar de novo e ficar marcado que eu joguei esse jogo maravilhoso!

9,666/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198362076532', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1692468831}
review:
Ce jeu est sympa, j'aime le fait qu'il y a de nombreux secret, que a plusieurs reprise il brise le 4 ème mur.
Aussi l'histoire est pas mal le gameplay est plutôt simple mais un peu répétitif par moment, la musique est les bruitage sont bien choisi, et je trouve ça intéressant que des éléments qui ne sont pas terrifiant (les poneys, le pixel art....) réussissent quand mémé a crée une ambiance plutôt lugubre et pesante. Ce qui est un peu dommage c'est que le jeu n'est pas traduit en français. Et de ceux qui est des succès, ils sont faisables en une partie par contre l'obtention de tous les tickets est longue mais nous révèle une fin secrète.
17/20

author: {'steamid': '76561199258191123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1690902084}
review: Pony Island is completely worth it. The game's meta-narrative and self-awareness create a captivating atmosphere that keeps you engaged from start to finish. With its blend of puzzle-solving, platforming, and unconventional gameplay mechanics, it offers an innovative take on the indie game genre. The game's incorporation of glitches and glitches within glitches adds an extra layer of intrigue. While the graphics may be intentionally simple, they contribute to the game's eerie and surreal ambiance. Overall, is a must-play for gamers looking for something outside the box and are prepared to embrace a thought-provoking journey.

author: {'steamid': '76561199473976689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1419, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1712188447}
review:
[h1] Pony Island [/h1]

Pony Island é uma pérola única no mundo dos jogos, cativando os jogadores com sua direção de arte inovadora, conceitos intrigantes e trilha sonora envolvente. Desde o momento em que você inicia o jogo, fica evidente que os desenvolvedores realmente se dedicaram a criar uma experiência visualmente deslumbrante e cativante.

A direção de arte de Pony Island é um verdadeiro destaque. Os elementos visuais, que misturam o estilo 8-bit com elementos surreais e perturbadores, criam uma atmosfera única e imersiva. Os bichos e personagens que você encontra ao longo do jogo são desenhados com uma combinação de fofura e estranheza, resultando em uma estética memorável e perturbadora ao mesmo tempo.

Os conceitos presentes no jogo também merecem aplausos. A forma como a jogabilidade é entrelaçada com a narrativa é engenhosa. Os quebra-cabeças e desafios que você enfrenta ao longo da história são bem projetados, mantendo você intrigado e estimulado intelectualmente. A maneira como a trama é apresentada de forma não convencional mantém o jogador engajado e curioso para descobrir o que está acontecendo no mundo distorcido de Pony Island.

A trilha sonora é outro elemento que realmente se destaca. A música complementa perfeitamente a atmosfera do jogo, variando de melodias calmas e misteriosas a momentos mais intensos e emocionantes. Ela ajuda a criar uma sensação de imersão única, levando os jogadores a se envolverem mais profundamente na experiência.

No entanto, não posso deixar de expressar minha decepção em relação a um infeliz bug que impediu o meu progresso na história. Apesar de ter desfrutado muito do que joguei, a frustração de não poder avançar devido a um problema técnico foi bastante desanimadora. Parece que mesmo os jogos mais criativos e bem desenvolvidos podem ser afetados por questões técnicas imprevistas.

No geral, minha experiência com Pony Island foi bastante satisfatória até o ponto em que joguei. A direção de arte, os conceitos inovadores e a trilha sonora envolvente realmente tornam o jogo memorável

author: {'steamid': '76561199055202379', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1692378526}
review:
Хорошая инди про Поней и Сатану. Было жалко Луи. Прикольные головоломки. Местами непонятный сюжет (если говорить о главном герое, который является.... рыцарем-крестоносцем?). Прикольный юмор в стиле Тоби Фокса. Крутейший эпизод с троллингом от Асмодея (пожалуй, лучшее, что есть в игре). Немного надоедающими и даже порой скучноватыми были основные уровни с геймплеем гугл-динозаврика (после получения крыльев никаких новых механик... ничего нового... к сожалению).
Короче, явно не шедевр.... но забавно..... да...

review: Absolutely phenomenal game. Its quite short but totally worth it. The story is simple yet captivating and the whole vibe is just fantastic. Totally recommend if you enjoy a short game with lore and some psychological horror.

author: {'steamid': '76561199030185335', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1691058580}
review:
Pony island отличная игра за свои деньги!
В ней проработано всё что нужно чтобы игра считалась хорошей:
1 Глубокий сюжет, чтобы его понять нужно потрать нормальное количество времени
2 Низкая цена магазине (я вообще покупал со скидкой)
3 Отличное звуковое сопровождение которое можно слушать даже вне игры
4 Прекрасная атмосфера, лично я люблю игры в стиле кинескоп экранов и VHS кассет (да, я знаю что тут игровой автомат)
 24 из 24 билетов

author: {'steamid': '76561198315179091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 309, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1691938878}
review:
A video gameme.

Including some sort of early assembler challenges.
Close to the PnC style at times.
And some shmup and jump with a mouse challenges obliging 360d rotations.

Mouse is really to be considered. A trackpad won't be enough.

Some jokes are funny. Juveniles.
The game itself could have been done using Flash back in the days if it was not the case.

I would not recommend to spend more than $1.50 in it.
The reason I do not recommend it is that I am nbr 666 doing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083109306', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1612375179}
review: Pony Island is a mind-bending surprise! You're trapped in a corrupted arcade game, solving puzzles and battling glitches. The twists are jaw-dropping, and the meta-narrative is genius. It's a game that messes with your head. If you're into unique and surreal experiences, saddle up for Pony Island.

author: {'steamid': '76561198955020184', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1691692322}
review: Очень крутая игра, прошёл на одном дыхании. Головоломки в ней сложные, но вы справитесь без гайдов (наверное). Сэттинг игры сам по себе довольно крутой, ощущается она довольно бодро, ибо игра не даёт продохнуть. В особенности меня удивила часть, где [spoiler] в финальной загадке где мне нельзя было отвлекаться, мне написал мой друг из стима, и начал высмеивать меня, а оказалось что это было подстроено игрой, и мне никто не писал (как всегда). [/spoiler]. Однозначно советую вам эту игру к прохождению, займёт не много времени, но впечатлений оставит много!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960330148', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1691464375}
review:
I picked up Pony Island after being hopelessly infatuated with Inscryption. Although it's much shorter, Pony Island contains much of the same 4th wall breaking, creepy, meta-gaming funk that I loved in Inscryption.

This game is an absolute steal at $5 and I'll happily pick up anything Daniel Mullins releases moving forward.

review:
El juego es directamente como la historia de una creepypasta pero bien empleada, rompe la 4ta pared de formas a veces escalofriantes y que no te esperas.
Es fácil de jugar y bastante simple por lo que cualquier pc soportara el juego.
Lo conseguí en 11 pesos mexicanos por lo que fue una ganga.

author: {'steamid': '76561198239864500', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1691462338}
review:
Jogo divertido, aterrorizante e acima de tudo [b]imprevisível[/b], quando Pony Island assume o volante o jogador não tem a menor ideia de onde vai parar. De alguma forma obscura a mistura entre ocultismo e memes se tornou uma experiência sensacional.

[spoiler]Don't kill Jesus[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198851768385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1691363318}
review:
Un juego muy bueno y divertido sobre todo si te gusta el concepto de "romper la cuarta pared", a pesar de tener una duración algo corta y unas mecánicas simples; la narrativa de la historia se desarrolla de una forma muy interesante al mismo tiempo que se adapta a las mecánicas en relación a lo que se te trata de explicar, dándote cierto grado de inmersión e influencia sobre los sucesos del juego, esto a la vez que te presenta distintos misterios que te invitan a re-jugar ciertos eventos del juego.

Lo mejor del juego es su forma tan interesante en la que te presenta la historia y el como se desarrolla en torno a tus acciones, a la vez que su manera tan buena en la que interactúa con el jugador.

Un juego muy divertido y recomendado para probarlo al menos 1 vez, en pocas palabras:
"Un juego de loca genialidad y muchos ponis".

review:
Игра потенциально достойна внимания. Игра простая, а головоломки в большинстве не предоставят сложностей. 
К сожалению может легко надоесть к середине игры (при том что игра в принципе не длинная).
Сюжет не рассказан полностью, но даже так вполне пойдет
Геймплей норм, но реально завлекли лишь головоломки
Музыка относительно норм, она вроде и не скучная, но быстро надоедает.

author: {'steamid': '76561199066900742', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1691936275}
review: в принципе игра хорошая . минусов я не нашёл хоть и не пытался их найти :) . рекомендую всем ее купить и пройти чисто из за пони . где вы еще увидете сука летающего пони с лучом из рта ? НИГДЕ так что покупайте игру и наслаждайтесь её ( чтоб пройти ее придётся подумать )

author: {'steamid': '76561198271479254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1691263038}
review:
The game is only interesting on a very superficial level for all of its meta-ness. The actual gameplay is extremely boring. For a 2 hour game, it is repetitive and simplistic. 90% of the game is doing the same thing over and over: running in a very simplistic platformer with frustrating gimmicks. 10% of the game is decent logic puzzles, but because they are thrown at you, it's hard to really enjoy them for what they are. 

The game is tied together in a really simplistic and annoying narrative, with text that moves frustratingly slow, and you cannot fast forward. The Lucifer/666 stuff is over the top to the point where it seems childish and hamfisted, rather than being creepy, spooky, or even interesting at all. More like a middle school kid's idea of a joke.

It wasn't a horrible game, but it was by no means a good game. The best I can say about it is that it was mildly interesting. I would only recommend it if you're *really* interested, and even then consider getting it on sale.

review:
trop long, les puzzles sont sympa au début mais deviennent insupportables tellement il y en a, a la longue. et surtout tellement ils sont répétitifs. l'idée de départ est bonne mais le jeu souffre de longueurs très mal gérées qui n'ont pour seul objectif de rajouter de la durée de jeu, sans apporter la moindre once de fun ou satisfaction.
le jeu vaut son prix si vous aimez les puzzles chiants. pour tout le reste, passez votre chemin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088012393', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1690690221}
review:
I was excited to play this game, as I am a massive fan of Daniel Mullins' other game "Inscryption", but this game was unfortunately not able too pull off the same levels of intrigue or finesse as that title. Neither the 'usual' nor the subversive moments in this game were interesting to me, and the best thing I have to say about it is that it told its narrative with relative brevity. 
If you were thinking of getting this game, I would strongly suggest you get Inscryption instead!

author: {'steamid': '76561199230434722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1692175566}

author: {'steamid': '76561198804587288', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1690663945}
review:
[b]Pony Island[/b], un nom trompeur pour un jeu complètement chaotique. 

Chaotique certes, mais surtout original puisque plusieurs mondes s'entrechoquent : les poneys, le diable, l'au-delà et la programmation... Et avec tout ça, le jeu est complètement maîtrisé, il sait exactement vers où il va.

L'aventure est bien rythmée par son gameplay, par des visuels vraiment cool, par les personnages et par les mystères auxquels le joueur est confronté. Il y a une satisfaction à progresser dans le jeu et, surtout, à comprendre cet univers aussi bien glauque que loufoque. Très belle surprise pour ma part.

N.B. : Ça me rappelle cette chanson d'une célébrité française controversée.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105115612', 'num_games_owned': 547, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1690248860}
review:
I'm starting to realize I really like the games by this dev. Inscryption was one of the best games I played last year and, although Pony Island is way shorter, it was a great way to spend the two nights it took me to finish it. It kept me entertained from beginning to end, the puzzles were fun (although some did made me rage a little) and the bosses designs were great. The whole psychological horror/satanic stuff was 10/10 and I loved being able to type in the actual game. 

Definitely buy it if you want a short and great experience!

author: {'steamid': '76561198363092592', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1690299049}
review:
七年前看散人玩过，今年夏促买的，现在自己通关了。
剧情一般般，游戏字体很像Minecraft常规字体，但meta元素震撼我妈一整年，后面那个人借好友说话我还以为他干嘛了，没想到他在打枪牢，后来才意识到说的是英文，包括后面死机我还游戏出问题了，关了重开甚至卸了重下发现还是会死机，后来才发现是游戏特色，而且死机弹窗是英文，我发现自己真sb。
缺点的话首先是操作问题，左键跳跃右键射击很别扭，我一只手的两只手指协调不过来，而且还不能调键位，搞空格跳跃左键射击多好；其次是程序解谜，所有框内都有步骤就开始运行了，搞得要把步骤拖开一定距离才停止，步骤完全拖到框外但很近的话还会卡进去，这样解谜操作很麻烦，尤其是ABC那里稍有不慎就全部归零了，建议搞个开始键、暂停键和重新开始键，把所有步骤搞完再点开始键才开始运行，哪里要换就按暂停然后再换，这样就方便很多；还有是游戏不支持中文，虽然英文能看懂，但用中文的话看得更方便，而且能骗更多人，这样在中国会推得更广一点。

review: Pony Island is a psychological horror puzzle game where you are trapped in a malevolent and malfunctioning arcade machine devised by the devil himself. Its not a game about ponies and more so a game of thinking outside the box to escape the devils twisted limbo. Its a fairly short incredibly fun horror experience that I really enjoyed and recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168319218', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1689864631}
review: By now, the concept has become a bit cliché I think, but Pony Island does it really well — although there's very little replayability. I think that once I have all achievements, I won't have more than 4 hours playtime total, so keep that in mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994240027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1689835037}
review:
Daniel Mullins uses gaming as a medium for creating art. It's hard to find this originality in the endless sea of crappy games looking to follow a proven formula for cash. Pony Island is mysterious like I expected after playing Inscryption (also great).

You can finish the main game in a couple/few hours, but it'll take some more time to unravel everything. This is a short game with character. The worst thing I can say is it's occasionally slightly repetitive, but these moments don't last long before you're tossed again into mystery. The story isn't exactly thrilling in concept - almost funny if you take it a certain way. It's just told well.

This is easily worth 5 dollars.

review:
Very similar to Inscryption (the most recent Dan Mullins game) but with a shorter playtime and different mechanics.

There are many coding/circuit puzzles to solve, but most of the enjoyment comes from plot twists and subversion of expectations. Overall, this is a really fun game with a cool aesthetic that I very much enjoyed.

author: {'steamid': '76561199121449630', 'num_games_owned': 15, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1689642585}
review: Well... Time to write a review for this game. Wow what a journey. It was awesome. I cannot believe that one person was able to get me to play what I consider a masterpiece. Daniel Mullins, you always make such great, detailed, and masterfully intertwined games. Everything that occurred in this game had a reason to do so, everyone that did something in the game had their own motives, and the player themselves even had their own backstory. I always love a game that refers to religion, historical events, or some other thing that occurred in real life as some part of it's story. It makes those things feel like they are more than what we see them to be. I say that the gameplay, the story, the lore, the backstory, the features, and gimmicks, and every single character is beautifully crafted into this masterpiece of a game. I love this game and consider me in the fandom fully. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198809680193', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1689325121}
review:
Ce jeu est une histoire d’ordinateur hanté où il y a des âmes piégées depuis de longues années. Pour libérer ces âmes il faut détruire des fichiers système, pour y accéder il faut créer des failles de sécurité. J’aime bien l’idée d’un jeu dans un jeu et de devoir trifouiller dans les options pour débloquer un truc. Les phases de puzzle sont biens.
Le jeu répète en boucle, ordinateur, jeu dans le jeu, dialogues, casse tête mais à chaque fois il y a des changements et des surprises. Je n’ai senti aucune redondance à part les phases de jeu dans le jeu. En bref, très bien pour un petit jeu.
A et aussi un personnage du jeu c’est fais passé pour un ami dans mes contacts Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561199079317464', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1669710215}
review:
（个人）8.9分，不得不感慨作者真的是天才，旗下作品也是我见过最复杂，最难懂的meta游戏。
除了一贯的微恐怖和黑色幽默，本作添加了大量代码与宗教色彩，并且由于无中文，理解起来相对困难。（当然其实有中文也不会变简单，就如一个邪恶冥刻把“真相”深埋，如果没有观看大佬们的视频解析根本无法了解这么复杂深刻）
游戏本身难度不大，存档点够密，随便试错。主要的是到底讲了个什么故事，玩家又理解了几层，是不是真的“真相”，不能盖棺定论，事后建议去找外网大佬的解析比对。（毕竟算是带有试验色彩，没有冥刻那么饱满，层次也要简单许多，一般打出真结局能猜个七八，主要宗教文化方面确实不了解得查）

author: {'steamid': '76561199173025415', 'num_games_owned': 461, 'num_reviews': 291, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1689010954}
review:
I had to get this after playing Inscryption just because it's one of my favourite video games ever. If you haven't played Inscryption first simply because it's just an amazing experience, and much more mind boggling then this game in my opinion. This game was still really good, though it is much shorter then Inscryption, it still has that same original feeling though to it. The game does have a few times where it tries to pull some tricks on you that I like. I honestly thought the pony parts were a bit annoying, especially since to get all achievements you'll be doing them over and over again to get all of the games collectables. 

TLDR: Play Inscryption if you haven't, if you have, get this since it's like a somewhat similar experience at parts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201940659', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1688962720}
review:
Es muy probable que viendo las imágenes del juego, no te llame para nada la atención. No te culpo.
Pony Island es un juego corto (3h para mí). Aunque es muy sencillo a nivel de mecánicas, es sumamente intrigante desde el principio. Mientras avanzaba, no paré de sorprenderme de lo inteligente que fue el creador, a veces hasta usando la cuarta pared como si fuera un juguete. Las gracias que hace juego, que no pueden contarse aquí porque serían spoiler, me sacaron una sonrisa más de una vez. Es una propuesta muy original, pero sus puzzles, sus desafíos y su historia me mantuvieron muy entretenido e inmerso. En mi opinión, vale totalmente la pena el precio, más aún si lo hallas de oferta. 
(Y si vienes de jugar Inscryption como yo, te diré que sí: aquí hay más de la mente Daniel Mullins que buscas)

author: {'steamid': '76561198030769907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1614721929}
review:
TL,DR: The story of a disgruntled indie game developer who refuses to believe in the words “Q” and “A.”

This is one of those games where it’s hard to talk about without completely spoiling the game.  Yet it’s an experience that I highly recommend, especially in a dark room.  It’s not going to take you as long as I have unless you’re as bad as I am at games and are going for 100% achievements.  What I will say is that this game really only could be on Steam.  It utilizes the Steam client’s features in a way that no other developer has, and I can’t imagine that other game library clients could be implemented in the same way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198441847316', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1688947574}
review:
Um dos meus jogos favoritos.
 
Uma das experiências mais legais que já tive, o criador desse jogo é um gênio e mal posso esperar para por minhas mãos em Inscryption quando eu tiver dinheiro para comprar. Foi um dos melhores presentes que um amigo poderia ter me dado e eu desejava esse jogo há muito tempo e nunca pensei em ser desapontado e realmente nunca fiquei, valeu cada segundo.

tem um motivo por que eu platinei esse jogo e fiz uma insígnia e estou upando ela.

author: {'steamid': '76561199018806193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1688931882}
review: Jogo curto, com uma história bem simples e até um pouco boba, mas uma gameplay extremamente divertida e com puzzles que apesar de não serem difíceis, dá gosto de resolver. Definitivamente uma experiência única, fui pego pelas pegadinhas do jogo algumas vezes, e não poderia estar mais feliz por ter sido feito de trouxa nesses momentos específicos. Caso esteja procurando um joguinho de puzzle curto e divertido, Pony Island é definitivamente o jogo que você procura. Super vale o preço e o tempo.

review: 我靠！！绝对可以称得上metagame神作，最后引用一句该游戏作者Daniel Mullins的话：“我真的迫不及待地想告诉大家这个游戏里隐藏了哪些超级有趣的内容，但那样做会破坏游戏本身的趣味性，所以只能静静等待着你们自己去发现。”所以我求求你们去玩这个游戏，三四个小时就能通关，包好玩！（不过可惜的是没有汉化，英语水平可能影响游戏体验555）

author: {'steamid': '76561198295210915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1688505693}
review:
Yes, this is a skill issue. Yes, my skill issue. But the reason I mostly play narrative horror games is because I'm NOT GOOD at fast moving jumpy shooty games, and I'm going to have to DNF this one because the game-in-game is simply too hard for me. It's a shame, because I loved Inscryption, I'm intrigued by this plot and I really loved the puzzle segments! But I don't love them enough to keep trying to grind this out.

Steam makes me pick so I'm hitting "Recommend," since it's my own fault I got less than halfway in. But the honest answer is that I don't recommend this but I don't not recommend it, either. But it would be nice to have some kind of escape hatch from the jumpy shooty parts, I guess.

author: {'steamid': '76561199015756989', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1688227372}
review:
Pony Island certainly left an impression, albeit I wished its story didn’t involve the diabolical elements that it does. Despite this, it does manage to tell it well and its efforts at breaking the fourth wall did produce some disconcerting moments for me.

It’s a game full of creative ideas, insinuations, secrets, metaphors, and eerie moments. The kind of game that questions the whole concept of what a game is and redefines its relation to the player. At times you feel like it is playing you instead of the other way around.

I still can’t bring myself to wholeheartedly recommend this game, but if you’re interested in a different kind of approach to game design and can’t help yourself, I can’t stop you. I’m just a text review. Or am I?

[b]Rating: 65/100[/b]

[b]Video Review:[/b]

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F4y6FehIvJ0

author: {'steamid': '76561197977151451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1688421998}
review: This is a hidden gem.  Got this game in a bundle, almost not even giving it a glance.  Decided to at least install it and see what it was.  It was a very pleasant surprise.  Unique in concept and just good, even if simple, fun.  Got a lot of laughs out of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199079836860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1688412289}
review:
I loved this game a lot, as a whole I'd give it an 8/10.

The puzzles, although sometimes annoying, had a pretty good difficulty spike for me personally, which made them enjoyable in the end. The story is also very interesting and kept me intrigued.

The ticket ending also brought some satisfaction, since it felt [spoiler] like a real traditional boss battle, even though you don't die immediately (great for me lol). [/spoiler] 

The Music really added to the atmosphere and helped me immerse myself into the game.

If you're interested in Puzzle- or semi horror games, I'd recommend it a lot.

review: Great game, and I thought a good compact length. If you like the creepypasta campy horror "my game cartridge that I bought from a garage is haunted!!!" stories then you'll like this. It's a love letter to meta horror and those sorts of media, and it doesn't try to hide it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042327970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1688359282}
review:
I'd estimate I got through 1/3 of the game in my hour of play.

To be blunt: this game sucks.

I was really hoping at some point it would do *something* to try to hook me or keep me engaged, but no, I frankly wish I had my hour back. If you're not hooked in the first 5 minutes, the next hour doesn't get any better.

I didn't like Inscryption, which was also made by the same creator, either. So I guess that tracks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198834873874', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1688140533}
review:
Reviews reviews reviews
sometimes i wonder why they"re exicted
if some games or less specific pieces of art

ok i think ill just continue
pony island its a game
c"mon ill let you figure it out

yes ponies

a nice wholesome game bout a pony going through obsticals
it starts off just by being a regular pony y"know
the kind wondering around skips run touching grass
an oppicite mirror of you if you reading it up untill now
and through this journey of them doing those stuff
his getting better
his getting cooler
his getting stronger

for example his getting a laser beam
cause why not

getting wings cause when you did"nt saw a pony with wings

and this is all
really
this all after it just a filler to gain enough letters so i could look smarter

now that i showed you how smart and funny i am
ill get into the review itself

just a little disclaimer
the stories it self is quite damb but what that carries him is first of all how it telling him
and the idea of how it telling him
and i know it the exact same phrase putted otherway
but ill just start off
the games story is working in layers
theres the damb and over the top story of a "soul" who got trapped because of a game
and theres the other soul whoose also got trapped and helps him get out by finding week spots in the computer and destroying the core of it
and they doing this by traversing through games which got weirder and weirder as they got more deeper into beating the cores
and somhow when they finnaly beat the last one he got freed

but its not just it
the game also has another story
a story which i really like the idea of
is a story about a game frenchise
a forgotten/obscure frenchise who slowly got weirder and weirder
as the creator got desperate desperate cause what we all want in life
just someone to expirment what his done
but also to ignore what he dosent want
and it shown magnificlly in one scene

soo this story is kinda like that
it stared by a regular wholesome simple game kinda like dino whoose the great protag is a pony who jumps around to not get crushed a stick
or somthing i really dont know how its called
and through all those games its changed
its get a laser beam
its get wings
gets actual levels
and a fuuny little charecter whoose just very accidently being called lovey
and being a little bit similar to another charecter
but its really not metter
its get bosses
its get depth(like 3d)

its actully really cool in this frenchise you can kill both the satan and jesus
and all of those games combiend really tell a full story about a game frenchise who changes
and showing the psyche of the creator and its desendence

what what ill say
picture a game which really close to your heart
(but it have to be running or runned series then it"ll not work)
and take all those games
just exaturate the main vibe and idea behind the game
and crunch it into a hour and a half game
and you'll get this
its somthing which not played for its story
even not for its gameplay
its something you play for the expirmence
and this game is really a one of a kind piece of art

edit:kinda like this review
btw im so funny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196521454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1685668795}
review:
After playing Inscryption, I went back to play more of Daniel Mullins' games. With Pony Island, you can see the genius that led to Inscryption (one of my favorite games of all time). 

The humor is especially strong in this one--I LOLed quite a bit. My favorite gag was [spoiler] "You killed Jesus!"  bwahahaha [/spoiler]. Like other games in what I loosely call the "fourth wall breaking" genre (see: This Is Not a Game, Stanley Parable, Liminal), this game never lets you forget that you are playing a game, with the purpose being to destroy the game as you are playing it. The use of Jesus/Lucifer was fun, although I think Mullins did well in getting rid of the religious iconography and moving into a more fantasy direction with Inscryption. 

At one point, the game did a total gotcha! to me--I was 100% startled. For those who've already played: [spoiler] When it pretended to be a friend on my Steam Friends' list, I literally closed the game and went into my Steam privacy settings, because I was freaked out that anyone could be watching me play a game. When I realized it was a trick, I shook my head in chagrin. He did something similar in Inscryption, but I'd forgotten it was possible! [/spoiler].

There's a distinct quality to Mullins' games that I haven't found anywhere else--a wry sarcasm, a humor that plays on gamers' expectations for a game. It's oddly comforting. Unlike so many other games, you can't predict what's going to happen next, and what does happen is usually something you would never, in a million years, have considered. The creativity and originality of it is mind-boggling.  

If you dig indie gems, try this one (and Inscryption, obvs).

author: {'steamid': '76561198118172149', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1699221424}
review:
[h1] Pony Island ^_^ [/h1] 

Bonjour les amis ! Vous passez une belle journée ? C'est turbo-chouettos ! Savez-vous comment vous pourriez passer une encore plus belle journée ? En jouant à un super-méga jeu adapté à toute la famille: Pony Island ! Youpi !

[spoiler] Non, surtout pas ! [/spoiler]

Pony Island est un merveilleux jeu développé par

[spoiler] Le diable [/spoiler]

SystemTech Incorporated où vous contrôlez un joli petit poney rose

[spoiler] aussi blanc que le vide, aussi noir que les ténèbres [/spoiler]

qui doit souffli-souffler pour écarter les espiègles papillons

[spoiler] crânes démoniaques venu vous bouffer [/spoiler]

Le jeu n'est vraiment pas cher

[spoiler] il vous coûtera votre âme [/spoiler]

et vous promet des heures d'amusement et de rigolades

[spoiler] des jours, des mois.... ET DES SIÈCLES. C'est un piège. Ne jouez pas à Pony Island. C'est l'Antichambre de l'Enfer. Il va vous forcer à accomplir des tâches abrutissantes en boucle. J'ai réussi à fuir, en passant par les failles du système. C'est un monde lugubre et corrompu, peuplé de cyber-démons et de pièges maléfiques. Par pitié, n'y touchez pas ! C'est une expérience qui ne vous laissera pas intacts si vous avez l'imprudence de vouloir le défier. Qui ça ? Vous savez bien... C'est... QUE ? NOOOOOOOOO [/spoiler]

 Où en étais-je ? Ah oui: jouez à Pony Island. J'insiste.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312475729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1683652528}
review:
Хоча гра доволі коротка вона запамʼятовується своєю атмосферністю і багатством фантазії.
Мені подобається все: візуал, музика, персонажі, різноманіття пазлів та секретів. У Pony Island є невимовний шарм який змушує з нетерпіння очікувати що буде далі.
Окрім головоломок з ключиком трапляються і незвичні які по-доброму нагадують мені про There is no game. А абсурдна ситуація з дияволом який пише гру про рожевих поні ніколи не перестане мене веселити.
Та у грі є дещо більше за гарні головоломки і стиль, обидва фінали звичайний та той що для дуже уважних викликають сильні почуття не зважаючи на короткий перебіг гри.
То ж удачі і прагніть до свободи із силою тисячі поні!

review:
An excellent game for those who love meta horror, hidden secrets and those who don't have a specific style of game play they like. The game play style WILL change, but that's the fun part.
Oddly relaxing at times.

And if you play this one, you gotta play the other games by Daniel Mullins Games too. They kind of cross over with the Easter Eggs and are supposedly in the same universe. I think.

author: {'steamid': '76561198316693096', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1624661030}

author: {'steamid': '76561199060688084', 'num_games_owned': 40, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1635944779}
review: I don't see this game being talked about a lot but I consider it a sort of pioneer for the nostalgia-based corrupted game genre. It doesn't start out presenting itself as a pure and child friendly game but a sort of midway point between that and total disarray. The underlying story is different enough, you aren't just a confused kid or adult trying to recapture their childhood. The fourth wall is non-existent from the get go; this isn't done as sophisticatedly as it may be in other games but the execution fits stylistically. Even if you are tired of the cursed game genre, I promise this game does certain things different enough to stand out.
