author: {'steamid': '76561198067567908', 'num_games_owned': 3453, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1666875167}
review:
Pony Island is extremely fun and in my opinion a hidden gem. A puzzle adventure game, with multiple layers and an abundance of hidden easter eggs - all accompanied by many achievements.

On the surface it is a runner game, booted up on an old arcade machine owned by the devil himself. You are set forth with discovering who you are/were and destroying said machine.

The soundtrack is amazing and the sound effects do not pose as annoyingly repetitive. The art style is adorable, with multiple changes throughout the game. Game is split into multiple acts, each with its own unique take. Main controls are 
 your mouse, although you are confronted with an interactive chat which helped to completely break the fourth wall and immerse yourself within the game.

Pony Island was not too difficult and is easily completed within 2-3 hours. Pony Island could be seen as somewhat repetitive at times, although each act has a fresh new look. I went back and thoroughly played through to ensure I found all the tickets, and any hidden easter eggs - this is also well catered to as you have access to each individual act/boss fight which prevents you from having to restart the entire game to gain certain achievements. Achievements are mostly easily obtainable apart from the hidden ones. The game does not require you to do any grinding for the achievements.

Labelled as a horror, it does have certain horror elements although would not call it horror. From the beginning of the game, up until the end, your expectations are completely unpredictable as the game is consistently evolving. The cheap price tag that comes with this gem, compared to the large amounts of mass produced asset-flips on the Steam store with a dearer price - makes this game a must buy. I thoroughly enjoyed it and was hooked in one sitting, going into my favourites for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198336741609', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1666622632}
review: Esta buenísimo, recomendado para cualquiera, te lo podes pasar en un rato de 3 a 5 horas max y te llevas algo re bueno. Obviamente se tiene en cuenta que no sabes nada del juego ya que depende mucho de eso para que te lleves una buena impresión. Ya de ultima, si conoces bastantes cosas del juego, sin haberlo jugado todavía, podrías intentar jugarlo después de 5 años, con ese tiempo seguro que vas a entrar como si nunca te hubieses enterado de nada y te mandas como un campeón.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046439791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1666602605}
review: I actually played the Daniel Mullens trilogy in reverse order, so I had already played The Hex and Inscryption when I started this game- I expected the ideas to be fairly half formed but honestly, it still holds up really well! Definitely still worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561199176234706', 'num_games_owned': 622, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1704281357}
review:
Co czuje wojownik, który zginął tysiące lat temu, a jego dusza zamknięta jest w grze o kucykach? Przerażająca wizja. Na szczęście możemy pomóc. I nieźle się przy tym zabawić.

Pony Island to psychodeliczna produkcja. Jest tu sporo zręcznościówki, trochę logicznych zagadek, oldskulowa grafika i dźwięk plus sporo sekretów.

Całość spina zakręcona fabuła. Po wszystkim miałem wrażenie, że gra ma w sobie nawet coś z The Talos Principle. Oczywiście w bardzo dużym uproszczeniu.

Opowieść o opętanym automacie daje masę rozrywki pod każdym względem. Pony FTW!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010155821', 'num_games_owned': 791, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1665342866}
review:
[h1]İ̸̪̤̕t̶̝̙̆'̸̡̥͋͂s̵̛̤ ̷̾͜ͅȃ̴͖ ̸̰̔u̵̯͌ǹ̸̝ị̶̝̈́c̴̭̠̊͝o̶̝͔͂r̸͚̊̚͜n̸͇͇͐[/h1]
Pony Island is at large an unassuming platformer involving a titular pony, hopping merrily over wooden fences. It’s the fact that the game runs on an arcade machine possessed by the devil himself that earns its horror tag. “Works as intended” phrase is quickly put in unique context as the game twists and bends to the whim of a moody influence behind it. While mild in its fear factor, Pony Island is full of unorthodox creativity and delivers its ideas with truly impressive ingenuity. Curiosity of what the devs came up with next is enough to keep the player seated throughout the game’s runtime.
[url]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2873715716[/url]
[b][i]ERMAC[/i] wins[/b]
One would struggle to find a better caption regarding Pony Island than the one present on the game’s own store page – “It is not a game about ponies”. While keeping things as ambiguous as humanly possible, it conveys the core idea of the game. The fence-jumping pony is merely a point of reference, used to show the player a game that twists and falls apart as the story progresses. The true gameplay would be solving a set of puzzles portraying the player’s interference with the Pony Island’s code, that while making the progress possible, also makes it increasingly unstable. Well, the title being possessed may also have something to do with that particular aspect.

While some may find the game’s distorted imagery slightly unnerving, its horror elements are downright negligible. To my eyes Pony Island is foremost a love letter to glitches. In a faraway land of the 90’s, when games often pushed technological boundaries of their respective systems, their capacity for short-lived or even one-time issues was substantial. Without widespread internet to patch the thing or distribute the news, these glitches often had an air of mystery surrounding them. Was it a simple error, or perhaps a hidden character in your favourite fighting game, whose means of unlocking are yet to be discovered? More than anything else, Pony Island pays a tribute to glitches’ role in creating gaming’s own set of urban legends. A nod to something nowadays almost entirely lost to technological advancement.

[b]Settings>Advanced Settings>Enable Free Will[/b]
Reference-laced gameplay would be more than enough to fill the game’s roughly 3-hours long runtime, yet this title goes on an extra mile with a layer of delightfully self-conscious humour worked into it. As it evolves throughout its playtime, Pony Island continuously toys around with its own formula in increasingly creative fashion (nausea-inducing Pony 3D blew me away). Furthermore, this title smuggles in more than a few jabs at both notion of the game development and how the player’s interaction with the game gives a meaning and context to its message. Pony Island pitches a couple of thought-provoking ideas if you are willing to read into it a little, turning this title into something much more universal than a throwback to glitches in old games could ever hope to be.
[url]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2873716030[/url]
All things considered, this game squarely earns its demonic pony/10 rating. While not scary at all, it’s an enjoyable piece of human creativity, neatly wrapped to be downed in a spare evening. If you have any long-lived relationship with games or happen to have an interest in video games as a medium, I can’t recommend Pony Island enough. If you don’t meet any of these conditions, hats off to you. I wouldn’t expect you to come across this game at all, let alone read its lengthy review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198803548275', 'num_games_owned': 1309, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1663777273}
review:
自诩meta游戏爱好者的俺居然今天才想起来把这个打通…口亨，还不是因为没有中文嘛！为什么支持那么多语种都不给个中文啦！让本英文白痴很为难啦！！（半恼
实际上不是很难懂，本英文白痴也能大致看懂个七七八八（嗯）就是有些字体属实比较眼瞎，看起来有点累（）
以meta作为核心的游戏，玩法一般都很简单啦不然就喧宾夺主了（）大致就是跑酷小游戏+简简单单的编程（应该算是）小游戏？这样两种小游戏来来回回给你玩。小马快跑的跑酷难一些的多试几次背板都能过啦很简单，所以不用害怕，[b]本作上手门槛还是很低的√[/b]
很经典的meta作品了，常见的meta元素塞得满满的，很有意思大满足！[spoiler] 隐藏结局的隐藏结局（？）也很让人惊喜[/spoiler]，至于故事背景嘛…呜呜，英文看不懂啦！（半恼）（再度）
全收集大概4～5h左右，至少我觉得肯定值回票价，毕竟也是楷模级别的metagame啦，放心冲！ww

author: {'steamid': '76561198010203905', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1663175749}
review:
So this game is short and sweet, and I got it for free from a friend who had a spare key. It took me 4 hours to beat, and additional 2 to clean up achievements. Less said about the game the better, but it was a nice palate cleanser after playing so many week long games.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
-Simple Gameplay
-Lots of hidden stuff that was mostly fun to find
-Music is alright
-Level select for completion once beating the game

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
-On a first play through a puzzle will not work to make sure you have to beat it twice for 100% and [spoiler]to hide the true ending[/spoiler]
-No fishing

[h1]My Level of Experience with the game[/h1]
I sorta knew what it was about going in, beat the game in 4 hours, 100% it in 6, I looked up 3 missing items/achievements

author: {'steamid': '76561198040855851', 'num_games_owned': 821, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1662814171}
review:
Viendo "Extremadamente positivos" tenía la perspectiva de que este juego iba a ser de lo mejor que iba a jugar, pero no ha sido así.

Es entretenido al principio, porque se muestra con una premisa innovadora, pero a la hora resulta aburrido y agobiante a partes iguales. Si es verdad que te vuela la mente en un par de ocasiones, pero no para catalogarlo como "Obra maestra".

En definitiva, algo decepcionado a raíz de las expectativas generada por los usuarios.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045619673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1662662843}
review: I played this game to completion in one sitting of a little more than three hours without a walk through or other assistance, not entirely aware about what went on there, but it did happen... I suppose that was to be expected with a game that asks you to deposit a soul or two along the way.  I do not believe that I will install this again to search the missing tickets or other secrets, but ymmv.  I think I had fun along the way, but again... not entirely sure about anything with this one.

review:
[h1]My  SAD Pony[/h1]

Дэниэл супер-креативный разработчик. Он берёт все ваши представления об играх и жанрах и ломает их одно за другим. Затем выносит с ноги четвёртую стену, а после выливает табаско на притупленые ассасинами и далёкими рёвами рецепторы.

Pony Island сносит крышу!

review: No es tan bueno como los demás juegos del creador, pero tiene muy buena atmosfera, tiene misterio y la jugabilidad es muy divertida y los jefes y puzzles son desafiantes pero fáciles de entender.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078588463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1619579657}
review:
Este juego sin duda es una experiencia muy extraña, una combinación de juegos de rompecabezas con juegos de corredores (runners) que me hace pensar en los problemas que tienen a veces los programadores cuando las cosas empiezan a fallar por cuestiones desconocidas, algo que quien ha trabajado programando sabe que es tristemente mas común de lo que uno quisiera admitir.

Aun jugandolo la historia que esta detras del juego es extraña, existen varios "niveles" de realidad donde se lleva a cabo el juego. Primero existe "Pony Island" que es el juego que jugamos en la pantalla frente a nosotros, esta la propia pantalla que vemos el cual contiene pony island y el contacto con otros personajes de la historia, pero esa pantalla esta enmarcada en un aparato que no es un simple adorno, aparte de la pantalla se encuentra insinuado una realidad fuera de esa pantalla que en momentos se logra ver que pareciera un salon de arcade  y por ultimo al final se revela una ultima rotura de la 4ta pared para concluir definitivamente con el juego. La forma en que esta diseñada la trama da mas interrogantes que respuestas, pero eso hace que sea mas interesante el pensar en que ese purgatorio creato para peleadores de las cruzadas obliga a los caballeros a jugar malos video juegos por toda la eternidad hasta que se rindan y otorgen su alma al demonio... o alguna otra tonteria por el estilo.

Otra cosa que podria decir es que aun que muchos de los puzzles parecieran acertijos de programación, no los considero completamente como tales ya que las direcciones para guiar las instrucciones no recuerdo ningun programa que se maneje de forma similar, aun que supongo que es una proximación de las funciones que mas adelante se ven como el "go to" o el portal morado. Pero en si dudo que alguien mejore en su habilida de programación con este juego, aun que alguien que sepa programar tal vez se le facilite mas por tener una estructura familiar.

Sin duda esta es una experiencia bastante experimental que me alegra haber probrado, aun que es dificil decir a que clase de persona podria recomendarselo, ¿Amantes de los rompecabezas, de los ponis, de demonios? Quizas la gente simplemente deba darle la oportunidad a ciegas.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PfMjmGQlinA

Pony Island es un juego muy original que sorprende mucho, al ser tan barato pensé al principio que quizás me timaban xd pero decidí tirarme a la piscina y comprarlo (total, vale lo mismo que una barra de pan). Este juego no te defrauda, juega en todo momento contigo rompiendo la cuarta pared y eso es lo que lo hace interesante. Cómprelo si quiere echarse unas risas y que el mismisimo demonio lo visite (okno), me lo va a agradecer. owo

author: {'steamid': '76561198002285053', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1662255856}
review: Pony Island is short and sweet, but it definitely wasn't terrible.  I liked the puzzle aspects and the overall theme of [spoiler]hell/devil/demons.[/spoiler]  It also utilized some [spoiler]intentionally glitch-like[/spoiler] moments very well.  It's not my favorite game, but it was a fun, short, indie experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066404365', 'num_games_owned': 2116, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1661489614}
review:
Um joguinho interessante!

-Curti a proposta do jogo, um jogo simples que algo mais obscuro por trás.
-As partes de programação deram um charme pro jogo, pode ser um pouco confuso pra alguns.
-Tem suporte ao Português o que facilita e muito nessas partes.
-As partes com o pônei também são legais, apesar de serem um pouco repetitivas.
-Tem um chefe lá pro final que é bem criativo a forma que ele faz pra você [spoiler] se distrair e perder. [/spoiler].
-A caça pelos Tickets é bem divertida. Você consegue coletar depois os que faltaram, sem precisar começar um novo jogo.
-É bem curtinho, da pra terminar em menos de 2 horas, adicione mais 1 hora caso queira encontrar todos os Tickets.
-As conquistas são bem fáceis de fazer. 

Recomendo, o preço está bem acessível.

Notinha do random123:

[_] - Perfeitamente daora, né?
[X] - Muito daora, né?
[_] - Daora, né?
[_] - Não tão daora, né?
[_] - Nada daora, né?

author: {'steamid': '76561198070453615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1480558520}

author: {'steamid': '76561198429074257', 'num_games_owned': 1455, 'num_reviews': 1353, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1660815273}
review:
We all love to play games. But what if scary tales in which Satan steals souls through games or licensing agreements are not nonsense, but true?

[b]Pros:[/b][list]
[*]+ Achievements
[*]+ Trading cards
[*]+ Humor
[*]+ Interactive chat
[*]+ Simple controls

[b]Minuses:[/b]
[*]- To pass 100% of achievements - you can't do without a guide[/list]

[b]Total:[/b]
A simple runner game in which we control a Pony. The horse gallops forward, shoots lasers from its eyes and has a pair of wings to overcome obstacles in its path. Several types of opponents that will keep you company. And corporate humor from the author of the fashionable (at the moment) "Inscryption".
You are inside Satan's slot machine - try to survive and get out of there. Preferably without losing your soul along the way...
The game is recommended for fans of "Inscryption", creepy-pastes and modern children's horror stories.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017080513', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1660186764}
review: I [i]would[/i] recommend Pony Island if it were playable for a wider audience. As it is, I'd say it's difficult enough to be challenging to even hard core sidescroller gamers.  It has an overall vibe I very much like -- the subversive nature of it, the humor, etc.  Unfortunately, I can't progress to the game's [i]first boss[/i]. In order to reach it, the player must complete some [i][b][u]much[/u][/b][/i]-too-challenging sidescrolling that's just ridiculous. I won't be able to get any further. Satan's a jerk; I should've expected as much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057506006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1660429519}
review:
Très bon jeu sur différents aspects.

Les puzzles sont à la fois simples, intéressants et originaux avec de bons thèmes.
Les phases de plateforme/shoot sont très simples au début et évoluent pour vous submerger sur la fin, sans pour autant être trop punitives.
Le jeu propose également quelques variations de gameplay avec shoot'em up/3D/jeu textuel/combats de bosses/hacking... tout en proposant une généreuses quantité de secrets, dialogues meta et mêmes de soulever quelques débats.
Évidemment l'aspect principal du jeu, plus que ces puzzles ou ses phases de plateformes, c'est sa narration. 

Personnellement, ses côtés horreur ne me font pas stresser du tout... je vois plus les bruitages, flash lumineux, etc comme des nuisances, plus que comme des sources de stress ou de peur... je trouve également toutes les informations sur l'identité du personnage principale vraiment inutiles et inintéressantes...
Mais le jeu à une identité propre et forte, en articulant ses phases de gameplay, ses mécaniques, ses variations de thèmes, etc... avec efficacité et subtilité.

Le jeu reste un jeu expérimental pas forcément très peaufiné, mais avec de très bonnes forces

author: {'steamid': '76561197993609592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1660412291}
review:
Lo primero, es hacer una advertencia. Si se te da mal jugar el juego del dinosaurio del navegador de Chrome cuando no hay conexión a internet, no juegues a este juego...lo digo por experiencia XD.

El juego mola, a veces te puedes encasquillar en algún punto pero realmente son puzzles sencillos que se pueden sacar enseguida.

Aunque el juego tiene momentos en los que se hace un poco lineal, hay puntos muy divertidos y muchos detalles.

Además, al juego le gusta jugar contigo, especialmente, la última fase del juego es espectacularmente divertida :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198063825413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 804, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1700945385}
review:
Das Spiel Pony Island, das wir in Pony Island spielen, ist ein Spiel, wie es so in den 1980ern einmal existiert hätte haben können, trivial aufgebaut und doch, zumindest damals, als es noch kein 4K und 8-Kern-Prozessor gab, die KiDs an die Konsolen gefesselt hätte hAben dürfen, welches nicht nur nicht soo leicht zu gewinnen iSt, aber noch viel mehr verbugged ist oder maniPuliert wird, jedenfalls von uns angepasst, man nennt es auch gehacked, wird, sO meint man jedenfalls, um eine "verbesserte" VariaNte von PonY Island zu erhalten, was aber vielleicht nicht das eigentliche Thema ist, was aber, selbst wenn ich es wüsste, nIcht verraten wird, weswegen ich nur sagen kann, daSs mir das Spiel nicht sonderlich gefallen hat, weil man doch letzTlich diEses Spiel, welches doch etwas trIvial ist, spielen muss, was mIr nicht soNderlich viEl Spaß machte, zumal ein ständiger lauter Brummton vorherrscht, was erhebLich nervig gewesen war und mir der Finger ächzte unter ständigem geklicke, so dass ich nach einer Stunde, es könnten auch 60 Minuten gewesen sein, es ermÜdet gelassen habe mit dem Eindruck, dass Pony Island sicherlich ein Kunstwerk ist, das aber nicht unbedinGt gespielt werden muss, so wie ich auch nicht Finnegans Wake lesEn werde, auch wenn es eines der bemerkenswertesten Werke der Literatur ist.

[code][b]In Zahlen für mich persönlich ein Unterhaltungswert von 4/10.[/b][/code]

Ein Gag, vielleicht ein guter Gag, den wirklich durchzuspielen mir nicht so erfreulich schien. Da kann auch ein Let's Play genügen.

[hr][/hr]
[i]Dies ist mein subjektiver Spieleindruck. Für meine Wertung zählt, wie gut es mich unterhalten hat. Entsprechend der Daumen nach oben oder unten, abhängig davon, ob ich es einem ähnlich gesinnten Spieler weiterempfehle. Der Spieleindruck eines anderen Spielers kann aber durchaus stark davon abweichen.[/i]

Eine andere Sicht auf das Spiel findet man beispielsweise [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/VeryImpressed/recommended/405640/]hier[/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561198077249957', 'num_games_owned': 549, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1660006431}
review:
I got this in the "Inscryption: Beginners Deck" bundle, and decided that I should play through the developer's games in that bundle chronologically instead of starting Inscryption right away.

Pony Island is a fun puzzle game with an interesting story and several secrets to find. It's not very long, but I enjoyed the time I spent playing this game. I don't have many criticisms to give about the game, except that replaying parts of the game to get to all the secrets was a little tedious ([spoiler]though still not nearlyas painful as it would've been without the chapter select[/spoiler]).

 After playing through both this and the next game in the bundle ("The Hex"), I think I actually enjoyed this one more, despite it seemingly not having nearly as many secrets (nor as much depth overall). It was probably because [spoiler]the story of this game isn't designed to make the player feel dreadful, the ending provides much more closure, and you aren't stuck playing as characters setting out to do awful things. [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198074650032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1611705092}
review:
A fun little experience with a dark sense of humor and some entertaining puzzles. The story of the game is a bit like the style of Undertale, where part of the fun is how it twists around what you have come to expect. I don't want to spoil any moments, but Pony Island does a few things I've never seen any other game do. For such an unassuming sounding game, it actually sticks with you.

Suffice to say, it's about a whole lot more than ponies. But giving away more than that would ruin the fun. It's a quick enough game (I beat it in around 2 hours) and for the price you will definitely get your money's worth. Not every game has to be massive to be worth it. An 8/10 for me

review: While short, this game has an engaging story, wrapped up in a series of puzzles and flashy graphics. It has a few twists, mood changes, and easter eggs. I originally played this game for free on humble bundle a while back, but seeing as it's by an indie dev, and was only $5, i was obligated to pick it up and try it again, since it'd been years since my last playthrough; although i remembered a fair bit of the story, playing it again made me remember how great the game is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096799324', 'num_games_owned': 542, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1661705726}
review:
Pony Island is totally weird and offbeat - but in a totally good way! It's a combination of a skill game, puzzle game, and point & click-like adventure game, with really creative and funny (and sometimes a bit naughty) ideas! 

By the way, I had to cheat to reach 100%, I would have never found all the tickets etc. in my life. But it's worth it, for example, there will be a final boss fight if you find all the tickets ;) 

In my opinion, for every fan of games off the mainstream or fan of somewhat "weird and sinister" games a must-play!

author: {'steamid': '76561198331041406', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1690674572}
review:
I remember back in the day going on YouTube and watching videos about Pony Island and how creepy and 4 wall breaking it was.
It's really nostalgic, to say the least, to re-live those memories in the game.

If I'm being honest, this ain't a game I am constantly thinking of replaying, but it's a really good experience that I recommend to everyone.
And for it being Daniel Mullin's first game, it's a very good experience that really set the bar high for him.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084914425', 'num_games_owned': 527, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1658924307}
review:
Daniel Mullins with another top-tier game about a lovely pink pony on a little island. Almost immediately, things get more interesting than a pink pony as the game blends text puzzling and side-scrolling with DOS-style graphics. It's a unique game that everyone should play and demonstrates more creativity in its design, mechanics and storytelling than most releases from bigger game studios. 
It's a short game, about 3 hours on my play-through. 100% completion would probably take another 2-3 hours. For the price of a cup of coffee, you can experience this great little game, it's worth it, and it's a must-buy if you see it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198366935877', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1658130667}
review:
私が感じたマイナス要素は下記の2点です。
それでもこのゲームを体験できて良かったと思います。
短時間でプレイできるゲームですが、内容、ビジュアル、サウンド、どれも大好きです。

・日本語化がちょっと大変
・アクション?要素がちょっときつい

日本語化が結構面倒なのですが、母国語が日本語ならぜひ日本語で遊んでほしいです。
困ったら→[spoiler]親切なレビュアーの方が比較的簡単に導入できる手がかりを書いてくれていますのでそちらを参考に。[/spoiler]

シューティング(東方Normalが限界)やアクション(あらゆるマリオで挫折)が死ぬほど苦手な私は、何度もかわいいPonyちゃんを頃してしまってなかなか進めない箇所がありました。
そんな私でも何度も挑めばクリアできる程度なので、かなり簡単に作られていると思います。安心して遊んでほしいです。

review:
[quote][h1] Highly Recommended: 8.5/10 [/h1][/quote]

An interesting new take on games and an excellent first entry for the dev who has essentially created a new game genre that involves layers upon layers of meta-game, game and game inside of the game which pairs beautifully with the story and characters in it. This game can be a little painful to 100% due to some RnG factors, but if you aren't achievement hunting there is little to be said on the negative side.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286807209', 'num_games_owned': 321, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1657625495}
review:
Интересная история с забавным геймплеем.

Преимущественно, управление в игре осуществляется с помощью мыши.
Есть два режима, которые встречаются в игре:
1. Банальное перепрыгивание препятствий, при этом убивая противников.
2. Головоломка, смахивающая на расставлением команд в программном коде. Вам понравится еще больше, если вы имеете представление о любом языке программирования.

Шикарный троллинг от Asmodeus xDD

author: {'steamid': '76561198335546395', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1657598104}
review: horrendously boring. Puzzles are very lame and stale after doing relatively the same type of puzzle 20+ times. I'm not even sure why you made that one 3d part where you jump over some 3d fences for a full minute before reaching the 3d flag. It was so incredibly stupid and uncreative to have that. The ending of escaping with the ponies felt great, for 20 seconds before being back to the stale jumping and firing. It was a cool trick how a friend on steam messages you to distract you. The other little tricks are mediocre, even if it's just pixel other games have been a lot more creative with tricks like "dude stop". The pixel affects/glitch affects are decent but not nearly as amazing as Tamashii's/Teocida's glitches and pixel art. Not sure why people love this game so muc, we get it, it's a pony but jeez this game is so boring and uncreative. If you want an S tier puzzle game play The Room. If you want an S tier demonic game play Tamashii, Teocida and Estigma (all by Vikintor). This game just has baby demonic elements in it that it's insulting. I love games/movies that are demonic so this game is very insulting for being so weak, stale, and uncreative about it. I wish i had played this game right away that way i could get a refund but sadly i got to this after 2 weeks had passed. NOT worth 5$ unless you want to see how boring it is to then refund it after. Thankfully i got this during steam summer sale so i didn't waste a full 5$.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025361262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1657424872}
review:
Pony Island is a short and sweet indie puzzle game. While it has horror themes, I wouldn't call this a horror game and I'd recommend not buying it if you're expecting scares. In your 2-2.5 hours of gameplay, you'll be playing many repetitive pony levels and solving puzzles with the occasional boss fight. I didn't like the generic pony levels and found them very repetitive. I mindlessly played through them unless it was a special level. The game is at its best when you're playing the desktop sections and searching for well-hidden secrets. 

If you have an evening free, I'd recommend this on sale.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198026565056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 603, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1657308426}
review:
|Bottom of the Bin Review|
Pony Island is a pixel puzzle horror game. You are stuck in a limbo like arcade machine playing a game about ponies... the devil has a thing for ponies, who knew. This is one of those screw with you games, which did get me off guard. Honestly it only tricked me, cause the person messaging me, I haven't heard from in awhile and I was super confused okay. The puzzles are easy enough, and the arcadey parts were fun. There are multiple endings and hidden secrets. And I'm glad it was long enough for one sitting, cause I think it would lose something if it when on too long, you get what I'm saying. I highly recommend this, and glad my friend forced me to play it........ I'm not in an arcade machine right now right? rIgHt? aNd I gIvE tHiS a 5/5.

Bottom of the Bin Video
https://youtu.be/DY-H5ANel-4

author: {'steamid': '76561198030906347', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1656923816}
review:
Wouldn't recommend it at full price, but on sale this is worth a buy.

It's a meta game, in case it wasn't obvious, where the game knows you're 'playing' a game and makes interesting gameplay challenges through it. The actual 'game' sections were kinda boring though - it involves left clicking to jump over obstacles, holding right click to shoot down enemies and sometimes holding left click to glide. There's nothing more to the game sections and they felt kinda boring to be honest.

The story is pretty neat, and I definitely didn't get through all of it as there's hidden story bits behind taking different choices (and you can go back to sections of the game as you like once you've finished the game), but I didn't want to go through the pony games again so I called it quits after 2 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272978189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1656863258}
review:
Не игра с привычным геймплеем, а, скорее, интересный интерактивный экспириенс. Очень много "пост", "мета" и всего вот этого.

Проходится быстро, удовольствие приносит, много лол-моментов. Пару раза со слома четвертой стены в самом лучшем смысле угарнул. [spoiler] Особенно в моменте с "написать гадость" и последующим письмом от друга. [/spoiler]

Чего-то такого и ожидал, поэтом рекомендую.

review: I gave the Inscryption demo a try first and immediately fell in love with that game, so I looked at the developer's other offerings too. His games look to be right up my alley. I've finished Pony Island and love it. I still need to finish Inscryption, and I have yet to play The Hex, but I have high hopes for it. The dark humor and twists on mechanics was really fun, imho. I'm really looking forward to the next game by this developer!

review: Mais um daqueles jogos que simula um computador antigo e uma IA maluca que quer te prender nele. A diferença é que dessa vez a IA é o próprio diabo e ele quer a sua alma. Precioso juego de plataformas para los más hardcore gamers, al principio puede parecer muy simple pero sus mecánicas de plataformeo lo convierten en un esencial del género. Muy elaborada la customización del pony y una interfaz clara y muy bien diseñada, para su precio (666€) está perfecto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198422199704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 431, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1656257125}
review:
Okay, honestly, i was expecting more from this game, especially this genre. But I've probably played a little too much of these and the element of surprise is long gone. The mind blowing part of the game seems a bit less even close to 0 for me, but there's still humor that made me laugh so I can say i still enjoy it nonetheless. The platforming (shooting?) part is pretty mediocre in both difficulty and stage setup so, they kinda felt a bit too easy for veteran platformer, but probably just right for amateur player so I can't say it's bad either. The Chat AI of the game isn't great and very unresponsive, which made the whole type your own question and sentence thing looks.. extra and needless. And speaking of extra, the Secret Ending really seemed like an "extra" entertain just to get the completionist to delete the game a.s.a.p... which... imo.. is a well done expression. Especially with the expressionless last boss. lol!

For those who haven't played a lot of this genre, i bet you can still get quite a lot of mind blowing surprise from it. For those who played a lot of this genre, this will come out as a "meh" game... for completionist, the hidden stuffs are still fun to find and collect, as well as getting that secret ending after all that work is rewarding(?)

Also, there's a bug that disable certain keys like Enter and Backspace on our keyboard if we have a controller/gamepad plugged in. One that made the game completely unplayable because we will get stuck at the stage where we need to type out the answers. Although unplugging the controller and restarting the game fixed it. This type of ridiculous bug shouldn't really exist in the first place.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977642500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1656126275}
review:
I mean... it's okay.  Maybe it was cool when it came out, but I've already played quite a lot of these games with meta-narratives before.  But this one's core gameplay is really tedious and repetitive.   

Play this if your mind is easily blown away by clever plot twists.  But if you've already watched hundreds of movies and shows and read books and played lots of story-driven games... 

maybe buy this on sale?  I got it for 2 bucks.

review: this game i really had no idea what i was in for but man its very different from the rest with good humor and puzzles (this game has lore right?). and a weird atmosphere from what i know it seems your playing some old haunted video game type thing. but man this game can feel a little predictable but for the time this game came out the haunted game trope was new so its fine. but i haven't really played any ''meta'' games like DDLC and such but man at one point in the game it really caught me off guard when it did happen and this game is weird but just fun so i recommend ( the game isn't scary btw ). the price point is nice and most if not everyone should play this game. my final verdict is 7.9 to 8.3 out of 10. thank you for your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198981677022', 'num_games_owned': 787, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1655637757}
review:
Даниэль вы гений! Ваш проект заслуженно награжден steam award 2017!
Эти 3 часа будут незабываемы! Геймплей скромен, но чертовски увлекателен. Головоломки легкие, кроме одной с бабочкой. И как же мне нравится стилистика этой игры! Особенно демоны. Выглядят как ярлыки. А также музыка. Финальный саундтрек божественен. Ну и самое главное это то как игра манипулирует игроком. Особенно предфинальный босс Асмодей. Не буду спойлерить, но скажу то, что я реально подумал что меня взломали. 
Именно таких шедевров сейчас не хватает игровой индустрии.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114965702', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 482, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1655584458}
review:
2016年发售，年轻人的第一款元游戏。
那个时候元游戏概念还没有火，那个时候facebook还不叫meta。
游戏并不算难，但是剧情倒是很有深意.
不要因为没有英文就止步不前，实际上所需英文水平异常简单。

author: {'steamid': '76561198049447352', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1655222867}
review:
Валялась на аккаунте много лет, вдруг решил пройти. Может, для 2016 года это было неплохо, но сейчас воспринимается как занудство. Головоломки безынтересные и однообразные, сюжет скучный и довольно банальный, секреты находятся на раз, персонаж, за которого мы играем (чтобы понять, надо покопаться в сюжете), не очень коррелирует со всем остальным — что история персонажа добавляет игре? Да в общем-то ничего, это просто рандомный выпендрёж автора. Аркадная часть с пони, хоть поначалу и весёлая, быстро наскучивает.

И да, я выбил все ачивки, прочитал весь текст, нашёл все секреты и скрытые концовки. Я во всех играх так делаю. И, несмотря на это, Pony Island меня не впечатлила. Повторюсь, наверное, для 2016 года это был инди-прорыв, не знаю, но в 2022 оно смотрится скучно.

С другой стороны, в том же году вышла Stardew Valley, в которую я с удовольствием иногда играю до сих пор, и которая тоже "до безобразия является инди-игрой". Так что...

author: {'steamid': '76561197970477239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1654720850}
review: Wanted to play Inscryption so thought I'd get the first two Daniel Mullins games to get some ideas of how he operates. :) Pleased to say that this is a brilliant game and I really don't want to spoil anything. Narratively, it's similar to There Is No Game: Wrong Dimension - you spend most of the game 'hacking' into a video game that has been coded by the Devil, meaning basic pony jumping games (sounds better than it is), then pseudo-code puzzles to proceed. An unsettling script helps to reinforce the atmosphere of being trapped in a possessed computer. The very best point in the game is towards the end during the final boss fight when he simply asks you to just focus on him, easy right? First two rounds I never took my eyes off him and passed the tests, then it breaks the fourth wall and had me genuinely worried that I had done something outside of the game that was going to make me no friends....attention lost, as I try to tab out of the game - I'm dead - awesome, really had me for a few minutes. Great little game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089200473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1654947327}
review:
Wyśmienita gra bawiąca się konwencją i oczekiwaniami gracza. Wcielamy się w duszę uwięzioną w automacie do gier przez samego Szatana. Musimy się z nim zmierzyć grając w uroczą grę o kucykach, która powoli staje się coraz bardziej dziwna.

Gameplay jest różnorodny i praktycznie przez cały czas zaskakuje nowymi elementami. To jest najlepsze w tej grze, nie można być pewnym tego co wydarzy się za chwilę. Sama końcówka to pokaz ogromnej kreatywności autora i byłem tak zaskoczony, że musiałem chwilę przetrawić to co zobaczyłem. Świetne wykorzystywanie systemów gry na sposoby, których nie widuje się raczej nigdzie indziej. Główne minigry są przyjemne i stanowią wyzwanie. Mamy tu tytułowe kuce, gdzie biegamy i pokonujemy przeszkody, a także prostą grę logiczną zahaczającą o podstawy programowania. Brzmi trudno i czasem trzeba trochę pogłówkować, ale jest fajnie przedstawione i wciąga. Do tego masa innych, szalonych sekcji, a każda ma swój urok. 

Na początku może być ciężko przyzwyczaić się do grafiki przez czerń, bier, dużo efektów i elementów na ekranie. Ale jest bardzo stylowo i ładnie oddaje to szaleństwo historii. Przy czym styl graficzny też potrafi się dość często zmieniać i chwile szaleństwa są przeplatane tymi spokojniejszymi.

Grę nie jest trudno ukończyć i zakończenie jest ciekawe, ale widać, że kryje się za nim bardziej rozbudowana historia, którą można odkryć maksując grę. Jeszcze jej nie poznałem do końca, ale na pewno jestem zaintrygowany. Podsumowując, bardzo ciekawe doświadczenie, pozwalające nieco inaczej spojrzeć na same gry. Polecam mocno.

author: {'steamid': '76561198234230228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 348, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1654330222}
review:
好酷的meta。但也没有酷到不行。

就很奇怪，小游戏的趣味和难度恰到好处，宗教背景的设定也吸引人，但说不出为什么总感觉差点意思。可能是所谓psychological horror不够horrifying吧。就比如deus那关，我相信谁在第一次收到朋友消息都会莞尔吧。比较符合本作气质的我认为是路线rpg的那一关，但可惜内容比较匮乏，流程也有些短，玩法也有点重复。

说到底就是两种风格缝合在一起不谐了。草莓很好吃，麻婆豆腐也很好吃，但是麻婆豆腐里放草莓我看你是在为难我胖虎。

好像也不太恰当。我应该是想说内容不够深。还有hack进账户，好多地方都是王炸创意，但是也全都浅尝辄止，疯狂重复跳马和逻辑开锁这种游戏型流程。然后这种玩法吧，又不够真的畅快，只能靠着不卡关来做到不加分也不减分。

全成就全结局有点玩不动。

author: {'steamid': '76561198825431360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1645898664}
review:
存外面白くなかった。
プレイの殆どを占めるゲームパートが古臭い2dアクションで、そういうテーマなのだから批判するのは的はずれなのだが、それにしても長く、それでいて気を張っていないと死ぬ調整なのでプレイしていて苦痛だった。謎解き要素も腑に落ちてしまう構成と言うか、ひらめきや捻りのようなものがあまりなく残念だった。
雰囲気と設定が凝っている一方でゲームとして面白くなるべき要素がカスカス過ぎたため、普通のゲームとインタラクティブフィクションを差別化する要素だけで構成されたハリボテのような感触だった。
こういうメタ的な演出の多いゲームが好きなだけに残念。

author: {'steamid': '76561198433829205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1654290859}
review:
[i]Quien diría que un juego de ponis se iba a tornar tan extraño y de plano satánico, veamos de que va Pony Island y tratar de liberar tu alma.[/i]

-----
[h1]+Contexto del juego: [/h1]
[list]
[*]Desarrollado y distribuido por Daniel Mullins Games, Pony island es uno de sus primeros títulos creados por ellos, que tras un game jam y la ayuda de streamers, el estudio pudo sacar a lucir su título, además de no parar, siguiendo con el desarrollo de The Hex y el reciente Inscryption. La compañía está en sus primeros años, quien sabe lo que tendremos en un futuro cercano.
[/list]

[h1]+Historia: [/h1]
[list]
[*]Controlamos a una persona que se encuentra en el limbo, directamente se pondrá a jugar Pony Island, un juego de arcade un tanto curioso, porque parece no estar terminado. 
[*]La historia es un tanto simple, pero el como es contada, he ahí la magia del título, el juego constantemente te plantea varias cuestiones, búsqueda de información y decisiones, siempre hay nuevas opciones por las cuales expandir la historia.
[*]Algo importante es que el titulo hace muchas alusiones al ocultismo, así que si alguien es sensible a estos temas quizá el titulo no sea de su agrado. De mi parte, siento que solo juguetea con estos conceptos, no es extremo con las referencias al señor de las 3am.
[/list]

[h1]+Gameplay: [/h1]
[list]
[*]Es un juego de puzles que rompen la 4ta pared, además de tener cosillas de plataformero y amidakuji.
[*]Es complicado definir el gameplay sin ir a los spoilers, pero lo más básico es que el juego pide varias veces que busques información dentro de carpetas, menú de opciones, cuadros ocultos o listas de códigos. El juego siempre tendrá una salida, pero el encontrarlo es lo complicado y divertido. Algo por agregar es que el titulo hace muchas bromas a otros géneros de juegos y a la industria en general.
[*]Tiene pequeñas secciones de plataformero al mas puro estilo del dinosaurio de Google, un endless runner donde tendremos un poni, que adquirirá habilidades con pequeños desafíos por superar.
[*]También tenemos secuencias de amidakuji, que son niveles donde tendremos que guiar a un patrón que se desplaza hacia abajo, la idea es llegar al final con ciertos requisitos. Son algo fáciles, pequeñas distracciones a la locura que es la historia.
[*]Al terminar el juego podemos elegir capítulos para sacar los logros. También tenemos algunos coleccionables en forma de tickets, muy ocultos para sacarle todo el jugo a la experiencia.

[*]Ahora veamos algunos problemas:
-A veces si a veces no: Lo divertido del título (la búsqueda de información) puede ser un tanto confuso, a veces no es tan obvio, hay que tener mucho ojo en todo lo que hacemos. 
[/list]

[h1]+Gráficos: [/h1]
[list]
[*]Son impecables, sabe cómo engañar al jugador con su apariencia, además que le da un estilo visual muy único (al momento de romper la 4ta pared). 
[*]Un pequeño detalle es que el juego está adaptado para otra época, porque algunas bromas no se adaptaron del todo bien al Windows 10 o más.
[/list]

[h1]+Música y sonido: [/h1]
[list]
[*]Musicalmente no hay tonadas memorables, pero si hay momentos donde tensarte con música chiptune. Los sonidos también están en la misma categoría. 
[/list]

[h1]+Accesibilidad: [/h1]
[list]
[*]Tiene texto en español y otros idiomas.
[*]Se puede jugar con mouse, con algunas entradas para jugar con teclado. El juego te recomienda usar un mouse, el trackpad puede tener errores (ambos clics a la vez).
[*]El menú de opciones tiene una amplia gama de resoluciones. 
[/list]

-----
[h1]+En síntesis: [/h1]
[list]
[*]¿Podrás liberar tu alma del extraño juego Pony Island? Inténtalo, te sorprenderá lo maniobrero que es el título. Quien sabe que pasará con este mundo de ponis y su extraño lore detrás. Una primera gran joya de Daniel Mullins. 
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198846565027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1643467370}
review:
この手のゲームが好きな自分ですが、このゲームは微妙でした。こっちで勝手にハードルを上げてた感は否めないですが...。

値段が安いから試す価値はあるでしょうし、そもそも圧倒的に好評なんだからそっちを信じて買うのが普通でしょうが、自分には合わなかったです。

以下ネタバレあり。ストーリーが分かるような直接的なネタバレはほぼ書いてませんので、大体どういうゲームか見当ついている人は見ても大丈夫です。

[spoiler]横スク２Dを中心に展開されるこのゲームですが、その操作性が微妙です。あとゲームとして単純に面白くない上に無駄に長いです。アクション的な面白さを求めて買うことがそもそもないにせよ、やっぱりこの時間は面白くないです。また、パズル要素も「ああ、そうですか」というレベルのものしかなく、あくまで演出を楽しむためにすぎません。待つ時間の方が答えを導く時間より長くなってしまう程です。何度も言いますが、「そこはどうでもいいだろ！」とも反論できますが、そうとはいえ、パズルやってる時間は面白くないな...と思っちゃいますし、演出だけが楽しいならもう映像見ます...という印象です。

また、ビジュアルに関しても、基本モノクロに色収差ガン掛け・ブラウン管的なエフェクト・グリッチといった比較的簡素で代わり映えのないものなので、個人的には飽きの来る見た目でした。

結局メタゲーはストーリーと表現方法に尽きると思ったりもします。その表現方法がイマイチというか、無理につまらないシンプルなゲームを挟んで冗長になっているのが、このゲームが自分に合ってないポイントでした。もちろん、ゲームで表現しないとつじつまが合いづらいことは承知ですが、それでももっとRPGやADV探索ゲーのように、自分から選択肢に対してアクションし、適度に分岐しながら進めていく形を前面にとった方が、メタゲーとして綺麗にまとまっているし、没入感もあるように（自分には）思えます。メタゲー好きな方は、このゲームがインディーメタゲーの先駆的作品であることを考慮した上で購入・プレイする方がいいと思います。[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198069635016', 'num_games_owned': 2885, 'num_reviews': 808, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1653678872}
review:
[h1]Либо всё ты ПОНИмаешь иль совсем не догоняешь...[/h1]

[b]Pony Island[/b] - это мета-иронично-инфернальная аркада с элементами программирования и чат-болталки.

Условно игра раскладывается на три составляющие:

1) Двухкнопочный платформер, в котором мы прыгаем пони-единорого-трицератопсом через ограждения. 
Для открытия новых, усложненных врагами, уровней и способностей [spoiler]лазырить и планировать[/spoiler] нужно ломать код игры.
Предусмотрено также тактическое хождение по квадратам на глобальной карте. 

2) Правка кода или "Циклорешалка", где надо расставлять различные указатели для движения курсора по программному коду в правильном порядке и в правильное время. Сами строки изменять не дают, т.к. потенциальный игрок ещё слишком юн.
Разбавляется появлением лишь появлением [spoiler]указателя-телепорта[/spoiler].
На поздних этапах игры приобретает другую форму и немного содержания, однако суть не меняется.

3) Лазанье по компьютеру - кликанье по доступным в данный момент программам в надежде двинуть сюжет.
В конечном итоге оно приводит либо к болтанию с инфернитами, либо к платформингу, либо к правке кода.

Всё это замазано на истории, что мы - [spoiler]убитый в походе на Иерусалим крестоносец, застрявший в лимбо-игровом автомате[/spoiler]. Видать, в Аду уже давно обязательны курсы компьютерной грамотности и использование арабских цифр!
Болтание по всем составляющим разбавляют глюками программ типа сыпящегося меню или ускользающего окна.
Реально неожиданный момент только один и зависит от вашей дружелюбности.
Ещё можно собирать билеты в неожиданных местах, чтобы сразиться с истинным боссом и ускакать в ночь...

Что-то как-то не зашло.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198279446929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1651035307}
review:
Pony Island was one of the first games I spun for a new streaming schedule of mine, and honestly, it was a weird but strong foot to start on.

Let's start with the weak points, and there's only three:
1. The difficulty: It fluctuates, A LOT! Sometimes, it's a really easy thing, and other times it's confusing to all heck as how you're supposed to get through a section (Jesus Christ is making me cross).
2. The volume: It is LOUD. I had my headphones on half volume and my stream was turned down and it was still LOUD. The music and ambiance were frankly wayyyyy too loud at times.
3. The length: The length of the game kinda hurts my feelings towards it. It's a really short game, which shouldn't take you more than three hours, even if you are messing around and not very good at the game. But, that's okay considering the other good parts.

Now the meh stuff, and there's only one thing here:
The gameplay loop: It's honestly fun, but with the difficulty being fluctuating, it feels like it drags the game down a bit. But it's not bad, but it's not great. It's just, good.

Now the good stuff:
1. The Puzzles: The puzzles really are one of the shining points for this game. As short as they are and how like, scarcer they become, they're one of the strongest parts to this game because they're simple, but enjoyable. One of the strongest parts of the game by far.
2. The Secrets: The secrets are honestly not terrible. They're good in that they collecting of tickets is fun to figure out the weird things you need to do to get them. And that's not a bad thing. Certainly made me feel good when I managed tp figure different ones out.
3. The Story: The story is simple, and that's why it's good. It doesn't overstay it's welcome, and it's not overly complicated. I won't spoil it, but it's a really good story, and the gameplay compliments it really well.
4: The Music: It's honestly surprisingly good. Despite my gripes with the music being too loud, it's honestly quite good music. There's not a single track that I heard when playing the game where I thought "Ugh this music blows." GG to the composers. The electronic beats and general atmosphere really was quite good for each and every scene.

TL;DR
I'd rate this game a 3.5 out of 5 for it's merits and it's price point. I'd highly recommend getting this game in the Inscryption beginner bundle as it's more than worth getting at that price point. It's a good game with a few things that I didn't enjoy, but they seemed more personal to me. Overall: Good game, would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122158599', 'num_games_owned': 358, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1650350678}
review:
It was an interesting experience! Did i have fun? Yes. Will i go raving to my friends about it? No. The game has a lot of elements to it. The actual gameplay is pretty simple and somewhat tedious even though there is some progression in difficulty throughout the game. The fun comes from the story and the dialogue and finding little secrets and exploring every new area. It's like an interactive VN, Point and click, puzzle and google not responding jump over stuff game mixed all into one.
Def isn't going to win any game of the year awards. But I was bored. It made 3 hours of my life enjoyable and for that I thank Pony Island.
Also i knew Lucifer was a brony that fuckin weirdo

author: {'steamid': '76561198062247697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1649579283}
review:
WTF did I just play? It is a game about playing a cursed game. I guess?

Seriously, give Pony Island a try. It is short, simple but it is VERY unique. It is mostly a puzzle + arcade game but the best part is the plot. There are a bunch of endings too (3? 4? I'm not sure I got them all), collectibles, achievements, selling your soul to sat- erm, ponies and butterflies!

Linux port was flawless, thanks for supporting the penguin! Achievements were also great and worked fine. I'd recommend playing spoiler-free first. After finishing, you get access to previous Stages and you can collect stuff/hunt cheevos in peace.

review:
É um joguinho curto, mas bastante divertido.

Afinal você é um pônei, não teriam como errar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039802118', 'num_games_owned': 2265, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1648780232}
review:
How to hack out of hell the game.
Pony Island is a game where you do simple puzzles, and runner segments under the narrative that you are a guy in hell being forced to play a terrible game. 


Pros:
Short but good story
good boss fights
easy to get all achevements

cons:
some meta jokes don't work well anymore


in short:
If you want a cheap game that is dark, funny, and has meta commentary this is the game for you

P.S. Their is a my little pony joke hear somewhere

author: {'steamid': '76561198841832827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1648152033}
review:
Es un juegazo, al ver el titulo uno supone que por el nombre va a ser un juego así nomas. Pero no se puede estar más equivocado.

El juego es bastante variado, con puzzles entretenidos y tiene una historia que te atrapa hasta querer llegar a la verdad. Capaz el jefe final decepciona porque no hay que hacer nada literalmente, aunque el resto de jefes están bastante a la altura. Un aspecto a destacar es lo inmersivo que se vuelve el juego en algunas partes, sobre todo en las partes cuando se simula que estás manejando una computadora.

En fin, excelente juego y muy recomendable de probar.

PD: Me gusto ese detalle que cuando peleas contra el tercer Boss "Simule" que te habla un amigo random de Steam, me quede re loco con eso y suma mucho a la inmersión.

author: {'steamid': '76561198291680630', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1647917608}
review:
Considero que lo recibí de forma gratuita ya que vino en un pack, por lo que no lo voy a tener en cuenta como compra: yo compré Inscryption. Se nota que es la base de ese juego, ya que la turbiedad que maneja y los diálogos y la trama, si bien no tiene nada que ver a ese otro juego, recuerda mucho a él. Creo que es un juego bastante sencillo, llama la atención lo distinto que es a una historia normal de un videojuego, pero tampoco sé si lo recomendaría ampliamente. Le doy mano arriba ya que fue entretenido el viaje, pero no considero que pueda llegar a ser un juego que estés obligado a tener en tu biblioteca o un 'must buy', ya que directamente creo que no lo compraría. 
¿Por qué le doy mano arriba? Básicamente está regalado, 70 pesos en Argentina no es NADA, y para su contenido, claramente debería valer más que una coca. Dura muy poco, por lo que la historia es rápida y no tan densa, siendo este un buen planteo de los desarrolladores.

author: {'steamid': '76561199015409876', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1646562635}
review: Played through this after playing through the Hex, expecting a similarly enjoyable and perplexing experience and was not disappointed. Mullins successfully creates a universe here that feels compelling and expectation-breaking. A must play for fans of Mullins' other works and I would suggest for many lovers of video games in general. I do comment that if you choose to play this via trackpad, expect some difficulties and the game itself does not recommend this; and to add to that, there is some emphasis on fine mouse movement that I felt was a bit too high in terms of making the game fully accessible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072298009', 'num_games_owned': 4503, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 686, 'last_played': 1454997654}
review:
This game was incredible, highly recommended.  All I can really say is the game's not what it appears to be at first.  It gets weird, and very cool.  There's also a bit more to uncover as the game goes along, it's hard to describe without spoiling anything, just play it.

------------------------------
Completionist Review:
Rating: Good
DLC Achievements: No DLC
Can be completed in one run:  Yes, kinda of, at least all in one save file anyways
Chapter Select: Kind of?  Game is weird.
Game is not over when you think it is either, keep playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072717002', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1645824464}
review:
I really don't understand the hype behind this game. 
Really cool concept, don't get me wrong, but it's been done before and better.
I love the whole corrupted, evil game concept, but here it's held down by almost offensively boring gameplay.
Plus, the story falls flat in the end, so the one good thing the game has going for it isn't done well.
You are much better off just watching a playthrough, you'd get roughly the same experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138167057', 'num_games_owned': 471, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1645724402}
review: A super enjoyable game. I enjoy all the 4th wall breaks it throws at you, I don't want to spoil anything, but the final, boss fight had me apologizing to my friend (if you know whats up you know). A very fun to follow story line with fun secrets to find, one which i only found on my second play through. Def suggest anyone who enjoys a story based game to give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025511676', 'num_games_owned': 2510, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1645106083}
review: Fantastic little game! The gameplay itself is rather simple and when negative reviews describe it as repetitive and sometimes outright tedious, I can see where they're coming from. The eponymous "Pony Island" is an autorunner game where you jump over obstacles and attack approaching enemies - it never gets more complex than that. It's interfused with a "coding" game in which a cursor automatically steps through the program and you have to direct it towards the goal making sure necessary conditions are fulfilled. While that's clearly more demanding than piloting an autorunner, it's still fairly straightforward, most of all if you're used to more challenging puzzle games and know how to code. However, this game is brimming with unique ideas, cleverly hidden secrets and well-executed fourth wall breaks that made the entire experience incredibly enjoyable and worthwhile for me *despite* the objectively present repetitions. I felt repeatedly baffled. But bored? Not once!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011506911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1649205108}
review:
Pony Island is short and sweet and certainly doesn't overstay its welcome. Despite the uneasy and unsettling atmosphere, I was pulled in enough to complete this in one sitting.

The trapped-in-a-video game premise is well done and the meta-game is fun to watch unravel as you play through.

The art style is great, and the soundtrack is a delight.

Well worth your time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198958835979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1644974186}
review: Pony Island is the debut work of Daniel Mullens. It's nothing absolutely groundbreaking, but sets the tone for what you can sort of expect from him. It is the tone of ARG's in the mid 2010's. Of fun little diversions from reality fleshed out to surprising degrees. It is at once novel and yet oddly nostalgic. It's certainly not the best game I've ever played, but it would be a lie to not say it was one of the well-made ones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111811696', 'num_games_owned': 1587, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1635813812}
review:
Очень ценю игры, которые внутри выглядят и играются так же, как ожидаешь по обложке. Эта одна из таких: если вы ждёте, что это будет мрачная, но не особо тонкая издёвка над классическими аркадами - то так и будет. Кроме того, игра будет короткой и будет предлагать интерактив и головоломки, стилизованные под взлом компьютера. Короче, обзор в общем-то не нужен %)

Игру можно разделить на линейную часть и механическую. С одной стороны, мы хотим узнать, что будет дальше, как развернётся противоборство сил, что персонажи скажут друг другу и что вообще случилось. С другой стороны, это всё-таки игра и тут есть свой вызов, свой геймплей. Впрочем, игра не ставит перед игроком особой сложности во время прохождения. Сюжет и атмосфера для неё явно важней. Хотя в целом для желающих углубиться есть возможность поизучать мир, найти коллекционки, пасхалки и даже опциональные штуки, которые потом помогают в прохождении. Пройти игру у меня заняло 2.5ч, не особо углубляясь в побочки.

С другой стороны, я слышала, что эта игра сильно разрекламирована как глубокая и прорывная. Ну, может в 2016 это был прорыв и новая идея, но с тех пор появилась масса игр про хакерство, программирование, застревание в компьютере и прямое взаимодействие с игроком. Возможно, Pony Island как-то повлиял на это. Однако сейчас игра выглядит как дерзкая, но не инновационная.

Короче, рекомендую тем, кому понравились скриншоты %)

author: {'steamid': '76561199230809641', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1702966708}
review:
A short Breakout-Success game, but don't let that stop you from giving in a playthru. Even if I am late coming to the party with Mullins' games, I still had a lot of fun poking at this game, annoying the evil A.I that is trying to trap your soul and solving the hacking puzzles. If you like The Hex or Inscryption, then you'll get a kick out of this one. Pony Island is the first of many great subversive games and deserves a little spot on the shelf. 

Also has one of the best trickeries from the game.. made me look away from the boss thinking my game actually crashed causing me to fail the test of the boss. Don't look away peeps, Don't Look Away.

author: {'steamid': '76561199040223659', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1687771634}
review:
Me encantó.

Yo sabía que este juego era bueno y famoso por romper la cuarta pared, pero jugarlo fue una cosa completamente distinta, la historia no es algo ultra complejo pero que la hayan implementado de la forma en la que lo hicieron lo vuelve muy original. Hay miles de sorpresas dentro del juego que si las digo arruinaría la experiencia. Por más que conozcan de que va o hayan visto un par de cosas pruebenlo igual, no tiene desperdicio.

No olviden desisntalar el juego cuando lo terminen :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198931044200', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1644370932}
review:
UN JUEGO QUE ROMPE LA CUARTA PARED DE MANERA INCREÍBLE

 Pony Island es uno de los juegos mas extraños y bizarros que se puede jugar nunca. La razón de esto es que el juego nunca para de recordarnos que lo estamos jugando, y todos sus puzzles son resueltos de maneras poco convencionales que con creatividad pueden ser resueltos.

 De la historia simplemente no se puede hablar, porque el juego es demasiado corto y porque mientras menos sepas más la vas a disfrutar. Solo tienes que saber que, aunque no te pondrá emotivo, te sacará constantemente del comfort al que los videojuegos nos tienen acostumbrados, y esto lo hace único.

 Gráficamente, el juego tiene muy pocos píxeles, pero los efectos de distorción, el diseño de niveles y puzzles harán que realmente el juego se sienta como una pieza que jamás se repetirá.

 Su jugabilidad es maravillosa. Sus niveles de "acción" se sienten rítmicos y precisos, y cada uno de sus puzzles se siente extremadamente diferente al anterior. Jugar el par de horas que dura este juego te mantendrá enganchado de principio a fin, y un poco más.

 El apartado sonoro nos recuerda que estamos en un juego que, aunque no trata de horrorizarnos, nos perturba e incomoda constantemente con sus efectos oscuros y perturbadores. Tiene casi 2 canciones, pero ambas son excelentes y se sienten muy épicas, haciendo que las escenas de acción se sientan realmente como una aventura.

 Poco y nada se puede decir de Pony Island sin arruinarle la experiencia a alguien, pues vale muchísimo la pena. Si te llama la atención, simplemente cómpralo, sabiendo que lo normal es perturbarte y romper la cuarta pared como ningún otro juego ha hecho jamás.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120870045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1644357711}
review:
Ayant joué à Inscryption auparavant (le dernier jeu fait par le studio), j'ai été très agréablement surpris de voir que ce jeu est fidèle à ses descendants. Je vais séparer en plusieurs parties ma critique afin que vous soyez au clair sur ce que le jeu peut proposer de mieux (ou de pire).

Gameplay : Plutôt minimaliste voir décevant quand on a joué à Inscryption avant, le jeu se résume pas mal à juste spammer les clics gauches au bon moment et bourré le clic droit sur tous les mobs de ce monde. Néanmoins, le jeu réserve beaucoup de surprise et ajout comme des casses-tête d'une difficulté moyennes qui ne vous feront pas galérer longtemps et qui s'imbriquent bien dans la progression linéaire du jeu. En sommes, ne vous attendez pas à du gameplay de fou furieux, le gameplay est juste là pour accompagner l'histoire.

Graphismes : Très minimalistes, on a énormément de noir, blanc et de ligne de texte parfois austère, parfois un peu énervé. Néanmoins, variations de graphismes sauront se faire ressentir notamment lors de phase de boss.

Histoire : Alors il paraît au premier abord confus et il est vrai que le jeu (tout comme inscryption) ne nous donne pas toute les réponses et nous laisse un peu sur notre "faim" quant à la compréhension de l'univers. Mais un peu de recherche de symbolisme et de petit messages cachés permettent déjà de mieux cerner les tenants et aboutissant du jeu. Donc histoire sympathique, assez original mais pas évidente à saisir.

Conclusion : Je lui met un 14 / 20 facile, le jeu vaut largement ses quelques euros et est sympa à refaire pour obtenir tous les tickets. Cependant, c'est pas un jeu qui a vraiment marqué l'histoire selon moi, il est plutôt timide en contenu. Ainsi, je vous conseil vivement à la suite de celui-là de repartir sur Inscription ou Hex, deux autres jeux sorties par ce développeurs et qui sont plus aboutis et prometteurs que ce que Pony Island peut vous proposer !

author: {'steamid': '76561198040558681', 'num_games_owned': 1756, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1643912705}
review:
I certainly can understand the hype behind this game and I can also clearly see now where "There is no game"got its inspiration from. 

There is something truly refreshing about a game telling its own story through the gameplay itself. The gameplay is straight forward and mostly stays the same throughout the game but presented in a multitude of ways. Kinda like a bottled up version of Portal.

And there are rarely any games as good as this one with breaking the fourth wall. Doki Doki Literature Club comes to mind.

The soundtrack is also really cool. I might listen to this on the side, while doing other stuff.

There is not much I can add to what other people already said. Play it! It is well worth it's three hours of playtime!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045191888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1468654310}
review:
Okay let's start off by addressing what should be the obvious by now. It is one of those indie games that try to subvert your expectations about what it means to 'play a video game.' And by the by, I think it does it with marginal success. I really feel like to give this game justice, you have to go in blind and lower your expectations, which already isn't the best thing to say about it. But I say this as someone who genuinely enjoyed his time playing this game and (for some reason) teared up at the ending, this game doesn't know what it wants to do with itself. There are so many expectations and directions the premise and early game set up that I feel lead to dwindling results. And the ending result we do end up with is either really cool and meta, or just lame and flat. And I think that entirely depends on how much you think about what this game is doing and could have done. 

Just. Try not to think about it too much, or else you'll end up with probably a better version of the game in your head.

author: {'steamid': '76561199044887428', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1633011296}
review:
Mimo niepozornej nazwy oraz na pierwszy rzut oka ubogiej grafiki, gra szybko pokazuje swoje prawdziwe oblicze. Rozgrywka w głównej mierze polega na czasami trudnych zagadkach logicznych oraz bawieniu się koncepcją co mi szczerze bardzo się podoba mimo że nie jestem fanem gier które opierają się na zagadkach, ciężko także powiedzieć cokolwiek o fabule tej gry bo nie uniknelibyśmy spoilerów. W skrócie gra z dziwną fabułą, masą zagadek oraz czasami mrocznym humorem, mi gra się podoba. Dziękuje za uwagę.

I tu przechodzimy do części w której mogą się znaleźć spoilery więc czytasz na własną odpowiedzialność.

Gra w miarę często łamie czwartą ścianę zwracając się bezpośrednio do gracza co w pierwszym momencie wprawiło mnie w małe zakłopotanie. Fabuła jest w głównej mierze oparta na walce z szatanem oraz jego sługusami co mnie zadowoliło, jeszcze wracając do przebijania czwartej ściany, gra świetnie bawi się zasadami oraz czasami chcę przekazać graczowi że wręcz ma własny rozum. Jeszcze raz dziękuje każdemu kto dotarł tutaj oraz chciałbym wam życzyć miłego życia.

review:
It's a point and click puzzle game with runner sections.
The difficulty is very accesible, and the controls are quite easy to grapes.
There are some good ideas, some puzzles are very entertaining and the fact that you virtually mess around with the game's code is cool.

But the game is not very fun overall.. I found the game a bit boring at times, even though I finished it in less than 3hrs.

The game is not at the good resolution so you have to change it and some sound effects hurt my ears.

But the end was cool enough !
Time to uninstall the game ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198085640332', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1643426637}
review: Игра хороша своей задумкой и атмосферой, ребусы понравились не все, при первом прохождении сложного вообще ничего нет. Не очень хороший геймдизайн раскрывается когда ты пытаешься выбить последнюю ачивку, получив ответы на 5 вопросов. Пятый вопрос "Как я попал сюда?" хоть тресни - не выпадет в первом акте - рестартил первый акт раз 20-30. Я так и не понял, благодаря какому алгоритму получил возможность задать этот вопрос, но попробовал так: задал любой вопрос в первом акте, перешел во второй акт, задал в пещере любой второй вопрос. Перешел в третий акт, и мне выпал вопрос "Как я попал сюда?" в ребусах с бабочками. Почему это плохой геймдизайн? Потому что игра не уважает мое время и заставляет копаться не только в ней, но и в гайде по выбиванию последней ачивки, причем в гайдах на английском, так как гайды на русском в основном пишут шкальники, либо студенты, не обремененные интеллектом, они упускают в гайдах важные детали для выполнения условий выбивания ачивок (типа подумайте сами). Зачем тогда нужен гайд если он не решает вопрос выбивания остатка ачивок? Такой процесс неинтересен, не весел, уныл и достаточно долгий, потому что для воспроизведения этой последовательности нужно по сути заново пройти 1/4 игры. Зачем? При том что играть в эту игру второй раз неинтересно. Ачивка из разряда "Проведи в игре 100 часов". Также было бы не плохо сделать побольше уровней с пони. Боссы - просто посмешище в плане сложности. Ребусы в стиле программирования быстро утомляют и становятся скучными. Скилл для игры не нужен вообще, единственное что нужно - это запоминать последовательность ребусов.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086066203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1643526618}

author: {'steamid': '76561198087072653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1645168041}
review: Pony Island is a very difficult game, especially if you are a completionist. One of the hardest puzzle games I have ever played. I managed to beat it in one sitting, and find 2 endings. However, if you aren't like me, it can take a lot of plays to beat. I may have spent way too much time playing it without much breaks. I played soo long I didn't sleep through the night. Don't follow my example. Everyone needs breaks, especially from a game like this. The story is what really captivated me. I can't wait to try their newer game, Inscryption, eventually.

review:
Pretty good. Short but cheap. It stood out more when it first came out, still worthwhile.

Split into 3 types of gameplay: The pony jumping (mouse-based and unique), some light puzzles (hard enough to feel proud when solving), and discovery, which comes from from prodding around an interface to uncover secrets.

Definitely worth it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970435091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1643060662}
review:
Vengo de jugar a Inscryption, que me ha parecido una maravillosa obra maestra, y buscando más del desarrollador he acabado aquí. 
Creo que haber hecho el camino a la inversa no le ha hecho justicia a Poni Island. Habiendo jugado ambos se palpa la línea creativa de Mullins y cómo Poni Island es la antesala o el laboratorio de lo que estaría por llegar, Inscryption. La idea es muy parecida y el desarrollo, las mecánicas y la jodienda enloquecida de Mullins empapa ambos juegos, pero como digo en Poni Island es todo muy básico y está en pañales. Todo esto por que se me hace inevitable compararlos, y no es justo en absoluto para Poni Island. 
En defensa de PI tengo que decir que este juego no lo habría tocado ni con un palo antes de haber disfrutado de Inscryption. Pero al haber entendido a Mullins he hecho de tripas corazón y lo he acabado terminando, pero ni de lejos me invita a perderme en su universo para seguir explorando o conseguir el 100% del juego como sí lo ha hecho Insryption. 
PI tiene algunos puzzles chulos y otros que son un dolor y repetitivos. En cambio tiene algunos momentos memorables en los que juega contigo a su antojo, y ya por eso merece un tiento, por no mencionar el jefe final: ese combate bien merece el precio que hayas pagado por el juego jajaja

3,5 horitas bien merece tener la experiencia con Poni Island, pero si de verdad quieres que te vuele la cabeza y flipar con una oda a la perturbación, burla, engaño, asombro y desconcierto no lo dudes, hazte un favor y regálate INSCRYPTION de Daniel Mullins, Cómpralo al precio que esté ahora mismo porque vale mucho más de lo que vayas a pagar por él. 
DE NADA.
