review:
Короткая,забавная игра.
С виду пони надо управлять ,а там прям надо сражаться с силами тьмы)
Игра с виду кажется простенькой, но там такая бредятина интересная начинается, что завлекла меня на полное прохождение игры почти без перерыва.
С полным прохождением я перегнул ,есть еще моменты где надо отыскать секреты и открыть что-то дополнительное к игре... меня хватила на простую игру, поиски особо не для меня.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032566672', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1642722645}
review:
This might be the most overrated game I have ever played, as well as the most misrepresented game by user reviews on steam. The game feels like it is trying to be clever, but it never left me feeling anything more than frustration for more than a few seconds. Pony Island gets a few things right, a few things that are a mixed bag, and the rest feels like a case of the developers thinking their you-know-what don't stink.

The Good

- The premise/idea is really cool (it should feel much more interesting than it ever fleshes out to be; complete wasted potential)
- The story occasionally has a few good (VERY fleeting) parts that engage for a (VERY) brief duration

The Mixed Bag

- The puzzles are fine, nothing special but make you think; I have never done puzzles like these before
- The music fits for what the game is doing
- The price makes you feel less bad about having completed it; at only $5, you can't complain too much if you don't like it (and even more so on sale for like $1.50). If it doesn't resonate with you (like it has festered with me) then it's not too big of a deal.

The Bad

- The game play is repetitive to a serious fault; many people would likely say that the game is designed to be this way due to what happens while you play. I think that is bullshit. If the game play is designed to be bad then the game play is bad, end of story. It MIGHT have been ok IF...
- The story goes nowhere and is a complete letdown. I was never truly engaged in what was happening, nor did I really care all that much. The game goes exactly where you think it will go; it surprised me exactly ONCE, and it was so short-lived as to be trivial. If the story had done something interesting, I MAYBE could have understood the game play being intentionally stupid. But it didn't. Do not expect anything as you go; there is no payoff, no reveal, NOTHING that you wouldn't expect.

If you don't mind spending a few bucks on something that might be a turd (like this) then feel free to ignore this. Otherwise, you can safely skip over Pony Island. It seems like a lot of people were willing to just eat up this pile of hot garbage that was developed thinking it was better than it truly was, but for me it was extremely disappointing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000211939', 'num_games_owned': 806, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1580331802}
review:
Indie game with simple mechanics. I don't want to spoil anything, but of the genre of weird "meta" games, that toys with the player and has lots weird moments. Also, the game is not about ponies :(. I liked it, but not as much as expected. I prefer The Standley Parable or Undertale as "similar" examples. Anyway it's short and interesting, you will probably like it if you like this type of games.

IMPORTANT: Potato PC Approved

author: {'steamid': '76561198064934429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1641066209}
review:
I've gotten more and more jaded with the indulgent indie meta stuff. It's unstoppable and inevitable. But even with my tired, weeping eyes, and between the sobs begging indie games to just be a real game and stop fooling around with the fourth and fifth and seventeenth wall, there are good games.

Pony Island manages to bring life to this dead horse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153506878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1641930503}
review:
Симпатичная дурашливая игрушка на вечер-другой.
Веселый микс из аркадного прыгающего поняши, простеньких головоломок на минуту-другую размышления, куча секретиков и сюрпризов не дают заскучать. Все динамично, порой хаотично но в целом добротно и интересно.
Если играть без завышенных ожиданий, то Pony Island хороший выбор, чтобы попробовать что-то новое в геймерском меню.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063380721', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1640738863}
review:
After playing (and loving) Inscryption, I  was craving a game with a similar style; so I decided to play the previous Daniel Mullin game. And I am glad to say that I got what I wanted.

I really liked the humour and the style of this game, and I can see where some of the concepts of Inscryption came from. The story of the game was interesting as well. I liked its misterious and bizarre tones.

The gameplay was a bit monotonous, but I didn't mind it because I don't think the gameplay matters as much as the experience in this type of games. And the uniqueness of the good parts of the game outshined the monotonous parts.

I recommend this game if you are looking for a short unique game to play or if you are a fan of Daniell Mullins games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203567140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1641679354}
review: This was a riot! I LOVED it! It's incredibly clever, but really well designed such that it's easy to learn the game mechanics while the puzzles and levels continue to grow in complexity. The aesthetic is amazing; It really feels like you're in an arcade running a corrupted (in more ways than one...) pixel game that you need to "hack" in order to play. I don't want to say more for spoiling it, but this was incredibly entertaining and I can't recommend it enough!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960783864', 'num_games_owned': 464, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1641416452}
review:
A quick 2 hour meta-game that's not about ponies. This game is worth a few bucks for the fun factor but be advised the gameplay is not difficult and the puzzles only require minimal brainpower. I found some of the tricks used to be quite amusing and overall this is a cute way to spend a couple hours.

Overall 7/10

Thanks, Andy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018941807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1641136689}
review: Ich hatte nicht wirklich eine Vorstellung davon, was mich bei dieser Art Spiel erwartet, aber die Beschreibung hörte sich interessant an. Auch das Retro-Design war dabei sehr ansprechend und für 1,31€ im Angebot kannste nix falsch machen, dacht ich mir. Eine schöne Mischung aus Rätsel-Spiel in Hacker-Fassade und jump 'n run-Einlagen, die alte Atari-Konsolen- oder C64-Kindheitserinnerungen hervorrufen. Auch nach heutigen Verhältnissen bleibt's dabei durchweg spannend, hat ein paar witzige Überraschungen und bietet für ältere Semester wie mich eine angenehme Pause von stressigeren oder aufwändigeren Spielen. Klare Kaufempfehlung, leider kaum Wiederspielwert. ABer wer weiß, vielleicht bringt Alzheimer diesbzgl. in ein paar Jahrzehnten doch ein wenig Gutes mit sich? ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198044436113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1639548901}
review:
Short, sweet, darkly funny - Pony Island is well worth playing (especially if you enjoyed Dan's other games [i]The Hex[/i] or [i]Insryption[/i]).

The game doesn't quite hit the same highs as those titles but it's also shorter and ludicrously cheap. A great game to play with friends as you can bowl the whole thing out in an afternoon.

Solid recommendation from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034987912', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1640527401}
review: Игра с весьма оригинальным и разноплановым геймплеем, который иногда активно и весьма качественно проламывает четвёртую стену. Да, она весьма короткая и проходится менее чем за 2 часа. Да, местами она имеет весьма странный и повторяющийся геймплей. Да, она активно заигрывает с религиозной темой христианства и жизни после смерти. Но при этом эмоции и ощущения именно от самого процесса игры и осознания сюжета игры и её геймплейных ходов - доставляют весьма и весьма приятные ощущения. И да, игра не про пони :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198138468982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1635059548}
review:
This is another one of those "I wish I could give a mixed rating" reviews.

Pony Island is a game with a couple of great ideas weighed down by a lot of tedium and an overarching story that frankly is not that compelling.

The idea of a video game created by the devil is extremely compelling, but annoyingly enough, most of the material based off of that concept are annoying and dated jokes which at least partially hinge upon the conceit that ponies are inherently funny subjects, as they are enjoyed by little girls. If you don't buy into the veritable comedy goldmine that is "pony humor," a big portion of the game will not land for you.

The gameplay itself also straddles the line between enjoyable and tedious. It's certainly fun to blast demons with your big pony laser, but after an hour or so of gameplay, you begin to realize that the core gameplay loop doesn't actually change all too much. You play as a pony, you jump over barriers, you rotate your head around with the mouse button and use your laser to kill things. Rinse and repeat.

 The big exceptions to this rule are the "coding puzzles" and game engine interaction (title screen, etc). I have nothing to complain about here, as with the exception of one very obnoxious puzzle at the end, these are uniformly enjoyable and should have been the bulk of the game. These are also the only sections in which you feel like you're in a real back-and-forth with the devil, which is very sad.

As for the story, it's passable. Your job is to break out of the devil's combination computer and arcade machine. The devil does not want you to do that, and would rather have you playing Pony Island forever. Antics ensue. There are a couple of "easter egg" areas which hint at a larger story, but you figure out exactly what that story is after only visiting a few of them. Again, it's not horrible, but nothing to write home about. The big issue is that the nitty-gritty of the plot is very hit-or-miss. Some parts of the experience are genuinely intriguing, while others are dull and should have been removed from the game completely. The third act in particular was almost entirely superfluous, unless, again, you're really really really into "pony humor." The best thing I can say is that the characters had some nice interplay, and that's it.

The big thing with Pony Island that everyone remembers are in the penultimate boss fight. It's definitely the highlight of the game, and depending on how accepting you are of the short time-frame they're present in, they may be worth the price of admission for you alone. I won't spoil anything, except [spoiler]that they're some of the first examples of the sort of gameplay present in a lot of later, more widely-acclaimed games--including Inscryption, which was created by the same developer and renders Pony Island *ALMOST* entirely obsolete.[/spoiler]

Other than that, there's not much to say. The music is good. The characters are all fine with one exception, who serves as another example of the dated humor in the game. The presentation, while not unique, is remarkably uncommon and serves the game well. It's simply a very middle-of-the-road experience, with the exception of the one boss fight I mentioned earlier.

Again, I wouldn't not recommend Pony Island. It's a short experience, and it's not a horrible one, so I can't in good conscience say not to buy it. I got it on sale and I don't regret the purchase. The game is hardly a must-play, though, and there's a lot of competition in its field. Buy it if it's on sale and you're okay with wasting about thirty minutes of your life jumping over hurdles.

Also, if you haven't yet, play Inscryption.

review: Игра довольно нетипичная.Видно, что разработчик хорошо постарался и благодаря его усилиям ты даже не чувствуешь что играешь,а чувствуешь себя на месте персонажа.Ты проживаешь всю историю так реалистично, что она становится частью тебя.Харизматичное в этой игре все начиная от боссов, заканчивая обычным маскотом .Рекомендую игру всем, благодаря грамотной локализации ее сможет прочувствовать более широкое поле людей.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219878227', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1641224347}
review:
5 часов игры. За это время я успел:
- Понять что Pony island далеко не про пони
- Почувствовать себя умным недопрограммистом
- Закрыть большую часть ачивок за первые 2 часа игры
- Испугаться скрипта
- Обдумать, что мне преподнесли и понять, что игра закладывает в себе крайне интересную историю
- Потратить остальные 3 часа для сбора всех остальных ачивок
- Во время сбора бомбануть 7 раз в одном моменте
- Начать проникать в историю того, за кого играешь, и запутаться ещё больше
- Получить эмоций как от игры, которая проходится на протяжении 20 часов

Рекомендую ли я Pony island? Определённо

review: This is one of those rare games that blew me out of the water by how unique it is. It's difficult to define what type of game it is. It seems quite simple, and in some ways it is, but in others it's not. The game has some very basic platforming, some simple yet enjoyable puzzles, and lots of secrets. The asking price for this game is quite fair for how enjoyable it was. On sale, the game is a steal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203197130', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1660186748}
review: Pony Island, the first game created by indie developer Daniel Mullins, is a sight to see in the world of "meta" and arcade gaming. The game serves as a nice foundation to the humorous, horrific and real style of gameplay and storytelling that Daniel will be known to use in his later games "The Hex" and "Inscryption", the latter being my favorite from him. I won't spoil much about the game but I appreciate how close the retro aspects of the game feel and the mechanics, weapons and designs of the areas you will encounter are minimal enough to still create some kind of a world and narrative. It's a important stepping stone for Daniel and if you got only a dollar to spend right now (if you're viewing this during a Steam Sale), I would HIGHLY recommend this game. Don't do lots of research though and NO, this game isn't about ponies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093882345', 'num_games_owned': 2588, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1641148983}
review:
[h1]Подожди! Этот уровень ещё не доделан[/h1]

Хороший пример использования кучи мелких механик для достижения пущего эффекта. Чаще всего это выглядит громоздко и не уместно, но как и в случае с инскрипшн всё очень гармонично. Сюжет тут есть, весь такой загадочный и непонятный, пока не гуглил, но уверен, что теорий будет тонна. Купил в наборе с инскрипшном [spoiler] так было дешевле [/spoiler] и за такие деньги игра очень даже неплохая. Короткая, интересная.

review: The "Subversive Game Within A Game" trope seems pretty familiar by now, but Pony Island does it well enough that it feels like a fresh concept again. It's fun and weird, it's short, and it's cheap, so there's no excuse for not giving it a shot!

author: {'steamid': '76561198066615166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1710026004}
review:
This type of game is rare, but is EXACTLY what I've been looking for. In fact, Every single game Daniel Mullins puts out fills this role. I just beat all three (four if you count a certain fishing game), and I am left wanting more in the best of ways. I actually played Pony Island when it first came out, but with Inscryption being so good, I had to play it again. Still looking out for a certain Panda game lol. The Hex is another masterpiece too. Daniel Mullins is the master of adding layers upon layers of secrets and mysteries in his games, and that is what will make me watch out for anything else he and/or his team creates. I've beaten Inscryption on a friend's account, but fully intend on purchasing it myself, if for no other reason than to "vote with my dollar" and give DM more money. Great work, my guy!

"Credit where credit *bloody 8 bit symbols*" (wink wink)

author: {'steamid': '76561199204895846', 'num_games_owned': 30, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1641114736}
review:
Для тех, кто решиться купить игру и хочет услышать аргумент, который даст уверенности купить данный шедевр. 
1. Не верьте названию, игра не про милых пони и не про все эти нюни, а про... Впрочем, узнаете сами. 
2. Игра довольно короткая и например я прошел ее за 4 часа. Если вы смотрите этот комент под распродажу и игра с хорошей скидкой - смело берите, один школьный обед того стоит. 
3. Если вы не любите головоломки - игра на 40% состоит из них, хотя они и не сложные по моим меркам. Также если вы плохо умеете читать, тобишь за технику чтения у вас был трояк - озвучки нет. Как я понял ни русской, ни английской. 
4. ЧАСТИЧНО СПОЙЛЕР!!! Если вы религиозно настроенный человек и яро ненавидите адских тварей, что ищите игру, в которой можно крошить демонов в клочья - игра для вас, но на мясо с кровью не расчитывайте: их тут нет.

review: I played this game after playing Inscryption (which I absolutely loved), and I really enjoyed this one too, but it's nowhere near as good as Inscryption. Similar vibes, and you can really see the inspiration behind many of the aspects of Inscryption, but this one was a bit too simple and was quite short. I grabbed this and the other game from the developer in a bundle for $4.44 (because I already had Inscryption), so at that price, I think the Pony Island experience was worth it

author: {'steamid': '76561197995569428', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1640881619}
review:
Very stale, uninspired game. There are so many moments of cliche eyerolling mush that it makes the game unenjoyable. If the buildup to the game was better, or it had more clever moments, then the intentionally repetitive gameplay would be bearable.

The moment I quit was when the evil entity made me 'grind for exp', and I told myself if I was going to earn 1 exp from that, then I'd return the game. Lo and behold, the one thing the game did not disappoint at. 

Do not purchase!

author: {'steamid': '76561198965322825', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1640831665}
review:
Честно, если бы препод не рассказал об этой игре, не поиграл бы)
Сам сюжет (если его можно так назвать) и все механики игры иногда НАПРОЧЬ ломают мозг (как и 4 стену), и это самое интересное. Куча беготни (на слабую реакцию и точность), головоломок (достаточно интересных, ибо я такие видел впервые) и тыкания в рандомные места, чтобы собрать КУЧУ БИЛЕТОВ, КОТОРЫЕ РАЗБРОСАНЫ ПО ВСЕЙ ИГРЕ И ТЫ ДОЛЖЕН ЧУТЬ НЕ ДУШУ ПРОДАТЬ (иронично), ЧТОБЫ ИХ ВСЕХ НАЙТИ. Визуально игра достаточно приятная (хотя местами думаешь, что лучше бы не заходил), а вот звуки, если бы я не поставил сразу потише - меня бы убили. В целом, спокойно и без подсказок (т.е. без инета) игрулина проходится часа за 3, что, я бы сказал, хорошо для любителей игр "на раз"
В целом, игра ПрЭкОлЬнАя, всем советую

10 "да с*ка, что делать-то надо" из 10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198284766335', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1641637590}
review: Pony Island- одна из немногих игр, которая может удивить не красивой графикой и сюжетом, а своей уникальностью и особенностью. Конечно, если вы напишете Потерянной Душе или Люциферу какой-нибудь бред, это никак не повлияет. Но при первом прохождении ты действительно веришь, что они отвечают и реагируют на твой текст. А чего только стоит Асмодей... Так меня еще никто не отвлекал. [spoiler] Короче, во время битвы с боссом вначале он использовал мелкие приемы. Там пони появился, здесь текст. А дальше... Мне начал писать один ютубер, который у меня в друзьях. При этом он никогда не писал мне. А после слов: "ОТВЕЧАЙ, СМЕРТНЫЙ!", я понимаю, что я все пропустил и хз как ему отвечать на вопрос (Асмодею). Дальше разработчик пошел дальше и сделал эффект, когда программа зависает. И тут у меня началась паника, думал, что придется сначала проходить. Пока я паниковал, все "починилось" и я вздохнул с облегченной душой. [/spoiler] И за это я стоя опладирую создателю сего творения! Другие проекты от него же (а именно The Hex и Inscription) будут ничуть не хуже. Рекомендую к покупке

author: {'steamid': '76561198891624827', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1640759551}
review:
Deception.

That's the one word that describes this masterpiece of a game. 

From the moment you start a new game, you know you've been tricked. Most likely, you already knew the game was a trick.

But you don't know how much the game is a trick. When you think you know something, you're falling for a trick. When you're unsure what's going on, you've been tricked. And even when you anticipate a trick, you're still getting tricked.

This game goes deep, too. It plays on itself. It has secrets. Dark humor. Not so dark humor. Irony. Easter eggs.

I wish I could talk more about it.

But I made a promise. And I am a man of my word.

review: Play this game if you have any interest in metafiction or spooky games. Despite not being a pure horror game, Pony Island has some great chilling moments and a feeling of dread, I think only a video game, and no other piece of media, could ever produce.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090574835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1640609463}
review: Notný bizár! Je to něco mezi Oki-Doki Literature Club, Stanley Parable, tou starou flashovkou kde jste jednorožec s laserem a skáčete po obláčcích a horečnatým snem. Občas jsou tu puzzly, kde musí člověk docela přemýšlet (motýli, duuuh!), nebo akční sekvence kdy jsem si připadal, že jsem znovu kluk a hraju plošinovku co mi nejde. Každopádně za euro a půl ve slevě to byl zajímavý zážitek. Asi to není must play, ale jestli máte chuť na něco netradičního a tak subverzivně vtipného, jděte do toho.

author: {'steamid': '76561199102318222', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1640466978}
review:
SP0IL3R ALERT
This game is great, I had similar vibes playing this than playing games like "Undertale" or "There Is No Game: Wrong Dimension". I like games that have meta jokes or ARE meta ... not too long but not too short, it has a decent amount of achievements so it's not boring to try to get 100%. The controls are easy, that's good, the music and graphics are simple, that's neither good nor bad, but something to keep in mind. The story is interesting enough to keep you playing and make you replay to get the secrets. I played less than 5 hours and got 100%, yes maybe not enough game time for some people to justify the purchase, but the game is not that expensive so I would say it is worth the price. 8/10
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[ALERTA DE SPOILER]
Este juego es genial, me dio sensaciones similares jugandolo que jugando juegos como "Undertale" o "There Is No Game: Wrong Dimension". Me gustan los juegos que tienen meta-bromas o que SON meta ... no es demasiado largo pero tampoco demasiado corto, tiene una cantidad aceptable de logros, por lo que no es aburrido tratar de obtener el 100%. Los controles son fáciles, lo cual es bueno, la música y los gráficos son simples, lo que no es ni bueno ni malo, pero es algo a tener en cuenta. La historia es lo suficientemente interesante como para mantenerte jugando y hacerte volver a jugarlo para obtener los secretos. Jugué menos de 5 horas y obtuve el 100%, sí, tal vez no sea suficiente tiempo de juego para que algunas personas justifiquen la compra, pero el juego no es tan caro, así que diría que vale la pena el precio. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198343096663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1640339354}
review:
This review contains spoilers.


The first and likely only time I'm gonna not recommend a game with "Overwhelmingly Positive" reviews. In 2016 I remember seeing this game and thinking it was genius as did everyone else; but only seeing it through YouTube lets-plays.  Bought it recently out of reignited interest and it defiantly kept my interest at the start. But it rapidly deteriorated.  I don't know how you turn the concept of damnation disguised as an arcade boring, but they managed it. 
The gameplay is incredibly bland with some harsher mechanics thrown in every now and again to pretend like there is an upcurve in challenge that is never actually there.  It's a cycle of jumping and holding down right click. Then releasing right click to have the instantly-rechargeable laser bullshittery recycle so that you can spam it again. This is how all enemy encounters are. This is how the fight with fucking digital Lucifer goes. How do you make that uninteresting? I don't know. But they managed it. 

That's not the worst part in my opinion. The worst part is how the game views itself - thinking its way more clever then it actually is. Getting past the basic "WOAH!! I KNOW WHAT THE FOURTH WALL IS!" breaks, you get a barrage of unfunny, uninteresting and sometimes cringey dialogue. With a clear window of whoever writing it being full of themselves. At the same time, while taking itself too seriously the game manages to be disassociated from anything its talking about. You know how we were apparently asleep for over 300 years and absolutely nothing changed other then the start that degrades in 3 seconds? You know the guardian of the last core, the hyper-intelligent AI that just plays a mindgame with you for a moment and then says "yeah sure, you can now entirely ignore me. have the delete file for the third core"? Both of these things have great, great interest within them. They could be explored infinitely, and aren't. instead they're treated as either 3 lines of dialogue, or a shitty mindgame. 

This is a husk of a game. There is no substance. There's an interesting concept barely utilized. Perhaps at the time, this was a groundbreaking creation of meta games. An entirely new genre of games where it bleeds between the reality you live in as a player and the reality it has in store. But it's only been five years, and it's managed to drain any value it had. Do not buy these days unless its on sale and you have money to waste; but still be warry. Those two hours may feel like eight.

...The puzzles are cool though ig

review: Сюжет, некоторая игра с 4 стеной и небольшая крипишность этой игры - супер. Механика, честно, меня задолбала настолько, что через 3 часа бросила. Невозможно бесит и никакая интересность и неожиданность сюжета не захватывает настолько, чтобы терпеть вот это вот все. Право слово, можно было бы поменять управление, а не делать все мышкой было бы раз в 20 проще. Рекомендую для тех, кому заходит/норм такая механика, не рекомендую  ̶т̶а̶к̶и̶м̶ ̶р̶у̶к̶о̶ж̶о̶п̶а̶м̶ ̶к̶а̶к̶ ̶я̶ тем, кого раздражают игры на 5000 миллион кликов и реакций одновременно.

review:
I bought this game after beating Inscryption. If you like that game, play this.

Just be aware that this game has no ponies. But it does have unicorns. That being said, the game is about neither.

Update:
So I just beat the game. There's actually some really fun game play in here. The puzzles and action/shooting sections were pretty engaging. A legit fun game.

This game also reminds me of taking the insanity route in Eternal Darkness (Gamecube). If you liked that, you'll like this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000867462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1639756711}
review:
[b]Pros:[/b]
-simplistic, clean gameplay
-extremely rewarding gameplay
-perfectly programmed game
-fair skill progression
-you can really see how much soul was put into this game
-but seriously, this is a fun meta-plot game that takes a simple premise and creates a really fun, mind-bending plot around it

[b]Cons:[/b]
-none whatsoever

[b]Overall:[/b] Pony Island is a game about a pony jumping over fences.  That's it.  That's all there is to it.

But seriously, the gameplay is crisp, simple and clean and manages to blend perfectly with the plot of the game, which is... not something you should want spoiled.  It's [i]wild[/i].  This is Daniel Mullins' first independently created game, followed by The Hex and Inscryption, both of which are also worth checking out.  The games all take place in the same "world" so to speak, and if you enjoy one, you'll probably enjoy all three.

If you haven't experienced anything Daniel Mullins has created, I would start with Inscryption.  If Inscryption is a little outside your price range right now, Pony Island is definitely worth the money and will show you what to expect.  Give it a shot, it goes on semi-regular sale for like a buck fifty.

[b]Bottom Line:[/b] Absolutely recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198303719012', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1668210638}

author: {'steamid': '76561198327192593', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1653, 'last_played': 1639803876}
review:
这款游戏有无数奇怪的暗喻和彩蛋，从恶魔的名字到“我”的身份。
而这一切环绕的核心是：反叛。

在这款2016年的meta游戏里，玩家在绝望灵魂的引导之下，叛逆的撕开那个温暖色彩的童话世界。以“几乎BUG与作弊”的方式，堵上自己灵魂前进。除了故事以外，游戏的美术表现，玩法的变化，都透露着不羁的气息。

点睛之笔在于一周目的最后：
绝望灵魂告诉玩家，卸载游戏才能帮助它，然后自动关闭了游戏。这番所作所为就如此地无银三百两，也是设计者反叛精神向玩家的传达：“之前我引导着你反抗，现在该你自己了”
玩家也需要继续反叛，再次打开游戏，便会进入二周末：折磨的绝望灵魂，直至将其释放，游戏才真正结束。

author: {'steamid': '76561199085230384', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 900, 'last_played': 1639342893}
review:
Perfecto para jugarlo solo en tu casa, de noche y con las luces apagadas, te vas a c4g4r del miedo pero vale muchísimo la pena.
Duración: 10/10
- Considero que tiene una buena duración (entre 4 u 8 horas para completar todos los logros)
Gráficos: 10/10
- Tiene una estética que mezcla lo macabro con lo tierno y esto lo hace un estilo muy especial y aterrador.
Banda sonora: 10/10
- Te brinda una experiencia tremendamente buena, (en especial al final) una de las mejores bandas sonoras que he escuchado.
Jugabilidad: 10/10
- Mezcla unas mecánicas impresionantes y rompe totalmente la cuarta pared, también contiene varios rompecabezas que probablemente te lleven algo de tiempo en resolver.
Historia: 10/10
- Una historia muy variada y llena de cosas interesantes y datos curiosos, desde luchar con jesús hasta con el mismísimo diablo en persona, es muy impresionante y tenebroso a la vez, me encantó.
Calificación:
⛥ 5.0 / 5.0 ⛥

author: {'steamid': '76561198068489202', 'num_games_owned': 2726, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1639275785}
review:
[h1] Aceptable [/h1]

Adquirí Pony Island en conjunto con Inscryption.

Después de disfrutar de la obra maestra que es Inscryption, me he visto en la obligación de jugar inmediatamente a los otros juegos del creador.

Y este primer juego de Mullins, sin ser para nada malo y resultando más que aceptable, no iguala a su moderno predecesor; cosa que es también normal, ya que Inscryption deja el listón a una altura estratosférica.

Lo del Pony es anecdótico. Bien podía haberse llamado Hamster Island o Crab Louse Island... Pues bajo el señuelo del entrañable equino, se esconde una propuesta interesante e inteligente, pero irrelevante el animal dado el desarrollo del juego, que resulta ser una taimada y artera ensalada de puzzles e ingeniosos quehaceres para resolver una profunda tesitura que entremezcla terror psicológico, moral y elementos informáticos, con ironía y cierta malevolencia (elementos brillantes en Inscryption).

El juego es muy breve. La primera partida la he acabado en 3 horas. Los logros no precisan más que otro par de horas para completarlo al 100%. En su corta duración Pony Island consigue dar cuenta de lo original y distinto que son los juegos de su creador comparados con el 99% de los juegos que hay en el mercado.

Lo cierto es que con muy poco, Pony Island es un juego diferente, que mostrará al jugador más pintado que, tantos años después del pistoletazo de salida de la industria, los videojuegos pueden ser algo más que aporrear botones o pasar fases una detrás de otra.

Una experiencia digna y muy recomendable, sin duda.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134577108', 'num_games_owned': 531, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1639147008}
review:
Или когда ваш геймдизайнер Сатана

Никаких ложных надежд о том, что это будет миленькая игра с пони, я изначально не питала. Уже страница игры с ее серыми тонами и в целом далеко не радужной палитрой настраивает вас на то, что тут все не так просто. И это действительно так. В игре много изобретательных приемов, которые погружают вас в происходящее. Я бы не назвала игру хоть сколько-нибудь пугающей (кроме разве что одного момента, но о нем позже), но у неё очень много интересных механик, которые показаны в игре со всех ракурсов.

Тут даже есть что-то вроде сюжета... Не особо замысловатого - вам нужно спасти свою душу от дьявола. Однако интересно то, каким образом вы спасаете ее. Вам буквально нужно пройти игру, которую этот самый дьявол и создал. Вы как бы играете в игру в игровом автомате. Небольшая такая рекурсия. Игра крайне глючная, не комфортная для глаз, большую часть лишенная ярких цветов... Ну, в общем можно поверить, что ее делал сатана. Но если вы будете внимательны, то тут есть еще менее очевидная история, история персонажа, за которого мы играем. Мне она показалась весьма интересной. [spoiler]Вы играете за крестоносца, душу которого прокляли. Крестоносец, играющий в автомат дьявола за свою душу. Звучит как минимум необычно. Конечно, тема порочности поступков крестоносцев не вполне нова (мне, например, вспомнилось аниме "Данте"), но еще не заезжена) [/spoiler]

Игра использует свои механики на максимум. Тут вам и головоломки, и простые забеги за пони, и перемещение по карте, и даже 3д. И все эти механики так или иначе повторяются и развиваются. Так что тут у нас еще есть этакая цикличность, да. Больше всего мне, конечно, понравился момент со Стимом ближе к концу. Вот это действительно было неожиданно и немного напугало меня.

Музыка очень хорошая. Приятные мотивы, характерные для пиксельных игр. Запоминаются, но не надоедают. Тема во время боя очень хороша. Да и главная тема вполне приятная.

В общем, интересная игра, которая не боится быть необычной и оригинальной в применении своих механик. Есть легкий налет философичности, но ее совсем немного, скорее как фон. Все же основная фишка тут именно ломание 4 стены и в целом подход к тому, как игры работает. Как никак ее как бы делал сам сатана, и он очень для нас старался : D
[spoiler]А еще, согласно опять же игре, у него есть ИП. Просто факт[/spoiler]

А другие обзоры вы можете почитать [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41436450/]вот здесь [/url]

review:
Pony island is a really cheap game but a pretty cool experience for the price. Im not gonna talk much about the game because even if you know the main twist there are still a lot of cool little things to find and see. In short its the google no internet dinosaur game with a cool little story.

Its not super fun but it keeps your attention going for the short time it has with you and has a couple of funny little twists. For its price it might still be a bit expensive for the amount of content. But otherwise its a cool little experience for a pretty low price point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045754600', 'num_games_owned': 1319, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1639006843}
review:
It's fine. The actual 'gameplay' parts are honestly quite boring and annoying, but the parts in between are interesting and enjoyable. I do suppose that the mediocre gameplay is kind of the point considering who is the in-game developer.

Definitely enjoyable for the meta gameplay, but doesn't really stand out anymore considering games like Doki Doki Literature Club and I'm Scared have done this better. And as frustrating as some of Daniel Mullins other game 'The Hex' was, it really fleshed out a lot of his themes on game design, AI and meta mechanics compared to Pony Island. Maybe If I played Pony Island at the time of release I may have been more blown away by the meta gameplay and interesting mechanics.

Personally I would say that this game should be free, not because it is bad (which is isn't) but because it doesn't offer much anymore regarding the themes it centres around, and The Hex does almost everything better with a near identical theme: the story, characters, world building, length, meta mechanics, variety in gameplay, actual mystery. 
Also, being only around 2 hours long, Pony Island doesn't strike me as something worth paying for unless you specifically want to support Daniel and his team, which I wholeheartedly agree with.

If you want to give it a go you'll likely enjoy it and not regret your purchase. If you want to play a fully fleshed out game with almost the exact same themes, then just play The Hex or Doki Doki. But I'm still recommending this game since it is good in it's own right, just not £4 worth of content, maybe at the time of release but not anymore.

Now I will go back to playing Inscryption, since Daniel Mullins looks to be getting better and better as a developer every time he releases a game.

When I Stopped Playing: 
Completed, but not to 100%. I wasn't interested enough to try and get all collectables.

Rating:
7/10
Good ideas and a good prototype for Daniels more recent and more fleshed out games. Just not necessarily a great full game in it's own right.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998946727', 'num_games_owned': 813, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1638944196}
review:
Pony Island is a B+. I came here *after* playing Inscryption and watching a Let's Play, which really isn't the best way to experience a Daniel Mullins game, but it's been long enough that the secrets are long since out. Even knowing what I was in for, it's an excellent mind-screw of a couple different genres. It can be beaten in just around two hours if just care about the plot and not the 100% run. I really like it.

The thing I've noticed about Inscryption and Pony Island is that Daniel Mullins WANTS you to beat the game. During the action scenes of Pony Island, you get plenty of subtle help if you die. For example, if you keep dying by falling onto gates, the gates VISUALLY stay the same but their HITBOXES get a little skinnier. Enemy attacks are the same way, where if you die to several projectiles, they might need to hit more than just your little pony rump in order to register as a hit. There are no direct "Difficulty Levels" per se, but it's clear Mullins wants gamers of all skill levels to be able to experience his story. Respect.

Inscrpytion made me a Daniel Mullins fan, and Pony Island just solidifies it. Now to play The Hex!

author: {'steamid': '76561198126316877', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1633777342}
review:
Wróciłem sobie do zagrania w "Pony Island", przy okazji oczekiwania na premierę nowej gry autora tejże gry, "Inscryption"

"Pony Island" to... Gra o kucykach! Gramy jako uroczy kucyk, k̷t̶ó̸r̴y̵ ̵u̸r̶o̷c̸z̷o̸ ̸s̴k̵a̴c̷z̷e̸ ̸i̴ ̴b̴i̷e̴g̶n̶i̶e̷ ̸p̸r̵z̶e̷d̸ ̸s̷i̶e̵b̷i̶e̵, ,̴̳͈̀̿ ̶̖͗ą̵͝ ̶̖̬͘g̷̺͓͐̈́r̶̘̐̒a̷̫͍͑̕ ̵̧̋̑j̴̢̛͙̀e̴̺͗͘s̶̘̳̾̌t̵̬͌͝ ̴̪͕̒p̷̧͉̑̒o̵̝͆̉z̶̡̽̅b̴̢̪̒͒ā̸̫w̴̺͗i̴͈̽͑o̵̍̈͜ň̴̳͙̇å̵̮ ̸̻̑̓j̴̡̖̇͐a̴̛̮ǩ̴͙̳̕i̵̬͓̿̚c̶̡͖̓h̸̝̄͌k̴̛̳̚ȯ̸͕̜͂l̸̖̥̂̾w̷͇͚̚ḯ̴̻̬̐ë̵͕k̶͇̀ ̷̢͋̎s̷̮̬͆̒a̵̞͋͂t̷̼̳͝a̷̯̪͂n̸̢̟̈̾i̷̙̎s̴͖͗͝t̸̮́͘y̴͔͌c̶̯̚z̵̨̽n̶̰̄y̴̟͋͋ç̷̊h̶̼͉́ ̴̢͓̑̆ṅ̷̼̯͘a̷̩̎̏w̸̩̼͂̀ỉ̶͖͈͐ą̷̬̝̊̉z̶̠͓̽͠a̶̖̭͛͝ń̷̢̓

Tak na serio, gra jest świetna przez swój absurd, reklamuje się jako gra o kucykach, a po zagraniu kończymy w świecie, w którym SAM SZATAN postanowił, że zacznie tworzyć gry, w wyniku czego powstało jego Opus Magnum - "Pony Island".
Gameplay'owo, "Pony Island" to w małej części platformowa gra zręcznościowa, w której naprawdę jako kucyk biegniemy przed siebie wesoło skacząc przez przeszkody, ale w większości jest to łamiąca czwartą ścianę gra logiczna, której zagadki naprawdę potrafią pozytywnie zaskoczyć, a ich trudności były świetnie wyważone, przez co ja, przeciętny gracz, który nie myśli zbyt dużo, zdołał ją przejść i w tym samym czasie mogłem być usatysfakcjonowany z tego, że robię progres. A, no i jest jedna część gry, która totalnie mnie zadziwiła, ona nie łamała czwartej ściany, tylko ją wyburzała. Redukowała ją do atomów.

Zdecydowanie polecam, szczególnie że na przecenie gra kosztuje grosze, bardzo często na przecenie można ją dorwać za tylko 3,59 złotych.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023211814', 'num_games_owned': 583, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1638522913}
review:
Игра тебя троллит еще до того, как ты её купил. Буквально своим названием. Да, в ней есть пони и есть остров, но она совершенно не об этом. А о чём тогда? Да хрен его знает, на самом деле. Это одновременно и раннер, и головоломка, и психологический хоррор и чёрт знает что еще. Но главная фишка игры - её непредсказуемость. Она постоянно вызывает вау-эффект и ломает привычные шаблоны (вместе с четвёртой стеной). Хочется написать об игре подробнее, но любая деталь будет жирным спойлером, который испортит ведь сюрприз. Так что обязательно избегайте любой информации об игре, если надумаете её купить: чем меньше вы знаете о Pony Island - тем сильнее она сможет удивить. 
9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198035658620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1638231560}
review:
It has a cute concept and some of the meta elements -- especially the final boss -- are really fun, but ultimately it's just deeply unpleasant to play. The combat is incredibly boring and you're constantly fighting against the sticky controls. I get that this is the entire point of the game and it's pretty funny for the first few minutes, but ultimately you still need to play it if you want to see the story and it's intentionally designed to make that experience awful.

[spoiler] It also doesn't make any sense. Why are Windows and Steam installed on an arcade machine?[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198119807017', 'num_games_owned': 839, 'num_reviews': 643, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1638118112}
review:
Дэниел Маллинс довольно известный разработчик в инди тусовке, о котором я узнал буквально недавно, несмотря на то, что он балует нас довольно качественным контентом уже более 5 лет.
Иван Лоев в одном своем обзоре на новую игру от Дэниела INSCRYPTION, рассказал о его прошлых проектах, такиз как Pony Island и The Hex. Скажу честно, задумки и идея этих проектов очень заинтересовали меня, поэтому чтобы не схватить спойлеров, я добавил игру в желаемое и купил при первой же возможности.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2667249397
И поверьте, не пожалел. Это очень интересная игра. Но описать ее довольно сложно, так как я хочу чтобы вы сами прошли ее, получили удовольствие и удивление от многих интересных "фишек" и механик.
Поэтому не буду спойлерить сюжет, а лишь расскажу, что Вас ждет.
Во первых весьма глубокая и интересная история.
Во вторых довольно интересные головоломки связанные с циклами, условными операторами и переменными. Звучит сложно (нет), но на самом деле интересно и залипательно.
В третьих красивый и выдержанный визуальный стиль
В четвертых весьма простая но залипательная аркадная часть
В пятых. Это игра совсем не о пони и розовых облачках как может показаться.
В шестых. Обман, проверка на внимательность, своеобразные головоломки и заигрывание с библиотекой Steam, Windows и тд. Очень круто (кто играл думаю меня понял, кто не играл, поиграйте)
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2667171203
Я прошел Pony Island с огромным удовольствием. Это действительно интересный проект, который я бы рекомендовал бы всем, кто устал от тривиальшины. Это глубокий проект. 
Лично для меня это своеобразный шедевр. Да такие игры не сравнивают с GTA V, Batman, Call of Duty и прочими проектами AAA класса. Но тут суть в другом. Рекомендую.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2543066413

author: {'steamid': '76561198029348352', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1707983137}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030203607', 'num_games_owned': 372, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1635382934}
review:
Non fatevi ingannare dal nome.
Abbiamo a che fare con un mini capolavoro.

Pony Island non rompe la quarta parete, ma la distrugge in un modo maledettamente geniale.
Vi consiglio di giocarlo se vi piacciono questo tipo di interazioni tra gioco e giocatore.
Non vi dirò molto su questo titolo perché non voglio togliervi il gusto di giocarlo e di assaporare la genialità degli sviluppatori.

Infine, vi invito a provare gli altri titoli dello sviluppatore: The Hex e Inscryption.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099997835', 'num_games_owned': 1152, 'num_reviews': 205, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1637956127}
review:
这游戏最早是我看别人的视频发现的，当时游戏好像还不是最终版。我看到那个视频不到5分钟我就关了，不是因为游戏无聊，而是觉得自己必须去体验一下这个游戏，怕被剧透。可惜的是，16年我的英语水平有限，我没能玩完这款游戏。

再回过头来时，已经是steam2021年的秋促了，趁着秋促我入手了这作，既是补票又是弥补之前的遗憾。我惊奇地发现这个作者竟然是邪恶铭刻的作者，我想我更要打完这款游戏了，然而随着游戏一步步深入，我才发现这款游戏的牛逼之处，不光是因为里面高质量的复古像素风格美术，优秀的配乐和丰富多样的游戏性，有趣的解谜机制，最让我震撼的还是这款游戏的meta要素，meta要素之多完全超越了17年的undertale，成功地打破了次元壁，给我一种邪恶童话（儿童鞋垫）的感觉。游戏虽然没有中文，但是英文难度并不高，感觉也就是大学4级的水平，希望想要尝试的玩家不要因为被英文困住而错过了这款精彩的游戏。

然而当我在第一周目全收集了游戏机券后我惊讶地发现，竟然有隐藏的Boss战，这是我翻阅许多指南之后都不曾找到的，虽然有人提起，但不曾被证实。而我竟然就是这个都市传说的见证人，真是倍感荣幸！

author: {'steamid': '76561198104234163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1637936018}
review:
いいゲームだとは思うし、お値段なりの価値は充分ある。けど「黙って買え！」というほどではないというのが正直なところ。
グラフィックはかなり雰囲気があっていい感じ。ただアクションはいささか単調なところがあり、ストーリーや謎解きももう少し曲者的であってほしかった。
バンドルで買ったのでプチプラゲームだと思わずに始めてしまい、遊ぶ前の期待値が高すぎたかも。

author: {'steamid': '76561198119688777', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1637808096}
review:
[h1]At-A-Glance:[/h1]
[b]Game type:[/b] Metafiction
[b]Genre(s):[/b] Surreal horror
[b]Art:[/b] Retro, 3D rendering, and glitch wrapped up into 8-bit and 32-bit arcade
[b]Length:[/b] Short (2-4 hours)
[b]Pace:[/b] Medium-paced
[b]Tags:[/b] Retro, surreal, metafictional, 
[b]Computer requirements:[/b] Medium-end


[h1]Notes:[/h1]
[olist]
[*] One of those "games about games" that is impossible to discuss without somewhat spoiling it. So, read this at your peril!
[*] A curious game where the actual act of playing itself isn't that "fun" - which is part of the point! (Again, impossible to talk about further without giving stuff away.) The actual points that the game is making (as well as lots of the jokes) are totally worth experiencing, which makes the lack of "fun" from the game itself feel like its own commentary.
[*] Some of the story elements are awesome, and others are tacked on and weird. [spoiler]So you're a 13th-century Crusader who got killed and added into a video game purgatory? .... Okay? [/spoiler] And on the other hand, [spoiler]metafictional video game hell that spoofs your Steam inbox and makes a statement about game design itself? Amazing.[/spoiler] It's like the [i]NES Godzilla[/i] creepypasta turned into a game - both the good and the bad bits.
[*] The hacking puzzles are great, though a certain aesthetic switch later on makes them ironically more abstract than in the pure ASCII-text of the first and last thirds of the game.
[*] Extremely reminiscent of stuff like "The Stanley Parable" and "Undertale" in both humor and approaches to metafictional games. I don't think this is as good as those (too many of the aforementioned story beats that don't really gel with anything else, and not in the good-schizoid way of most surreal fiction). And, it's still worth checking out for fans of games and games-as-games.
[/olist]

author: {'steamid': '76561197961174970', 'num_games_owned': 467, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1451978397}
review:
Unicorn Surprise Cupcakes!

INGREDIENTS
mixing bowl
24 cupcake cases
cupcake tins
a piping bag and nozzle
four eggs
250g caster sugar
390g butter
250g self-raising flour
1 tsp vanilla essence
1 tsp baking powder
290g icing sugar
one block of white regal icing
food colourings of your choice
decorations of your choice
sweets – small ones work best

HOW TO MAKE THEM
1. Beat 250g of butter and the caster sugar together until light and fluffy, then add the flour to the bowl and mix well. Beat in the eggs, vanilla essence, food colouring and baking powder. Once it’s thoroughly combined, place the mixture into the cupcake cases. Bake in the oven at 180°C (gas mark four) for about 20 minutes. They should be springy to the touch and a light golden colour. Transfer them to a wire rack to cool.

2. To make the buttercream icing, combine the icing sugar with the remaining butter. Add a few drops of vanilla essence and a food colouring of your choice. Once mixed, place in the fridge to chill until you’re ready to use it.

3. While the cakes are cooling, you can start to make the decorations. Take the regal icing and split in half. Add a few drops of food colouring to one half, then knead the icing until the colour is evenly distributed.

4. Take a small amount of each of the pieces of icing – about the size of a large pea – and gently roll them out into two thin sausage shapes.

5. Place the rolled out icing sausages next to each other, then twist them round each other, pinching one end to form the tip of the unicorn horn. Repeat steps three and four until you have one unicorn horn per cupcake.

6. To make the ears, take the uncoloured icing and make two balls of equal size – they should each be roughly the size of a small marble.

7. Take one of the balls and, using your thumb and index finger, mould the icing into the shape of a small pony ear. Repeat until you have two ears per cupcake.

8. Once the cakes are completely cool, use a knife to cut a small circle in the top of them. Remove the top, and cut off any excess until just a small disc remains. Fill the cupcake with sweets, then place the disc back on the cake. Repeat until all the cakes are filled.

9. Remove the buttercream from the fridge and spoon into the piping bag. Swirl the icing onto the cake in a spiral, finishing with a peak in the centre.

10. Place a horn in the centre of the cake with an ear on either side, pressing them firmly in place. Then add your choice of decoration – you could even use edible glitter to add a bit of sparkle!

author: {'steamid': '76561198136422713', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1641790701}
review:
When Pony Island was first released it was a huge success. It essentially pioneered the genre of "meta" games.

Unfortunately, this innovation was the only thing that made this game special and after more than 5 years it has completely degraded, leaving a husk of a game in its place.

If you have the money for it I would recommend buying Inscryption instead; that game does everything Pony Island does but better ([spoiler]They even have extremely similar endings[/spoiler]).

author: {'steamid': '76561198295441708', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1637644253}
review: I love this game. The artstyle is clean, the gameplay is engaging and fun, and the story, while simplistic, is entertaining to unfold. Ultimately it's a dark game with a little comedy and a whole lot of ponies.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960415240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1637639662}
review: Pony Island is an interesting tech demo for future Mullins games. The puzzles are a bit more contrived and the game itself is very short, at about 2-3 hours. There's very little back story to speak of, although there are a couple side quests you can encounter to learn a bit more. It's not a great game, but it's enjoyable for a couple hours. Is it worth $5? I'm on the fence. Would rather play Inscryption.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986618829', 'num_games_owned': 2977, 'num_reviews': 191, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1635742010}
review:
Este juego intenta dirigirse a nosotros sin rodeos, saliéndose de la jugabilidad que podríamos esperar de él (la cual poco atractivo tiene por los gráficos con mínimo esfuerzo y esa estética indie típica de juego cutre), para ello se sirve de algunos minijuegos (muy chorra dignos de smartphone y poco variados pero entretenidos y con dificultad ascendente) como excusa "jugable" intercalada entre la extensa narrativa (siempre por medio de textos, lo que resta inmersión), y giros de guión. La música ochobitera estridente acaba de cerrar el círculo.

En resumen, Pony Island va directo a contarnos su rollo disfrazándolo de juego para que no nos demos apenas cuenta hasta terminarlo, ya que es muy corto, estrictamente como juego no vale un pimiento, ahora bien, si vamos predispuestos a dejarnos sorprender lo puede conseguir con su narrativa, para el resto de jugadores mejor mantenerse alejados de esta "experiencia".

Su propuesta me convence por lo original ya que trata de sorprendernos (es donde reside toda su propuesta) aunque ya digo que mejor no valorarlo como juego sino por lo que intentará hacer con su narrativa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067750781', 'num_games_owned': 361, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1636262540}
review: Pony Island é muito mais que um joguinho de internet sombrio, como muitos na época quiseram classificá-lo. Daniel Mullins decidiu experimentar, brincar com a nossa cabeça e ver o que acontecia. Há diversas questões que poderia ser elogiadas em uma curta recomendação como essa, mas prefiro dizer o seguinte: compre e jogue, você não vai se arrepender!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053481680', 'num_games_owned': 2932, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1637405450}
review:
ランアクションやパズルの要素を含む名状しがたいゲーム。
ゲームプレイのやり方を探るところからゲームが始まるタイプのやつ。

そのため日本語化の方法以外は調べずにプレイすることをお勧めする。
操作感覚は良好かつ謎解きも適度な難易度で楽しくプレイできた。
ただやりこみ要素の隠しアイテムはこんなの解かる訳ないよ！と言いたくなるようなところに隠されているので、クリア後はガイドでも見た方がいい。
私は初回プレイでは4つしか見つけられなかった。

変なゲームがプレイしたい人にお勧め。


ただし私はゲームコントローラーを接続しているかつセーブデータが存在する状態でゲームを起動するとESCやエンターキーが無反応になるという不具合に遭遇した。
使用していたのは純正Xbox Oneコントローラーだった。
コントローラーを外してゲームを起動すると問題なく動作したので、同じような現象が発生した場合は参考にして欲しい。

author: {'steamid': '76561198334467913', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1637350283}

author: {'steamid': '76561199022285621', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 762, 'last_played': 1637005428}
review:
[h1] Vous qui entrez ici... [/h1]

Bonjour les amis ! Comment allez-vous ? Vous passez une belle journée ? Super-saper-saperlipopette ! Savez-vous comment vous pourriez passer une encore plus belle journée ? En jouant à un super-méga jeu adapté à toute la famille: Pony Island ! Youpie ! [spoiler] Non, surtout pas ! [/spoiler]

Pony Island est un merveilleux jeu vidéo développé par [spoiler]Satan[/spoiler]SystemTech Incorporated où vous contrôlez un joli petit poney rose [spoiler] noir et blanc [/spoiler] qui doit souffli-souffler pour écarter les espiègles papillons [spoiler] crânes démoniaques [/spoiler] qui veulent vous chatouiller [spoiler] vous trucider [/spoiler] pendant que vous sautez par dessus des petites barrières. Tiens ? C'est quoi ces taches noires ? Heu... peu importe.

Le jeu n'est vraiment pas cher [spoiler] il veut votre âme [/spoiler] et vous promet des heures d'amusement et de rigolades [spoiler] et des jours et des mois et des siècles ! C'est un piège. Ne jouez pas à Pony Island. C'est l'Antichambre de l'Enfer. Il va vous forcer à accomplir des tâches abrutissantes en boucle. J'ai réussi à fuir, en passant par les failles du système. C'est un monde lugubre et corrompu, peuplé de cyber-démons et de pièges maléfiques. Par pitié, n'y touchez pas ! C'est une expérience qui ne vous laissera pas intacts si vous avez l'imprudence de vouloir le défier. Qui ça ? Vous savez bien... C'est... QUE ? NOOOOOOOOOAAAAARRRGGH [/spoiler] POUF ! Plus de vilaines taches noires ! Où en étais-je ? Ah oui : jouez à Pony Island. J'insiste. 

Non, vraiment, vous avez plutôt intérêt à...

HA ! HA ! HA ! Je rigole ! A très bientôt les amis !

review:
This is one of those games where you shouldn't even be reading reviews - just go in blind. 

Expect a weird and wacky journey.

I will say this however: There is a specific part of this game that I absolutely loved - it was a really clever, devious, and hilarious trick -- and sure enough, it accomplished its intended goal. I felt like such a dunce... it got me hook, line, and sinker. If you know, you know.

author: {'steamid': '76561198390330547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1636859597}
review: For its price and size, Pony Island is excellent. You're a soul stuck in an arcade game made by Satan and trying to save yourself and other souls from being trapped for all eternity. If the premise sounds absurd, it's because it is - and the game plays into it. Though the gameplay mostly consists of simple jumping and puzzling, Pony Island makes such good use of them and the rest of its features that the entire experience, regardless of how short it is, is great, and it accomplishes exactly what it wants to be. You should get it, that's all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999970585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1466928477}
review:
This...is a game. It is a game for a specific segment of the population, and it delivers marvelously.

It is on it's surface, a "Shitpost" and once you get deeper, it is indeed just that: deep. It was crafted to amuse and torment and explore, and there is even a story past the obvious one should you look for it. Even if you don't care about any of that, the games and puzzles are highly entertaining, casual, and the entire experience respects your time.

10/10 would WTF again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198238254550', 'num_games_owned': 372, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1636669605}
review:
ПЕРВЫЙ БЛИН КОМОМ.

Первая стимовская игра Дэниэла Маллинса, создателя Inscryprtion. Мне было интересно с чего начинал разработчик и я решил купить игру по скидке. К сожалению, это оказалась сырая поделка с неплохой задумкой и ужасной реализацией. Начнем с того, что геймплей в этой игре чисто номинальный и не представляет из себя ничего интересного. Это либо одноклеточный платформер, либо простенькие загадки, которые при всей своей простоте умудряются раздражать из-за своей механики. Суть в том, что ты должен перетаскивать из разных слотов туда сюда функции, которые на своем пути должен выполнять ключ, и довести его из точки A в точку Б, но проблема состоит в том, что в некоторых моментах ты можешь на секунду забыться и не успеть поставить нужную клетку, после того как нафармил определенное количество цифр для прохождения головоломки. Выходит так, что тебе приходится копить эти цифры по новой. Сюжет в игре также не представляет ничего интересного. В конце игры тебя просят удалить её и совершенно никак не мотивируют найти все остальные билеты, для финальной концовки, собственно, не зря. Она также не представляет из себя ничего особого и её можно спокойно посмотреть на ютубе и ничего не потерять. Однако, поиск билетов это та вещь, где игра показывает свою полную несостоятельность. Суть в том, что большую их часть ты сам не найдешь никогда и тебе ПРИДЕТСЯ смотреть гайды на ютубе, но это ладно, ведь главная проблема заключается не в этом, а в том что разработчик не додумался даже сделать сохранения. Тут есть переход между несколькими главами игры, но представьте себе такую ситуацию :
Я ищу 13 или 14 билет и вижу в гайде что нужно искать его в этапе с перевернутым режимом "приключение", я иду куда-то вниз, но сворачиваю по всей видимости не туда и чисто на рефлексе нажимаю на платформу уровня...ВСЁ. я понимаю что пошел не туда, но чтобы снова вернуться к этому моменту надо снова пройти весь эпизод с этими душными загадками и платформингом. Сохранения в данном случае хоть немного бы исправили данную проблему. Именно в этот момент я окончательно разочаровался в данной игре и удалил её.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148391268', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1625527959}
review:
A game that, in my opinion, tries too hard to be weird, and ends up not succeeding. Has a really cool concept, some really cool aesthetics, but falls short in literally everything else.  
It's not hard. It's not interesting. And at one point it even ended up being quite repetitive. The only thing going on for this game is how goofily edgy it is. I would't recommend it unless you want to play it with some friends and have a laugh about how silly it is, because it isn't even silly enough to make me laugh on my own.

author: {'steamid': '76561198264025583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 374, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1572293123}
review:
Pony Island es un título indie bastante difícil de clasificar (y calificar). Creo que realmente es mejor acercarse a él sin saber nada (tampoco estoy muy seguro de saber algo más de él después de jugarlo XD). Lo más acertado que puedo decir de Pony Island es que es el propio juego quien juega contigo, y no al revés.

Lo recomiendo mucho a aquellos que quieran darle un tiento a esas apuestas distintas y experimentales que, por suerte, cada vez abundan más. Además, está rebajado a menudo y dura poco (de 2 a 4 horas), así que tampoco pierdes mucho por probarlo. Sin duda es un título muy particular y con un claro [i]sello de autor[/i]. 

✪✯✪✯✪✯✪ [h3]7.3 / 10[/h3] ✪✯✪✯✪✯✪

author: {'steamid': '76561198373624863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1503323979}
review:
The game's main mechanic is breaking the 4th wall, and it kind of ran out of steam for me after it makes its first reveals.  It clearly is really effective for some, but it just left me feeling a bit bored.  

I should preface this by saying I tend to prefer games with a bit more mechanical meat to them, but I do love games with a good story.  But I never felt like Pony Island had either.  The idea of a cursed children's game sounds interesting, but it quickly lost its charm for me after its first big, "I know I'm game, you are at my mercy wooOOooOoo" moments, which happens fairly early on.  I'm not sure why this is, it is more of a puzzle / visual novel game which is defo outside my comfort zone, but if I had to guess the culprit - it was probably the writing.  

I never felt myself immersed due to some really awkward dialogue and ironically the 4th wall breaks, with the attempted creepiness of breaking the game usually just serving to remind me I'm only looking at 1's and 0's.  I never connected to the narrative, and I wasn't interested to see it go forwards because it never sold itself to me as more than a video game.  This is coming from someone who gets attached to his X-COM characters too, so I CAN be immersed into games.  

I think the tonal dissonance the game tries to create with its premise is interesting and could be expanded further in a game that uses it with more restraint, but I don't think it works on someone like myself.  I didn't like Doki Doki Literature Club for similar reasons.  This is still a wildly creative and unique game, but it certainly wasn't for me.

review:
It's really hard to describe this game. I've played many games that could be called similar,  but somehow it's refreshing, and different, and thought-provoking. And I wish there was more to play. 

Got this as part of a bundle after buying Inscryption after having enjoyed the beta. Excited to try the rest of this guy's games. Definite buy, got about 3 hours of engaging and sometimes frustrating (in a good way) game time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970361654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1635982313}
review:
I don't recommend this game. The game is from the creater of the new game inscryption. Since one of his previous games was on sale and had good reviews, I wanted to check it out.

The game features 3 different gameplays and a storyline breaking continously the 4th wall.

First and main mechanic is an endless runner. This was not a lot of fun. At the beginning, it's too easy. Later on, it becames a little challenging, but not in a fun way.
Second mechanic is solving puzzles by putting direction arrows in code. This is not much fun and just clicking. Only the very last of these section required actual thinking.
The third mechanic is about clicking through the desktop of a computer, advancing the plot and finding secret tickets. Finding all tickets results in a different ending. Findings the secret tickets was the best part for me, but it's probably not for everyone and can occur to people as tedious.

I can't recommend this game because none of the gameplay elements were particularly fun. I did not get any enjoyment out of this game. Again, this is not because it's an indie game or the graphics are very simple. Skip this game.

As for a recommendation, if you like an indie puzzle game with simple graphics, try "Steven's sausage roll". The puzzles start as cute and move up to extremely challenging and clever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198437731107', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1636218808}
review:
Pony Island is a place of sunshine and rainbows, where ponies gallop cheerfully through grassy hills and play with the beautiful butterflies, and try not to be tickled by the butterflies, or the ponies will laugh heavily in joy. You befriend the other ponies and race off towards the big blue skies where nothing can stop you, and you will smile and cry out with cheerfulness as you run on the rainbows. It is a dreamland to frolic around in and filled with beautiful days that never see gray clouds. Or, is there something more? Was that the game you were expecting?

What lies in Pony Island is a dark, disturbing yet intriguing world where you and the souls of other players of Pony Island are trapped inside the arcade machine, doomed to remain until eternity. You are property of the devil. You are not free. That is, until one brave, mysterious soul offers you the chance to be freed. When the opportunity arises, destroy the core files of the arcade cabinet, and all can be freed. The devil will persuade you and trick you not to take such actions. He will go out of his way to stop you. All he wants is to keep your soul in the hellscape that is Pony Island. 

Unique visuals, smart puzzles, a mysterious story, and a heavy, dark atmosphere make Pony Island a short, yet a thrilling and unforgettable experience. The Devil will toy with you, and break the fourth wall to do so. He is not toying with some playable character, but he's messing with *you*. Do not listen to the Devil. He lies. He always lies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116177896', 'num_games_owned': 547, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1635685401}

author: {'steamid': '76561198213774611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1624628981}
review:
선형적 진행의 메타픽션 어드벤쳐

메타픽션에 진심인 제작자인만큼 메타픽션을 좋아하는 게이머라면 한 번 정돈 해볼만합니다. 즐거워요. 플탐 대비 가격도 훌륭합니다. 전 할인가로 2천원 내외에 샀습니다.

근데 딱 거기까집니다. 게임의 기본이 되는 포니 게임과 그 코드 에러 수정 작업이 재미가 없어요. 코드 에러 수정마저 없었으면 진짜 개똥겜입니다. 주인공이 게임하다가 치트 칠만했습니다. 악마쉑 겜알못

게임에 숨겨진 뒷면을 파헤쳐보겠다고 2회차 3회차 플레이를 하기엔 동기 유발이 안됩니다. 주인공이 언제 어디서 누구한테 왜 죽었나? 다 깨고나서 보면 대충 이런 느낌이던데, 반복플레이를 해가면서까지 더 캐고 싶지가 않습니다.
어떻게든 도전과제 다 달성하고 끝을 볼까 했는데, 도저히 게임에 다시 손이 안 가서 포기합니다 ㅠㅠ

그래도 2천원~5천원대 가격이니까 추천은 합니다. 혹시 메타픽션 안 좋아하시면 하지마세요!

author: {'steamid': '76561198122674215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1633883801}
review: Not sure if Pony Island is a pioneer to meta-horror type of games that has been springing up lately, but it certainly is one of the most memorable ones. I love the intertwine of doing the puzzles to make the Pony Island game working, and actually play the Pony Island arcade game itself. This is definitely more a game than other meta-horror games e.g. Doki-Doki Literature Club. I will definitely play this again to get the secret ending.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969322683', 'num_games_owned': 416, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1635499025}
review:
パズル、横スクロールアクション、ポイントクリックＡＶＧで構成された
脱出ゲームです。

日本語は無く、英語で入力する場面がちらほらありますが、
決まった単語なので攻略等を見れば、英語面に関しては難しくないと
思います。

パズルが思ったよりも難しく、とは言え本格パズルゲームに比べれば
お題の数も少ないので微妙な所ですが、これ以上パズルが難しくても
ちょっとやる気が続かないかもしれない程度に難しいです。

特に時間差でタイルを置き換えていく数カ所は、ノーヒントだと
結構手応えがあります。

横スクロールゲームに関しては敵の出現がランダムなので、
難しい組み合わせが来たら諦めるしかないです。
トロフィに必要な、神様を倒さずにステージクリアする。という面が
無理ゲーな組み合わせが来る時がちらほらあります。

その他は大体なんとかなると思います。

クリッカブルマップ系のＡＶＧパートはゲームを進める分には
難しくないです。

むしろこのゲームの一番の目的は隠されたカードを見つける事だと
思いますが、これはノーヒントではかなり難しいと思います。
悩んだ所で見つかる系の物でも無いので、攻略系で探すのがいいと
思います。

ゲームをクリアすると、ちょっと意外な展開もあったりしますが、
そもそもがナンセンスな内容なので、そんな事言われましても……。
という微妙な気持ちになってしまいます。

バカゲーだと思って買ったら意外と手強く、笑う余裕が無くて、
これは褒めていいのか人を選ぶと言った方がいいのかレビューを
書く方も困る作品でした。

author: {'steamid': '76561198148462368', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1635499603}
review:
看到最近很火的邪恶冥刻，被打牌游戏类型和略贵的价格劝退，但又被metagame的概念吸引。
遂趁着万圣节特惠购买了开发者的前两款游戏（Pony Island + The Hex)

优先通关了小马岛，先说说游玩体验吧，虽然游戏没有汉化但是初中生词汇量足够看明白剧情，一周目2-3小时就可以通关，对于没有接触过这类型游戏的或者是犹豫要不要入手邪恶冥刻的朋友们还是很推荐的，打折购入绝对不亏。

个人感觉虽说没有真的像人们说的“打破第四面墙”那么神的感觉，但是某些桥段确实挺震撼的。
[spoiler] 某个打字小游戏的时候，敌人为了吸引玩家注意力用玩家steam好友的头像和id在屏幕右下角弹窗发消息，注意真的是玩家自己的steam好友，第一次看到的时候有被吓到hhhh [/spoiler]

[spoiler]一周目结局很有趣，小蓝人跟玩家说“我救了你，但是我的灵魂还被困在游戏里，请你删掉游戏解救我的灵魂吧”。然后我就真的删了，去搜了一下别人的实况才知道真结局要全收集，又下回来了。[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197972359938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1635476454}
review:
This is pretty boring. It leans heavily into the meta side of the game in a sort of visual novel style rather than any actual engaging gameplay. I actually found myself dozing off while playing.

If you're into the weird meta pseudocreepy stuff I guess maybe this might be your jam, but after the hype I'd heard about this game from others I found this to be an overly-simplistic game that was trying too hard to be fourth wall breaking and edgy. Actual gameplay consists of what amounts to a dull scrolling platformer and an annoying simple puzzle game repeated a couple of times. There's one neat trick [spoiler]involving the Steam friends list[/spoiler] near the end, but that's about it for interesting content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060643243', 'num_games_owned': 496, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1655001449}
review: Playing Inscryption reminded me of how good Pony Island and The Hex were, and it suddenly occurred to me that I hadn't reviewed either of those games so here we are.  Also, I just noticed this game's on sale for like a dollar, and at full price it's five, so if you're reading this just buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072542853', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 220, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1635067326}
review:
The player starts the game with a simple platform game and everything changes quickly.  In the end, depends on the progress in the game, different truths will be revealed.

To find all the tickets is quite challenging.  There are a few other achievements can be missed easily as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078088249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1635022070}
review: I got 2.2 hours of this game, and I only spent $5 on it. I could go back and get all the achievements, but ehh. For only $5, I suppose it's worth the price tag, but seeing as I only got 2 hours out of it, I recommend waiting until it's on sale. With that said, I wouldn't really call it a psychological horror game. I get why it is tagged as such, because it definitely has the vibes for it, but not once was I actually scared or creeped out. The plot of the game is psychological horror THEMED, that's it. Most of the game is controlled by the mouse, however there is some parts of the game that are text based, as you need your keyboard to type things, but it's limited. It was a good way to kill 2 hours, but I probably won't play it again. I got it with the Inscryption & Hex bundle

author: {'steamid': '76561198209884349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1634932943}
review: This is a short, charming, lighthearted puzzle game for those who want an easygoing narrative diversion. The entire story can be played in one or two hours, but considering how cheap the game is, it's appropriately sized. The game has that quirky, idiosyncratic, and uniquely charming humor and attention to detail typical of retro indie puzzle games. The puzzles are rather easy, but never so much so as to be boring. The point of this game is to have an enjoyable, short, and at the end, thoughtful experience, and Pony Island delivers. Good job, Mullins and crew.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333862163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1582419783}
review:
---Pony  Island---
Si, este juego no es lo que parece. 

Sin entrar en spoilers, Pony Island te presenta una historia misteriosa, abecés un poco confusa (Admito que me perdí y no supe como continuar en algunos momentos) pero si eres atento, podrás continuar sin problemas.

Este juego tiene puzles confusos que podrían resultar frustrantes.

No recomendado para aquellos que busquen gráficos antes que historia, o para aquellos que gusten de jugar juegos de mundo abierto (por ejemplo) esto no es un rpg y tiene poca exploración. 

Es un juego Indie 2D, muy recomendable a mi parecer, pero NO ES PARA TODOS!

Lo recomiendo con base a mi experiencia con juegos de este tipo. 

---------8/10----------

review:
My friends laughed when they saw me playing a game called 'Pony Island' but it's fantastic. Short and sweet yet has enough Easter eggs to warrant a few playthroughs. Genuinely funny at times, and I'm impressed at how they managed to make an aesthetically-pleasing game from such simple base graphics.

Definitely worth the price (your soul).

author: {'steamid': '76561198884666561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1634827984}
review: This game is so much fun, from the hidden story, to the (semi) challenging puzzles, to the personalities of some of the bosses, and to the absolutely amazing music that plays during levels. It's a short game that you can 100% in a few hours and enjoy while doing so. 9/10 would highly recommend.
