author: {'steamid': '76561197971701135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1604856327}
review:
Boooooring. 
Don't believe the hype (I never learn) The most funny thing about this game is the metacritic score. 

Sure the concept is "funky" and a bit "crazy", but that is about all you can say about this "game".

The gameplay is completely non-existent and with completely banal puzzles. 

I you want to play something that is actually interesting and challenging for real then play something like The Witness or Baba is You. If you want to play something with the concept of being trapped in a game then play Omikron: The Nomad Soul instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996633876', 'num_games_owned': 1153, 'num_reviews': 370, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1604797303}
review:
Okay, well, I don't really have much to say about Pony Island.

I didn't really love it or hate it, it's just another vaguely meta game, probably in the game's favour it doesn't burden you with philosophy or anything trite like that.

I guess it was fine?

You spend most of the game probably just doing a very simplistic jumping game. Sometimes you shoot stuff. There's also some puzzles which are possibly the highlight, and the devs tried to vary things up here and there as you go along, but honestly I got kind of bored by the end. Fortunately, Pony Island is a pretty short game so it's not that big of an issue. There's hints in the 'corrupted text' of every puzzle too, but some are more like outright instructions on how to beat the puzzle.

As for the story, I was pleasantly surprised that... well, okay I can't really talk about the story without going into spoilers, so consider yourself warned. The story is basically a straight shooter, I thought there'd be some asinine twist or something but it's just a clear-cut story, which I think works to the game's favour.

I wouldn't go out of my way to buy Pony Island, I got it in a bundle, it's fine. If I could give this a middling or 'whatever' recommendation, I guess I would. You won't hate it, but you probably won't get much out of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082820960', 'num_games_owned': 492, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1604361727}
review: Очень простенькая сюжетно игра, особенно после множества других на подобную тематику (Stanley Parable, Talos Principle, Undertale, SUPERHOT Antichamber). На всю игру есть только один действительно неожиданный забавный момент, который зависит от наличия друзей в стиме, но всё же самое неожиданное в этой игре это то, что раскрывающаяся спустя полчаса после начала идея никак не развивается и не разворачивается. Всю игру ждёшь сюжетного поворота хоть куда-нибудь, но он так и не поворачивается, мех

author: {'steamid': '76561198032219063', 'num_games_owned': 792, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1604255404}
review:
Pony Island ist eines dieser Titel, die nicht durch Gameplay überzeugen. Oder Story. Oder Grafik.
Ehh?!
Pony Island spielt mit der vierten, und, wenn man so will, fünften Wand. Und damit, dass es sich mit keiner der oben genannten Dinge im Weg steht (hier einen zwanzigseitigen Rant über die albernen Schwierigkeitsspikes in Undertale einfügen). Oder mehr seien will, als es ist.  Mit 2-4 Stunden ist es ein kurzes Spiel, aber kein zu kurzes Spiel. Wenn man Lust darauf hat, bietet es genug Metaebenen, um die Spielzeit nochmal mit doppelt so viel Denk- oder Recherchezeit zu strecken. Muss man aber nicht.
Ich gebe häufig negative Bewertungen für Titel, die nur so lala sind. Hier nicht, weil Pony Island meine Zeit nicht verschwendet oder meinem Geldbeutel ungerechtfertigt weh getan hat.
Außerdem hat Satan gesagt, dass ich bei einer negativen Bewertung nie wieder mit einem Pony auf den finalen Kreuzzug ziehen darf.

author: {'steamid': '76561198225416840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1604350470}
review:
[h1]Ich habe meine Seele verkauft.[/h1]

Unfassbar gutes Indie-Puzzle-Game mit mal mehr und mal weniger Psycho-Horror-Atmosphäre! Pony Island zeigt wunderbar, welch tolle Ideen Indie-Entwickler haben. Davon können sich die AAA-Entwickler mal eine Scheibe von abschneiden, anstatt immer den gleichen Kram rauszubringen.

Die Rätsel sind super, nicht zu schwer, aber auch nicht einfach, nämlich genau richtig. Mein persönliches Highlight ist die Interaktion und Kommunikation zwischen Spieler und Spiel. Wir schreiben, wie in einem echten Chat, mit Charakteren aus dem Spiel und das funktioniert aus meiner Sicht sehr gut.

Es gibt auch einige bewusst eingebaute geniale "Events", die ich zwar gerne nennen würde, aber nicht spoilern möchte. Spielt selbst, um es herauszufinden, es lohnt sich. Klare Empfehlung!

[b]10/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198044096372', 'num_games_owned': 751, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1604342866}

review:
Un excellent jeu "méta" dans le style de "the stanley parable", qui à travers son histoire interroge de manière intelligente les notions de gameplay, la relation créateur-joueur, et joue intelligemment avec le "dedans-dehors" du jeu.
Je recommande chaudement, surtout vu le prix.
Compter 2h de jeu environ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042535807', 'num_games_owned': 1035, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1600989042}
review: The game just isn't fun enough to play for the meta-commentary. It's too much in your face with no subtlety. The actual gameplay ranges from silly puzzles with mediocre UI to terrible "platforming". It combines a bunch of stereotypes and genres together, but none of it is particularly good. As a commentary on most games being bad, this is spot on. Unfortunately, it does so by being kind of bad itself. Sounds are jarring, UI is a mess, art is amateurish, presentation (which I guess is the "story") is a meta-mess. It has its moments and its charm, but I just didn't find it appealing enough to persevere through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043439432', 'num_games_owned': 668, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1456415700}
review:
For better or for worse, Pony Island came out in a world that had already played Undertale, so I have to utter the cursed phrase, 'if you liked Undertale, play Pony Island'.

It's an ecclectic mix of genre-bending that tells an atmospheric story, and predicts and messes with the player's expectations.  It's hard to come away from it without feeling impressed. At its cheap price, it's a great way to spend a few hours, and I look forward to playing the dev's other games when I can.

review:
다회차에 의미가 있는 언더테일류 게임. 언더테일보단 덜 정교하지만 생각보다 재밌다.
종교적 소재와 메타 요소에 관심이 있다면 나름 즐겁게 플레이할 듯.
게임과 퍼즐 요소가 혼합되어 있는데, 둘 다 수월하지만 컨트롤이나 논리 퍼즐에 약하다면 피로할 것이다.
숨겨진 티켓을 찾는 재미가 있다. 가이드를 잘 따라가면 적은 회차만에 모든 도전 과제를 모으는 것이 가능.

ステージが進むにつれ不穏につぐ不穏でなにこれどーなってんの？！がいっぱい詰まってます。

こんな感想、ジャケから想像つかないってば。

author: {'steamid': '76561198132503739', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 548, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1602937791}
review:
[b]My playtime:[/b] 4.1h (based on Steam, 100% achievement)
[b]Grindy Achievement(s):[/b] No.
[b]Optional Achievement(s):[/b] Yes (12 achievements).
[b]Difficult Achievement(s):[/b] No.

[h1]Intro[/h1]
[i]Pony Island[/i] gives an interesting premise with its colorful and children-friendly look on the menu. You might assume that it's safe for your children to play and boot it up for them. Your assumption turned to be wrong after you tried the game for the first time - it was a lie to let your soul trapped in the game, playing the same game over and over for eternity. [i]Pony Island[/i] is a game of deception, repetition, and out-of-the-box thinking.

[b]Pros:[/b]
- Some levels and collectibles need out of the box thinking to solve and obtain
- Multiple endings

[b]Cons:[/b]
- The game might be too repetitive at some point
- People who don't know algorithm might have a problem to understand some parts of the game

[h1]Should you buy this game?[/h1]
[b]Yes.[/b]
[i]If you know a bit about algorithm and like to play bizarre games with some puzzles, buy this game. Make sure to buy it at a discount though because it's very short.[/i]

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[h1]In-Depth Review[/h1]

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
You play [i]Pony Island[/i] in an old arcade machine. It usually has 2D, black and white graphics on an arcade-looking screen with other colors at some cases. Most graphical changes are spent in making a lot of [i]Pony Island[/i] variations, the game that you played on the arcade machine, where the most noticeable difference happens when the game switched to full color, making everything looks cuter.

[h1]Story[/h1]
Most dialogues are unnecessary remarks from the creator of the game within the game about how you played it. Some are important facts about the game lore that has no depth in it. Dialogues are enjoyable if you don't think too much about the whole story since there are none.

[h1]The game[/h1]
[b]Tinkering the System[/b]
The game starts with a glitchy game where you have to think of a way to make it work. You need to check anything that might help you to fix it and this will happen a lot, especially in the first few minutes of the game. Some will be as easy as ticking the "fix the start menu" tickbox, some will need more thinking to solve. I didn't know what I was doing or what the game was about at first, but it was fun tinkering the game to find secrets and read dialogues.

This gameplay is one of the game's charm and the developer knows well how to make use of it. Collectibles are also introduced in the form of tickets, which can be obtained by doing a specific action. You'll need to do a lot of out of the box thinking and exploration to get them all since some are very tricky to get.

[b]Side-scroller Runner[/b]
[i]Pony Island[/i], the game within the game, is a side-scroller runner game where you have to jump above obstacles to reach the goal. More obstacles and enemies will be introduced as you progress, making the game more difficult yet still easy to beat. The game is very forgiving and you can retry the game as many times as you want if you fail. However, playing the slow, easy game over and over again might be boring at some point. Luckily, the game finished sometime after that; it's as if the game knows when it should stop.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2261064317 

[b]Algorithm Puzzle[/b]
The game has puzzles in the form of an algorithm code block. A key is introduced at the start and it must be delivered to the end with the help of some arrow blocks. It might seem easy at first until the game introduces logic to the game, where you also have to satisfy some logic conditions to pass some lines. People who are familiar with an algorithm might have no problem with these, although people who aren't might be able to learn it on the spot because of how simple it is. The puzzles itself will be progressively harder after the introduction of the logic condition and a certain symbol, which might make the game to be confusing yet still easy to solve.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2261064373 

[b]Bosses[/b]
The game has 4+ boss battles with different gameplays. Most of them are the improved versions of [i]Pony Island[/i] game and algorithm puzzle, although there is an original one where you have to do a certain task to beat the boss. The latter one is the one that I liked the most since it's full of deception and hilarious.

[b]Length and Replayability[/b]
I finished the game in 2.2h and spent the rest of my playtime to obtain the rest of the achievements and secrets. The game has 2 endings and some secrets, making replayability to be a must if you're up for some challenge. You don't have to start the game from the beginning if you want to unlock everything since the game allows you to play the game from a certain part of the game.

[h1]Specs[/h1]
Intel Core i5-9300H 2.40GHz, 8GB RAM, NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
It's a nice short game about ponies where you have to deal with an algorithm puzzle, play a side-scroller runner, and tinker around the in-game system to fix or unlock something. The game might feel too repetitive at some point although it's short enough to keep you playing until the end.

[quote][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/7871885/]Follow our curator page,[b] OCG-Curations[/b], if you like and want to see more reviews like this one.[/url][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198002134811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1601660636}
review: Pony Island was a really fun little game, with a lot of creativity and humor. Trying to cleverly uncover the right approach to "hack" your way through the game was quite satisfying. The run/jump/shoot gameplay of the "pony island" main game served its purpose as a mild challenge at times, and it's intentionally simplistic to drive home that you wouldn't want to be stuck playing this dumb little game for eternity. The puzzles required some thought in a few cases, and I liked the way it was laid out like a code block. In my opinion, people complaining about satanism or whatever are totally blowing it out of proportion. This game is not remotely about devil-worship; the devil is the enemy, after all! I liked the few moments that mess with your head, I won't spoil anything here. If you like a subversive and fourth-wall-breaking game like Doki Doki Literature Club, OneShot, Undertale, or The Stanley Parable, then definitely give this a try as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072422740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1599827749}
review: I was hoping for an intriguing psychological -fourth-wall breaking- adventure trip like the Beginners Guide or Stanley Parable but this is mainly half baked and obnoxious, I could not play this for more than 20 minutes before it gets repetitive and sorry to say, boring. While the initial idea was surely fun and I applaud and usually love good alternative indie creativity on Steam, I cannot recommended this "experience" as it seems unfinished and just one idea dragged into eternity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043642717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1601267495}
review:
Achievements: Not a hard 100%.  A few runs might be needed, but luckily collectibles are retained on subsequent play throughs.  

It is difficult to review a game like this without revealing (and thus spoiling) all that makes it so charming and fun.  Being surprised by the uniqueness of Pony Island is what makes it so great.  It's probably best to play this with as few preconceptions as possible, so I'll try to keep my comments terse.  

Pony Island is a strange, experimental game which defies the limits of its genres.  One could call it a puzzle game, a horror game, a runner game, but these labels might misrepresent what the game ultimately delivers.  Liking the individual genres of Pony Island is not necessary to enjoy the game itself.  The mechanics are varied enough to keep the gameplay from stagnating and becoming boring.  There's enough challenge to keep the player engaged without ever becoming frustrating.  

This game reminded me why I love indie games.  It's delightfully odd and unpredictable.  The story was both gripping and humorous.  Though it was a little short (one run is ~2 hours), I'd certainly call it a worthwhile experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062401781', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1601303291}
review: Monotonous and too satanic for me to enjoy it, makes it distasteful. It's trying to be edgy and scary but the gameplay becomes extremely repetitive after 15 minutes, the puzzles are incredibly easy once you get the hang of it and its not worth it, I get that the "help me I am trapped in a game" premise is interesting, but Doki Doki Literature Club made it far more engaging than this crap being only a point and click.

author: {'steamid': '76561198338533435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1577037154}
review:
The premise is neat and there are definitely some interesting moments in the game, but overall I was quite disappointed. Decent puzzles, game mechanics and graphics, but the story was paper-thin and too predictable for me. Once I got the gist of the game I ended up being quite bored despite the short gameplay.

I need to mention though that I'm not really into platformers or shooters to start with, and Pony Island is mostly that.  So if you're into those, it might be the right game for you. However, if you're looking for something original that subverts traditional game mechanics or breaks the fourth wall (which is how Pony Island was recommended to me), there's better games than this out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275540612', 'num_games_owned': 1595, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1600058737}
review: le tenia mucha fe a este juego al comienzo te vas a entretener ya que el pony a medida que avanza en el juego conseguira distintos poderes para poder jugar, luego exploras distintos escritorios para poder encontrar claves que te permitiran seguir con la historia, pero lo que más me cabreo, me aburrio del juego es el puzzle de las llaves donde tienes que mover flechas para que llegue a su lugar, son muchos pero muchos puzzles donde el unico objetivo es que una llave llegue a su sitio, al comienzo quedas wow que entretenido pero luego al ver el mismo puzzle ya estilo matematico que tienes que Y tiene que ser menor que 0 y tienes que hacer que la llave pase varias veces por un mismo lugar luego que X sea superior a 90 y que Y sea menor que tal numero, me llego a aburrir, esperaba más, nose si me lo vaya a terminar, espero que si, pero bueh, esperaba algo más

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1599578691}
review:
Pony Island is essentially a 2D retro pixel puzzle/hacking/desktop simulator.   Trapped inside some kind of corrupted arcade game/endless runner, you have to click through the various puzzle/programming glitches to escape. 

The idea and theme are really clever here and nicely done.  Unfortunately, great ideas, no matter how well they're scribbled on a napkin, don't always turn into actually enjoyable video games.   The developer kindly made the game work mostly with the mouse, which is a plus, and you get a few graphics tweaking options, but there's no 4K support despite this being released in 2016.   Normally in reviews I will always call out if the graphics are bad... in this case, like with almost every indie game, that's true.   Pony Island thematically requires bad graphics, it sort of gets a pass, where most of the time these bad pixel graphics are just used by talentless/budgetless developers as a nostalgia gouging substitute for proper PC graphics.

The puzzles are kind of okay, but nothing amazing.  The $7.50 price tag for something that is arguably more "art" than actual video game is just too high.   You could get as much enjoyment watching a Youtube playthrough of the game as actually playing it, and save yourself some money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103264863', 'num_games_owned': 1228, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1599121672}
review:
[h1][i]Not[/i] Exactly What It Says On The Tin[/h1]
[b]Summary:[/b]
Imagine a cute casual game that's all about adorable ponies. This is not that game.

[b]Review:[/b]
Pony Island is a very short, very unexpected game of platforming action that plays quite a lot like a running game. For the unfamiliar, a running game is about guiding a character, be it jumping, ducking, etc, as the stage auto-scrolls forward. You don't exactly control how your character moves, only when they jump, and in this case shoot. These aren't too difficult, but in some areas can definitely require paying attention to obstacles and enemies as they come at you.

The game also has a lot of puzzles, the object of which is to get a key (and later, butterflies) to a goal. The trick being that they move constantly and you must arrange pieces, like arrows pointing to the left or the right, in order to move the key through lines of code to fulfill certain conditions and unlock whatever it is you need to unlock to progress the story.

The story must be experienced to be appreciated. It isn't deep and not even very original, but it is a great big part of what makes this game worth playing. Not specifically because the story is good, but because the game is greater than the sum of its parts. The way the story coalesces with the puzzles and the action resulted in a couple of baffling moments, and one or two where I genuinely laughed out loud.

There isn't much to this game, I don't even remember buying it. I played it on impulse and came away happy. Again, this isn't the most challenging game I've ever played, but it does pretty much everything it means to do very well.

Two gripes: there were some issues playing in ultrawide (I'll get to that in a sec), and a certain part of this game was unnecessarily tricky due to a lack of control customization.

This game was played with all settings maxed out using an Intel i7-8700k, 32gb DRAM, Samsung Evo SSD, 1080ti, running at 3440x1440. This caused some real problems when the action got a little hot and I moved my mouse beyond the screen, causing the game to pause until re-selected. A game like this [i]should[/i] be played in full screen, but in that mode parts of the games faux menus were cut off. It was a problem more than a few times in either mode, but not a deal breaker.

[b]Pros:[/b]
[list]
    [*]Simple to learn
    [*]Fair challenge
    [*]Clever puzzles
    [*]Charming presentation
    [*]Many mini games
    [*]Never felt padded or repetitive
    [*]Humorous writing
    [*]Lots of secrets to discover
    [*]Very unique experience
[/list]

[b]Cons:[/b]
[list]
    [*]Ultrawide has issues
    [*]Secrets sometimes nonsensically obscure
    [*]Cannot invert mouse
[/list]

[b]Verdict: 8/10[/b]

A clever and funny puzzle and platforming game that didn't overstay it's welcome. Don't let the title, presentation, or any of its other parts fool you; this game's got [strike]your[/strike] soul!

author: {'steamid': '76561198166502583', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1477839397}

-Gran variedad de mecénicas.

-apartado visual correcto.

Puntos negativos:
-Banda sonora olvidable.
-Extremadamente corto. Dura entre 2h a 3h.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063662656', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1598360774}
review:
Extraño juego de puzzles, plataformas y preguntas-respuestas, todo ello unido por una historia en la que unos archivos demoníacos intentan robar tu alma y tú, junto a un ente desconocido que te va guiando, tratas de impedirlo y, de paso, salvar otras almas prisioneras. 
Los puzzles son entretenidos y tienen su miga, aunque son tal vez un poco repetitivos. En las secciones de plataformas manejas a un poni que salta, planea y lanza rayos por la boca en todas las direcciones. Simple y entretenido. Y la historia va de destruir archivos informáticos perversos y demoníacos que tratan de robarte el alma, para lo cual hay que resolver más puzzles, luchar o contestar a las preguntas (atentos a los vaciles al final) de una IA superdesarrollada. A todo esto, hablando en chat a ratos con un personaje desconocido que te va ayudando a eliminar los archivos corruptos mediante un extraño hackeo.
Música de ocho bits, textos en un montón de idiomas y duración escasa, lo cual se agradece porque la fórmula, que así funciona, se podría hacer pesada a largo plazo.
Barato, bueno y original.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050591619', 'num_games_owned': 2320, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1571345642}
review:
I was able to play this during some downtime at work. It was...interesting. The base game of making a pony jumping over some gates is pretty dull, but I did enjoy the puzzles, and the overarching meta plot was pretty bizarre (in a good way). And for anyone that’s played the game, [spoiler]I about shit myself when I got a Steam message from my friend after I said “something vile.” It probably didn’t help that my vile thing was “scat boner.”[/spoiler]

[b]Disclaimer: This review was written in October 2019 and posted in August 2020. [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198893483535', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 276, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1597694208}
review: This game is absolutely phenomenal and breaks the fourth wall better than any other games I've seen yet. From a seemingly harmless game of playing as a pony jumping over fences to a horrific shift in tone, it really does keep the player intrigued at what will happen next and what is going on with the game itself. Definitely worth playing to the end and a great experience overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011854190', 'num_games_owned': 574, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1597521966}
review:
[h1]"MLP (не)здорового человека"[/h1]

[i]До конца неясно под какими веществами разработчик придумывал и создавал эту игру.[/i][hr][/hr]
• На странице игры, в её описании написано, что это [b]НЕ[/b] игра про пони. С одной стороны автор поступил верно, сказав правду. Ведь без этого продаж могло быть в разы меньше. А с другой стороны зря он так сделал! Надо было маскировать суть игры как можно лучше. Ведь тогда и эмоции были бы ярче.

• Итак, мы попадаем в когтистые лапы Сатаны и его игрового автомата. Задача проста, выбраться и попутно спасти всех, кого сможем. Сатана будет нам мешать, переписывать код игры и [i]"ломать"[/i] саму игру разными способами.  Мы же будем фиксить баги, стрелять лазерами и сдувать бабочек.... наркомания чистой воды. Проходится сие [i]"чудо"[/i] за 2-3 часа + ещё 1 час на открытие всех достижений.

• Я вот ожидал некого разнообразия в геймплее, а именно минимальной вариативности в некоторых местах. Допустим общение с чат-ботами можно было расширить, а то получается, что там всего пара активных фраз. А ещё тут можно покарать Иисуса, ну или не делать этого... В общем, игра необычна и потратить на неё пару часов было не жалко, тем более ценник у неё совсем небольшой.

[b]Итог:[/b] [u]на один вечер, и только если приелись другие игры![/u][hr][/hr]
Курирую в "Steam" - [url=store.steampowered.com/curator/44823445/]тут[/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561198001964986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1597217690}
review:
An interesting game that sits in its own niche alongside experiences like Undertale and Doki Doki Literature Club. I'm recommending it solely because there are not many games of this type out there - however I do think the game has its significant flaws. 

The puzzle design is a bit obtuse and repetitive - I found the core loop of the game to be really tiring after a while. The last 10-20 mins of the game reserve all the neat tricks and it's really a shame these things weren't spread out across the whole game experience. Personally I ended up using a walkthrough, because it allowed me to experience the game minus many of the frustrations of solving moon logic to collect tickets.

The story is extremely predictable and could have been so much more if they didn't choose the obvious angle they chose. It's honestly a bit of a disappointment to be presented with another "satan haunting a machine" type narrative when there's a lot of cool horror stories that could've been instead.

So, overall - is this game worth a 9 out of 10? Absolutely not. If you want a solid all round game with clever similar narratives then check out Undertale, DDLC, or Hypnospace Outlaw. Is it worth a curious look though when on sale? Sure. As harsh as my critique might be I do applaud the dev for embracing a cool and weird game concept and running with it - it just needed more refining.

review:
When you learn what the word "metanarrative" means and need to rush and tell everybody.

In all seriousness the game has some neat subversions and I really like the puzzle sections that make clever use of the UI, but outside of that the overall experience feels kind of cheap. If cleverness for its own sake appeals to you, then this is definitely worth checking out, but other than that I find the postmodern commentary on video game feedback loops pretty basic and shallow, which lessened the experience for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198795504448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1597014360}
review:
Haber, no quiero contar mucho, asi que solo dire esto:
-Empezas siendo un poni y saltando, tan simple como se escucha, mas temprano que tarde la situacion se va retorciendo completamente, y a traves de un habil uso de romper la 4º pared, el juego te va a guiando a traves de puzzles ingeniosos (y afortunadamente) no demasiado dificiles, es cuestion de interpretarlos con atencion, con esto vamos avanzando en una historia mas interesante de lo que pensariamos en un primer momento, no dire mas
-Hay muchos juegos indie dando vueltas por ahi, planteando diversos giros respecto a la jugabilidad o sobre como contar historias, bueno este es uno de ellos
-El juego vale la pena sobradamente, yo lo compre cuando estaba de oferta, pero incluso sin el descuento se justifica sin lugar a dudas, no me quiero ir por las ramas, pero hay que ser honestos, en lo que respecta a innovacion/experimentacion, es el sector indie el que marca la tendencia a seguir, no por eso sera necesariamente bueno, pero si estas buscando algo distinto, este es tu sector

author: {'steamid': '76561198992447801', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1590180530}

author: {'steamid': '76561198083930000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 261, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1595854804}
review:
트레일러만 봐도 알 수 있듯이, 절대 겉으로 보이는 귀여운 게임은 아니다.

이 게임은 크게 세 가지 파트로 이루어져 있다. 첫 번째는 마우스를 사용해 방해물을 없애고 목적지로 달려가는 아케이드 파트. 두 번째는 화살표로 프로그램의 흐름을 바꿔 조건을 만족하는 프로그래밍 파트. 세 번째는 게임 내부의 OS같은 공간에서 벌어지는 어드벤쳐 파트.

이질적이고 공통성이 없는 세 가지 파트가 의외로 조화롭게 이어져 있다. 플레이어에게 의도적으로 잘못된 정보를 보여주는 등 뒤통수를 칠만한 요소들도 있다. 각 파트마다 게임의 깊이는 얇지만 난이도는 절대 쉽지 않다.

스토리는 상당히 단순하다. 어느 오락실에서 귀여운 게임을 실행했지만, 사실 그 게임은 영혼을 흡수하는 악마의 게임이라는 것. 덕분에 분위기는 전체적으로 어두침침하지만 공포스러운 점프스케어 요소는 없다. 


가벼운 가격에 가볍게 즐길 수 있는 게임.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021228038', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1596808586}
review:
Я играл в Pony Island ожидая, что все пройдет по мему The Dev Team Thinks Of Everything, но Pony Island оказалась крайне линейным приключением с минимумом возможностей эту линейность нарушить.

Вот есть, к примеру, головоломка, где LASER_POWER нужно сделать больше нуля. Я ее решил и оставил счетчик тикать: мол, пусть LASER_POWER будет не просто больше нуля, пусть он будет больше сотни. Но это никак не повлияло на игру: монстры убиваются ровно с той же скоростью, что и при LASER_POWER = 1. Конечно, всегда можно свалить все на дерьмовый код Сатаны, но что-то тут все равно не то.

Или взять тех же чатботов. Они реагируют только на те слова, которые нужны по сюжету. А ведь это так не сложно: посидеть один вечерок и придумать им всем еще пару забавных реплик для диалогов.

Еще меня крайне удивило, что мне не пришлось копаться в файлах игры, а слом четвертой стены происходит в 2,5 местах.

Хотя что еще можно было получить от игры за 4 бакса.

review: It's... fine? It's probably fine, but it left me feeling disappointed. It sets itself up as being subversive and surprising, but then leads you by the hand down all the most obvious paths. By the time I reached the end, even as short as the game was, I already wanted to just stop playing and go look up a wiki or something in hopes that there might be some neat secrets I missed. As it turns out, no, there's just not much here.

review:
[i] "It's not a game about ponies." [/i] But you're gonna wish it was.

Don't let the "overwhelmingly positive" reviews trick you into buying this game.
It's an ugly-looking, frustrating and most importantly ungodly boring waste of time.
Some (even negative) reviews mention a good story, which has me pretty confused, a story? [spoiler] The guy being trapped in the game and then not, [/spoiler] that story?

author: {'steamid': '76561198373154245', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1593881452}
review: 自我解构做到极致就是自我革命，而这个无时无刻不在吐槽游戏流程自身，并唆使玩家篡改代码以破坏游戏程序的元游戏则进化成了“反游戏”。阻止游戏继续是它最大的游戏性，因此卸载游戏这一终极自杀被设定为玩家实现自救的唯一途径，收集全成就反而会陷入永无止境的地狱之中，这种根深蒂固的自毁倾向，即是游戏精神的黑暗本原。

author: {'steamid': '76561198053787480', 'num_games_owned': 739, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1596116294}
review:
Ох, столько положительных отзывов. Добавлю пожалуй ложку дёгтя. 
Эта мета-игра с чудесной задумкой и качественным художественным исполнением по моему мнению просто убивает на корню основную идею тем, что она практически полностью линейна. Ни сделать ни шага в сторону, как в том же the Stanley parable. А если и получается сделать, только для получения якобы запрятанной ачивки.  Автор как будто побоялся, что разнообразив своё детище хоть какими-то вариантами на подумать игроку, это отпугнёт множество казуальных геймеров. Будто это вообще сработало. Видимо да, судя по рейтингу.
А ну и сюжет слишком быстро выдаёт все карты. Ты уже заранее предполагаешь, что произойдёт в ближайшую минуту, и удивить остаётся только каким-то геймплейным разнобразностям. Пусть и линейным.
6/10. 1 раз не без толики удовольствия пройти и забыть.

review:
Soy incapaz de decir cosas de este juego primero porque es tan raro que me costaría mucho describirlo y segundo porque creo que arruinaría la experiencia al que lo lea. Es mejor ir sabiendo poco. 

Es un juego de... ¿puzzles y plataformas, supongo? Créeme, es raro, no te guíes por el título. Es un juego al que le gusta mucho romper convenciones y, por ejemplo, buena parte de su humor está en romper continuamente la cuarta pared de formas muy ingeniosas (y le salen muy bien).

author: {'steamid': '76561198142700003', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 710, 'last_played': 1595960222}
review:
[h1] [b] [i] "Ein Spiel mit dem Teufel höchstpersönlich, welches deine Aufmerksamkeit trainiert." [/i] [/b] [/h1]

Pony Island klingt im ersten Moment wie ein kunterbuntes Spiel, welches mit rosa Ponys und anderen lustigen Wesen daherkommt und man seinem Nachwuchs zum Geburtstag schenkt. Aber lasst euch vom Titel nur nicht täuschen, denn hinter der Fassade und dem fröhlichen Hauptmenü steckt ein sehr düsteres Spiel, für das ich nicht einmal wirklich die richtigen Worte finde.

Ein Spiel, bei dem Satan höchstpersönlich teilnimmt und das deine komplette Aufmerksamkeit fordert. Dazu gibt es neben einigen Secrets und den zahlreichen 'WTF'-Momenten auch interessante Rätsel mit gutem Konzept. Klingt spannend? Nun, das ist es auch. Aber worum handelt es sich bei Pony Island genau?

[h1] [b] Die Story des Spiels [/b] [/h1]
Pony Island geht in eine ähnliche Richtung wie das Spiel der sehr bekannten Creepypasta "The Theater", welche über ein Spiel aus der damaligen Zeit handelt, dass für Kinder gemacht war, aber durch Bugs und Fehler sehr grotesk und komisch geworden ist.

Hier ist es zwar nicht ganz so schlimm wie in der Creepypasta, aber dennoch ist Pony Island nicht das Spiel, was man zuerst erwartet. Denn im Spiel angekommen, finden wir uns in einer Arcade-Maschine wieder und stellen sehr schnell fest: Von der kindlichen Optik im Hauptmenü ist nichts mehr zu sehen und vor allem scheint hier etwas nicht zu stimmen.

Nach einiger Zeit bekommen wir durch einen neuen Freund im Spiel die Info, dass diese Arcade-Maschine vom Teufel persönlich verflucht und auch unsere Seele (wie die von vielen anderen) darin gefangen ist. Um dem Albtraum zu entfliehen, müssen wir die drei Kerndateien des Systems zerstören. Als Nebenaufgabe gilt es ebenfalls herauszufinden, wer wir eigentlich sind und woher wir kommen.

[h1] [b] Das Gameplay [/b] [/h1]
Pony Island ist an sich eigentlich ein sehr einfaches Spiel, in das man sofort reinkommt. Man braucht nur WASD, die Leertaste und die beiden Maustasten. Das Spiel selbst spielt die meiste Zeit als Sidescroller und die Steuerung funktioniert hier präzise und gut.

Neben dem Springen über Hindernisse begegnen uns ebenfalls sehr viele Rätsel, mit denen wir das Betriebssystem des Automaten austricksen, um Fortschritte zu erzielen und Sicherheitsvorkehrungen zu umgehen. Diese sind sehr gut gestaltet und haben oft dazu geführt, dass ich sehr lange sehr ausgiebig über eine Lösung nachdenken musste. Aber selbst dann kam ich immer auf den richtigen Lösungsweg.

Ich hatte den Punkt oben schon einmal kurz angeschnitten, möchte aber nochmals ausführlicher darauf eingehen. Pony Island ist ein Spiel, welches unfassbar viel Aufmerksamkeit und Geschicklichkeit von einem verlangt. Denn wir müssen nicht nur über Zäune springen, sondern dabei oft gleichzeitig noch Feinde bekämpfen und Bossen ausweichen. Und wem das in der Hauptstory nicht reicht, kann sein Geschick noch in den vielen versteckten Leveln und Eastereggs auf die Probe stellen, während man die insgesamt 24 im Spiel versteckten Tickets sammelt.

Was ich ebenfalls, an dieser Stelle loben möchte, ist der interaktive Bildschirm im Spiel. Das Öffnen und Ziehen von Fenstern fühlt sich einfach genauso an, als wenn ich es in Wirklichkeit auf meinem Desktop tun würde.

[h1] [b] Grafik und Aufmachung [/b] [/h1]
Ein grafisches Meisterwerk darf man bei Pony Island nicht erwarten. Das Spiel ist auf Basis der Unity-Engine aufgebaut und hat einen sehr guten und zum Thema passenden Artstyle. Der Arcade ist hier sehr authentisch dargestellt und sieht genauso aus, wie er soll: alt.

Man sieht am Bildschirmrand schon Spinnenweben, alles ist sehr pixelig dargestellt und auch das monotone Brummen im Hintergrund sorgte immer dafür, dass mich das Spiel direkt gefesselt hat. Als ob man wirklich vor dieser verfluchten und von Satan besessenen Maschine sitzen würde.

Die Performance ist dementsprechend auch sehr gut. Ich habe das Spiel auf meinem Hauptrechner und einem eher dünn ausgestatteten Notebook gespielt. Immer lief es mit 60 bzw. 144FPS. Pony Island läuft also auch auf schwächeren Maschinen problemlos.

[h1] [b] Mein Fazit [/b] [/h1]
Für wen ist Pony Island denn nun etwas? Ich kann das Spiel jedem Horror-Fan empfehlen, der mal was anderes sehen will. Etwas, dass es vielleicht nicht so häufig zu sehen gibt. Denn das Konzept und die allgemeine Aufmachung des Spiels hat mir sehr gut gefallen und ich wollte immer wissen, wie es weitergeht.

Ob ihr es euch für 3,99€ kaufen solltet? Nun, dass muss jeder für sich selber entscheiden. Ein normaler Durchlauf dauert ca. 90 bis 140 Minuten. Da ich manchmal zu kompliziert denke, habe ich daraus im ersten Durchlauf über 5 Stunden gemacht. Aber ich hatte in dieser Zeit immerhin eine Menge Spaß.

Am Ende des Tages ist Pony Island aber ein Spiel, welches ich euch bedenkenlos weiterempfehlen kann.

PS: Grüße gehen an dieser Stelle an die Person raus, die mir das Spiel zur Verfügung gestellt hat. Vielen Dank nochmal! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198343781727', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1663761933}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968652342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1586567825}
review:
Pony Island is what would happen if you combined My Little Pony with the Necronomicon, LSD, and an old glitchy Macintosh that was just hacked by a bunch of 4chan kids.

It's a series of games within a game that routinely plays with your expectations and where you have to think outside the box to progress forward. It's also delightfully creepy and weird. Play at your peril...

author: {'steamid': '76561198150695251', 'num_games_owned': 3161, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 98852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1661026812}
review:
A game, or well... is it? At least, something resembling a game, maybe you could better describe it as an experience. Either way the original plot of the game combined with the simply gameplay makes for a great game you can finish in one or two sittings depending on what you want. I liked it.

PS: Rest well my friend <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198375372162', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1594622143}
review: The game centers around three modes: (1) Side-scrolling action, (2) Node Puzzles and (3) Meta-fictional narrative and techniques. (1) and (2) repeat far too often, eventually becoming tedious as the difficulty ramps up. I was hoping the gameplay would be more varied. But I was motivated to finish the game, if only because of the effectiveness of (3). Overall, not a great game, though I was hooked.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040498159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1519538453}

author: {'steamid': '76561198981346833', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1684560351}
review: Pony Island to gra, którą nabyłem na promocji. Oglądałem kawałek odcinka u Czokleta i mi się bardzo spodobała. Gra ma bardzo rozbudowaną fabułę, łamigłówki dające trochę do myślenia oraz pełno secretów do odblokowania. Grę nie można zbytnio uznać za horrorową, ponieważ straszna nie jest (choć trzyma w lekkim napięciu). Przed rozpoczęciem pisania tej recenzji grę ukończyłem i koniec jest niespodziewany. Bardzo polecam tę grę innym, ponieważ moim zdaniem ta gra jest warta swojej ceny.

review: the atmosphere is eerie giving you a sense you really are inside the game. the start screen makes you think "oh, this is going to be a nice, fun game about a pony!" when really its about a haunted arcade game that steals the souls of children. SCARY! all of this, wraps up to be a scary, but fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198847915950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1663738811}

review: I'd recommend Hex over this. They have similar meta-narrative, but Hex has more gameplay and you'll never know what you'll be playing next. With Pony Island it's pony jumping and shooting lasers with twists. Still Pony Island is enjoyable if you can digest game with flashing lights and crackling sounds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045317719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1594424211}
review:
I generally don't make reviews of games but this one certanly deserve it. Having said that, I find it dificult to even aproach this. Pony island can be mostly be define by the following words: meta, unique and enganging the  former  especially so.
The game is about three hours long, and that can double if you try to complete it (you most likelly will), and the things that are tradionally selling points are here but are not the focus. The experience is. I know cringe as fuck but i know no other way of puting it. In sumary, i belive that most people that give it a chance will be plesantly surprised especially at the price at offer.
Give it a chance and go in blind. You’re in for a treat.

review:
**DON'T READ REVIEWS BEFORE YOU PLAY, SERIOUSLY NOT EVEN THIS ONE, TURN BACK**

This game is best experienced with as little knowledge as possible beforehand. It's delightfully weird and gets in your head a bit. I'm not going back for 100% achievements, and if you play it through, you'll understand why.

10/10, turns out the devil likes ponies.

review: Pode parecer um jogo simples (e visualmente seus gráficos pixelizados podem até enganar), mas Pony Island é um jogo inteligente, que consegue te prender e entreter até o último segundo de jogatina, mesmo que n~ao tenha grandes desafios, a interação do jogo com o jogador é divertida e compensa demais, vale muito a pena comprar!

author: {'steamid': '76561198308091619', 'num_games_owned': 559, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1603854365}
review:
bueno, para empezar la reseña comenzare diciendo que este no es un juego cualquiera, es uno que construye su ambientación de forma magistral, y en algunos casos rompe la cuarta pared, comenzare diciendo de que como bien muestran los trailers no es un juego de ponis, es un juego de un alma atrapada que lucha contra satanás adentro de un pc antiguo en forma de pony que dispara láseres de 1 y 0 para liberar cientos de almas, no me lo estoy inventando, es la historia del juego y te la explican nada más en la introducción, comenzare hablando de los distintos apartados que tiene el juego y que considero son importantes para saber cuándo comprar el juego o si vale la pena gastar dinero en el mismo 

referencias y amor por los videojuegos de antaño: primero que nada no soy viejo y apenas hace 5 o 6 años empecé a jugar, pero se nota que el juego tiene un amor por los videojuegos de antaño, con unos gráficos que simulan a las primeras pantallas donde el banco era imperfecto y se filtraban los colores, minijuegos y recursos jugables que se asemejan a algunos clásicos como space invaders, las aventuras de texto, e incluso Mario Bros, pero esto no le da mágicamente más calidad, solo lo hace más disfrutable para las personas que sepan apreciarlo 

mecánicas: las mecánicas son simples, al inicio se estropea el menú y nos piden arreglarlo usando un puzle básico y muy intuitivo, más adelante nos dan más herramientas pero en el inicio solo son unas 2 o 3 como mucho, y la otra mecánica son las carreras, estas apenas tienen evolución y nada más por meter mecánicas como tener que obtener unas ala para poder avanzar y todo eso mientras disparas, las mecánicas se van intercalando para que no sea siempre lo mismo y funciona, no parece repetitivo por más que la duración sea muy corta y eso influya en el resultado 

sonido: perdonen que lo diga así pero el sonido de este juego es nefasto, la música está bien y por el estilo que tiene parece de 16 bits, muy buena, pero los sonidos de volar disparar, saltar caer o lo que sea están tan bajos que apenas que te concentres mucho no escucharas nada y se reproduce a una calidad horrible 

dificultad: la dificultad de este juego es buena por momentos y en otro momento es decepcionante, durante la primera mitad del juego la dificultad logra aumentar de forma magistral, ni muy rápido ni muy lento, casi sin darte cuenta estas peleando en niveles el triple de grandes y con 4 veces más enemigos sin darte cuenta siquiera, y luego cuando llegan los combates contra los demonios es increíble, tienes que pensar a futuro para poder ganar, los puzles se convierten en una batalla de estrategia, no tan así como una partida de ajedrez pero tienes que saber que va a hacer la ia del juego para contrarrestarla y que juegue a tu favor y sobre todo la última donde tienes que estar atento al máximo para poder ganar, usando recursos como distracciones en forma de mensajes de steam falsos o ese tipo de cosas, muy bien pensado, pero llegamos a uno de los 3 jefes que tiene el juego y es decepcionante, pasamos de tener que pensar a futuro para poder ganar a memorizar los 3 movimientos del jefe y atacarlo mientras esquivas los movimientos repetidos hasta el infinito, lo mismo con el final y con el oculto, que el oculto usa los minijuegos descartados para traer variedad y termina siendo más de lo mismo, francamente decepcionante y hasta insultante si me pones serio, por el resto del juego y los minijefes es increíble, y el final no podría ser más vistoso 

historia: la historia está muy bien contada, dudo mucho que alguien pueda no entender las cosas, e incluso tiene una crítica escondida detrás de unos secretos que seguro van a encontrar si se dedican a buscar el 100% de los logros, el juego te lleva de la mano todo el tiempo pero no parece que fuese porque así lo quieren los desarrolladores, realmente logra su cometido de ponerte en el rol de un alma atrapada que quiere salir, y otra vez no todo es color de rosas, cuando tienes que hablar con alguien a través del chat de la computadora apenas reconoce cosas y la mayoría simplemente responde, no sé qué quieres decir, es algo a lo que hay que darle más trabajo y listo, al final del juego otra vez como no rompe la cuarta pared, instándote a borrar el juego porque así el que te acompaño durante el juego podrá salir del mismo y se libre, aprovechándose de las estadísticas de que la mayoría de jugadores de steam no borran sus juegos o no los juegan directamente, muy bien traído por parte de la desarrolladora, no hay mucho más que decir al respecto, también rompe la cuarta pared mencionar que tienes que hacer tal cosa porque si no al trama del juego o avanza, muy inesperado eso y que gracia que me dio  

secretos, los secretos de este juego son algo muy raro de explicar, hay muchos que son obvios y repetitivos hasta el punto donde se repiten más de 7 veces los mismos secretos en distintos contextos, pero por otro lado son algo bastante bueno, incluyendo un secreto donde te explican donde moriste, quien te mato, como llegaste hasta ahí y esas cosas acompañado de visiones que dejan entrever una vaga critica a cierto periodo de la historia, también al final tienes el jefe oculto [spoiler]cuando completas todos los logros y tu amigo decide darte un buen jefe final...[/spoiler] que como ya expliqué resulta ser una completa decepción, pero está bien traído y se siente bien dentro de lo que cabe y otras cosas más humorísticas o de referencias a algunas cosas 

methajuego: realmente desaprovechado todo eso, no digo que sea malo, pero realmente hay juegos como doki doki literature club que logran jugar hasta con los archivos físicos del juego siendo free to play, y otros como undertale que ofrecen algo más de horas, historia y mecánicas interesantes además de recordar como jugaste antes y recordártelo, dando puñaladas si lo mereces, este juego solo tiene una buena ambientación y poco más, que no quita que sea entretenido y un buen juego, pero tenía mucho más potencial 

duración del juego: personalmente me parece ridículo hablar de horas de juego con esta clase de videojuegos que tratan más que de dar una gran cantidad de horas de dar una experiencia única que juega con los conceptos de lo que sería un videojuego, ya hay otros juegos que intentan cosas similares y no ofrecen muchas horas salvo contadas excepciones, sigue siendo una buena forma de entretenerse pero diría que por el precio que tiene no merece la pena, aunque si cuando está en oferta, no es perfecto pero sigue siendo una buena experiencia en general, y por favor si no son de los que quieren juegos que duren muchas horas aléjense de este juego, con todos los logros y haciendo algunas cosas más así que seguramente pueda sacarlos en menos tiempo me duro solo 4.8 horas en total, en una tarde se lo terminan al 100%, el contenido que tiene no merece la pena por el precio completo ni menos cuando estás buscando obras que duren mucho, además tampoco incita a la rejugabilidad, su fuerte no está en las horas, está en las mecánicas innovadoras, y como todo luego de que te cuentan 2 veces el mismo chiste ya no hace gracia, es una buena obra para jugar una única vez, la rejugabilidad es inexistente

author: {'steamid': '76561198992070208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1594075249}
review: It's offbeat and unusual, but frequently repetitive and seemingly pointless. I gave it a go, and then decided I had better things to do with my time. You might love it, or you might think it's a waste of time. I'd expect opinions to be polarised. There appears to be no skill involved, only perseverance. There's a storyline of sorts, but my inability to avoid being forced to do things that were (seemingly) pointless made me indifferent to it. (I could "escape" by just exiting the game. Job done.) And, while the graphics are *supposed* to look primitive, it's hardly easy on the eye (at 2560x1440). I found myself losing interest, and either letting the pony get killed, or waiting to see whether the game was coded to expect fruitless activity for a certain period before moving on. Having discovered that you need to look for coloured pixels/text to interact with, leading to simple (or impossible) mini-games, it got marginally better. But making progress is so painful that since I'm not masochistic, I wasn't impressed. In its defence, maybe I should have persevered a bit longer than I did (~45 minutes). But the game didn't give me much cause to think it might get any better, and I'm not prepared to take the risk that it won't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198437901107', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1711398719}
review:
Primeiramente, eu tenho que agradecer uma pessoa mt foda e pika por ter me apresentado esse jogo que foi o RERRYSON (Não sei se é assim q escreve o nome dele) ou Dash Fant Games pros mais intimos.
Esse jogo é um dos jogos 2D de Puzzle mais fodas do mundo.
A hístoria é mt interessante, o estilo do jogo me da muita vontade de rejogar dnv e dnv e dnv.
(E é isso q eu eu vou fazer em breve, ou daqui a pouco)
Não sei como o criador desse jogo teve coragem de publicar isso aqui, esse jogo tinha q estar em todas as plataformas do mundo: PS4, PS5, XBOX SERIES X, XBOX ONE, PS2, PS1, GAMEBOY.
Porque serio, é um dos jogos que está na minha coleção de favoritos.
A soundtrack é feita com muito carinho pq é viciante de escutar (Sem contar q algumas partes da Soundtrack são em Mono e outras em STEREO, oq é mt legal, dá uma sensação 8D pro bagulho)
O estilo plataforma de mostrar os seus dois lados desse jogo é mt FODA.
Uma ideia genial, jogada de mestre.
O jeito q o jogo te engana e interage com vc é incrivel.
Eu só espero que mesmo em 2022 (o ano agora), as pessoas possam jogar ainda, mesmo sendo um jogo antigo.

review: 作为一款童趣游戏，该作品画风诙谐幽默亲近小盆宇们，操作简单，极易上手，各位大朋友也可以当作日常休闲娱乐游戏，找找童年时的快乐。游戏中控制可爱小独角兽送小蝴蝶回家[spoiler]吹走迷路的蝴蝶[/spoiler]越过一道道栅栏，期间还有[strike]kamisama[/strike]为你送来指路的启明星，实在是休闲娱乐之佳选。[spoiler]😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈😈[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198340239220', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1593273287}
review:
The game play and the story of this game are balanced between the puzzles and "Jump and shoot", It doesn't take too much time yet it's not too short as well. 
This game is very good on being the game that breaking the 4th wall. If you like to see unexpected event and surprises, this game is an answer to you. 
Although this game can be played to the end in a few hours, but what surprised me was the creativity they put into the game. It really shows the intention of the team that made this game.

9/10 very good game (-1 score. There are too few types of monsters.)

Anyway don't kill Jesus and of course, don't give your soul to Satan.

Thank you

author: {'steamid': '76561198139237807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1593256539}
review:
this is a game best played completely spoiler free! i'll get into some vague details below but if you're looking to see if it's worth buying then i'd definitely say yes, even at full price, but with one caveat.

on my first playthrough, i was wowed by the presentation. the music and visuals really brought the story to life and set it apart from other games that use similar concepts. as a completionist, i knew i would eventually re-install this and go through to find all of the secrets it had to offer. and this is where i'd say not to follow in my footsteps. repeating puzzles was tedious and genuinely frustrating (most likely because i had beaten the game before and just wanted to collect my tickets and leave). i swore to myself that as soon as i collected the last ticket, i would exit the game and be done.[spoiler] i didn't know about the secret ending, and i would actually say it was worth it, despite what i endured to get there. it was satisfying in the most unsatisfying way, challenging the idea of completionism and calling me out pretty hard in a way i liked.[/spoiler]but despite my own satisfaction at the end of it all, i just can't recommend taking on the challenge of some of the harder tickets and puzzles.

i'll say again that this really is a game worth playing if you're at all interested in it. and if you still want to 100% this game regardless of what i've said, do what i did and use a guide ([spoiler]and be ready to spare the life of jesus[/spoiler]).

author: {'steamid': '76561198124675205', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1596729130}
review:
O jogo é muito bem feito, bem melhor do que eu achei que seria inicialmente. Tem uma historinha que te prende e é bem gostosinho de progredir.

Enquanto você progride no jogo, vão aparecendo mecânicas novas o tempo todo e sempre acontece algo bacana que te surpreende, te faz pensar que os desenvolvedores realmente adicionaram detalhes que não precisavam. Dá pra ver que o jogo foi feito com muito carinho.

A única coisa que estragou um pouquinho minha experiência foi na sessão de Text Adventure, se você passar por essa parte, às vezes digitar "PULA" não funciona, é preciso digitar "PULAR". Fora isso, o game é um espetáculo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008563010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1593204480}
review:
I dunno, I kinda like what they're going for in this game, and it's maybe worth a few bucks just to see what it is if you're curious, but I think it's pretty full of itself in a way that I didn't care for. I mean the game literally begs you to uninstall it at the end. I think I see what narrative it's trying to portray, but it's a little obnoxious about it, and the gameplay has some really annoying moments, so that hinders it a bit more.

I'd say pass unless you're morbidly curious and/or money is not a concern.

review:
Es ist echt unglaublich, wie viele skurril-kreative Ideen in diesem Spiel stecken. Einfach ein großartiges Erlebnis, zu dem man nicht allzu viele Worte verlieren sollte. Am besten geht man ohne großartiges Vorwissen an das ganze ran. 
Absolute Kaufempfehlung! (vor allem für ein-zwei Euro im Sale ein Muss; dauert ja auch nur rund Zwei Stunden.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198294412574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1593145355}
review:
Eh. On a fun scale I'd say 3/10. The concept is okay albeit unoriginal. The execution could have been a lot more exciting -- a good deal of the game is actually you jumping over fences with some little puzzles mixed in. There are some promising moments of creativity, however they pass by pretty quickly before they can leave a great impression, then you're back to jumping over fences. It seems the dev wanted to do something creative while keeping gameplay simple, sadly it's often way too simple.

I got it on sale and I definitely wouldn't consider it a waste of money, especially to support an indie developer. I was just hoping to like the game more. If it seems interesting to you, give it a shot. It's cheap whether on sale or not.

review:
This is one of the most unique games I've played in a while.
The less you know about this game, the better.
It's not the longest game out there with me being able to complete it in under two hours, but it's 100% worth the 4 or so dollar price tag. It's especially worth buying if it's on sale like I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028362980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1672354335}
review:
this game is soooo repetitive and boring. forced myself to play it to the end, the amount of reskinned enemies to pad out the game is just laughable. you literally do the same thing for the whole 2 hours or so. jump, click enemies, with a few terrible puzzles thrown in here and there.

without spoiling anything, the 3rd 'boss' really caught me off guard and i found him really interesting,i wish the game was more about playing with the player. it would've made it so much more intriguing rather than a mindless jump and click. skip this game, its not worth your time.

3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198837947230', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1592918994}
review:
I'm really trying to enjoy this game, but it's just too difficult. Not difficult in the sense that you just need to think a little outside the box. But difficult as in keep grinding away mindlessly until you stumble across the solution. It feels like it's designed to piss you off. Maybe this is intentional. But there's no satisfaction when you "solve" something. 

I'm stuck on the last lock of the first core, and can't pass it, because the ai just randomly decides to put the pieces wherever it wants even when it's not it's turn to move. Tried following a walkthrough and that still doesn't help. It's basically a big trial and error fest. I seriously can't figure out what I'm doing wrong. Following a video guide on you tube and I still can't get past it. Because the ai randomly gets multiple moves and I randomly lose moves. And like every other puzzle in this game, I'll probably just grind at it until it works. 

Still going to finish it (somehow) and get the achievements, but I hate this game. 

On another note, the graphics and music and presentation are all good. If the game gets better after this stupid puzzle, I might come back and edit my review. But no telling when that's going to happen.
